loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, electric cables, breaker box, sand, and gravel in order to install electricity and cement the floor of her home.

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en:
Vevencia hails from the town of Dauis, Bohol. She is very busy in her food vending business. She sells banana cue (deep fried banana with caramelized sugar) to the locals in the community where she lives.

She is married with seven grown children. Her husband is a fisherman and a carpenter. Vevencia is 57 years old. She is in need of capital to support her daily source of income.

She has decided to take a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to buy supplies like bananas, sugar and edible oil. With these, she could continue to provide snack food and improve her daily earnings. In the long run, she could roll-out her capital and be able to settle her finances.

She would like to improve her current source of income to become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy supplies like bananas, sugar and edible oil.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell  for her fish vending business.

Maria has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from raising livestock.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Desiree

texts.en:
Desiree is 37 years old and married with one child.

Desiree works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Desiree has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Desiree aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en:
Perpetua is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Perpetua is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

Perpetua has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is the age of 44, living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her son newly set up a mobile shop nearby his home. He offers types of mobiles and accessories and provides a recharge facility. He has attained a list of customers in a few days. 

Nowadays, he is facing problem due to lack of availability of funds because he wants to increase the mobile accessories which is very famous and costly nowadays. He just begins this business and does not have further cash in hand to purchased desired inventories.

This is the reason Rani contacted Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan and requested a loan for her son. With the help of loan, he can easily purchase mobile accessories and extra recharge of various networks. In this way; he can easily attract more customers and can generate more income to cherish his family.

Rani would be very thankful to such lenders who take an active part in loan raising.

loans.use: to buy mobile accessories and extra recharge of various networks for her son's mobile shop.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 50 years old. She is a responsible mother and lives happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son owns a scrap shop and deals with the scrap such as iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, waste paper, etc. He has been running his business for many years. Nowadays due to household expenses, he does not have an amount to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell to get money.

Therefore, Parveen requested a loan for her son, so that he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents.

She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy recycle goods and waste papers for her son's scrap goods shop.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is 54 years old married man from the Ozurgeti district. He lives with his wife, son and daughter-in-law. The family has no source of income and they live in poverty.

Davit decided to start a taxi business in order to generate income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 400 USD. With the received credit he will purchase a second-hand car and will serve locals as a taxi driver to generate income. Davit will be able to improve the living conditions of his family and awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin a taxi business in order to generate income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, gravel, sand, and pay for labor to cement over the floor of her house.

loans.name: Manuelita

texts.en:
Manuelita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her raising pigs.

Manuelita dreams that one day  she will be able to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to buy aditional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Asifa

texts.en:
Asifa is 31-years old woman. She lives with her spouse, four sons and a daughter in Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a turner by profession and manufactures spare parts of vehicle. He has been operating a lathe machine for many years and can easily refurbish or manufacture the spare parts for various vehicles. His lathe machine is out of order and some tools are worn out due to continuous use and are in need of replacement. He has spent his savings to buy cast iron for manufacturing spare parts and does not have money to fix the lathe machine.

Therefore, Asifa requested a loan for her husband so that he could fix the lathe machine. She is relieved now that her husband will be able to operate his lathe machine again. She is very thankful to the Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to fix the lathe machine so her husband can operate it easily and can generate income for his family.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf, a housewife, is need of a loan for her husband so that he can refurbish and expand his restaurant. 

They are blessed with three children, and she aims at getting them education with the funds generated from this restaurant.

The items required include furniture, including tables and chairs, and groceries which can be further divided into vegetables and meat, plus a new gas cylinder.

Hence, this loan is pivotal for Ashraf as it would help her enhance her husband's earnings with the expansion of his restaurant, simultaneously fulfilling her aim of getting a quality education for her child.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, groceries, vegetables, meat, and a gas cylinder for her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Xochilt Group

texts.es: Grupo Xochitl está conformado por tres mujeres con muchos deseos de superación, es coordinado por Xochilt una joven laboriosa de 23 años de edad, casada y madre de un niño de tres años, ella se dedica a la venta de alitas picantes desde hace tres años, trabaja con el apoyo de su marido quien también prepara los alimentos, solicita por primera vez el financiamiento en la institución para la compra de pollo, salsa, empastadores, aceite y papas, y de esta manera desarrollar su negocio, debido a que una de sus metas es comprar sillas y mesas para atender mejor a sus clientes. La segunda socia es María de 27 años propietaria de una pulpería y Brenda de 41 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa usada.
texts.en:
Grupo Xochitl is made up of three women who are very motivated to succeed. Its coordinator is Xochitl, a hardworking 23-year-old woman who is married and has a three-year-old child. For three years, she has been working selling hot wings. She works with the support of her husband, who also prepares the food.

She is applying for her first loan with the institution in order to buy chicken, sauce, batter, oil, and potatoes. She wants to develop her business, since one of her goals is to buy tables and chairs to better serve her customers.

The second member is María, 27, who owns a small grocery store. Brenda, 41, sells used clothing.

loans.use: to buy chicken, sauce, batter, oil, and potatoes.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en: Scovia is aged 27 years and married. She has two children and is requesting a loan to buy cocoa seeds to dry and sell to get income. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She trades in cocoa, mainly buying and selling to agents and cocoa companies. She started the business to raise income for the family and pay school fees for the children. Her main challenges are a lack of funds to buy enough cocoa during the peak season and the fact that there is a lot of competition since this is the major economic activity in her area. Through her hard work, Scovia sees herself as a leading cocoa trader in her area.

loans.use: to buy cocoa seeds to dry and sell to get income.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy farm inputs to enable her to increase production. Her business goal is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years.

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: El Madroño Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario el madroño está integrando por 3 mujeres quienes día a día, trabajan fuertemente para sacar adelantes a sus familias, sintiéndose orgullosas de poder tener sus propios negocios y obtener ingresos económicos para prosperar en la vida. El grupo lo coordina Julia de 41 años, soltera y madre de un hijo de diecinueve años, ella se dedica a la venta de tortilla desde hace once años y solicita por  quinceavo ciclo el financiamiento en la institución para la compra de maíz, leña, cal. Uno de sus logros con los créditos anteriores fue ampliar  su casa, por otro lado su nueva meta es vender ropa. La segunda socia es Ivania de 40 años de edad, propietaria de una pulpería y la tercer socia es doña Mayra  de 53 años propietaria de una pulpería.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "El Madroño" is made up of 3 women who work hard day to day to get their families ahead. They feel proud of being able to own their own businesses and get economic earnings to prosper in life.

Julia coordinates the group. She is 41 years old, single, and the mother of a 19-year-old child. She has earned a living selling tortillas for 11 years and she is requesting her 15th loan cycle from the institution for purchasing corn, firewood, and lime. One of her successes from her previous loans was expanding her house. What's more, her new goal is to sell clothing.

The second member is 40-year-old Ivania, who is the owner of a grocery store. The third member is 53-year-old Mayra, who is the owner of a grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, and lime.

loans.name: Nonxay Group

texts.en: Bounta’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Bounta and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits. Bounta and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within these 2 years filter users, like Bounta’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Guerlyne

texts.fr: Guerlyne, 36 ans, est mariée. Elle a un enfant. Elle vend des produits cosmétiques et des sandales. Elle a dix ans dans cette activité. Après plusieurs microcrédits que lui a octroyés Palmis, elle est parvenue à améliorer son commerce. Elle a besoin d’un nouveau crédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Guerlyne is 36 years old and married. She has one child.

She sells cosmetics and sandals. She has been in the business for ten years.

After several micro-loans granted by Palmis, she has managed to improve her business. She needs a new loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: buy sandals.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Jeanne a 35 ans, elle est mariée et elle a trois enfants. Elle gère une petite épicerie à domicile où elle vend des produits alimentaires et des produits cosmétiques. Elle a beaucoup de clients et elle demande un microcrédit pour acheter de la marchandise.
texts.en:
Jeanne is 35 years old. She is married and has three children.

Jeanne runs a small grocery store from her home. She sells food and hygiene products. She has many customers.

She is requesting a micro-loan to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: buy tubes of toothpaste and personal soaps.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a Lebanese widowed woman, living alone in North Lebanon. She is 58 years old and owns a retail shop next to her house in which she sells all kinds of accessories, bridal gadgets and gifts. She established her business six years ago as a way to become financially independent. Her son also owns a small bakery in the area, which allows him to support his mother with some expenses when needed.

For the first time, Sanaa is asking for a 1,543,658 Lebanese Pounds loan from Kiva's partner Ibdaa. She is hoping to use the loan to buy a new accessories collection before the Eid. Since opening her shop, she has earned a very good reputation among her clients by being friendly and welcoming.

loans.use: to buy accessories for her shop

loans.name: Olène

texts.fr: Olène, 45 ans, vit en union libre. Elle est mère de cinq enfants. Elle revend des produits alimentaires. Cette activité lui permet de gagner des revenus pour prendre soin de sa famille. Pour éviter des ruptures des stock, elle a recours au microcrédit.
texts.en:
Olène is 45 years old. She lives with her partner. She is a mother of five.

She retails food products. This business allows her to ear revenues with which to take care of her family.

She is turning to micro-lending to avoid out-of-stock situations.

loans.use: buy bags of rice.

loans.name: Kerline

texts.fr: Kerline a 30 ans. Elle est mariée et a un enfant. Elle est propriétaire d’une boutique de revente de produits cosmétiques. Elle y vend des lotions de beauté, des savons, des déodorants, des parfums, etc. Elle cherche à développer l’activité. C’est pourquoi elle demande un prêt pour pouvoir augmenter son stock de produits.
texts.en:
Kerline is 30 years old. She is married and has one child.

She is the owner of a cosmetics store, in which she retails beauty lotions, soaps, deodorants, perfumes, etc. She is attempting to grow her business.

This is why she is requesting a loan to increase her merchandise stock.

loans.use: buy perfumes and individual soaps.

loans.name: Marie Maniella

texts.fr: Maniella est âgée de 58 ans. Divorcée, elle vit seule avec ses deux enfants. Elle vend des produits alimentaires dans une petite boutique à son domicile. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Maniella is fifty-eight years old. She is divorced and lives alone with her two children.

She retails groceries from a small store in her home.

She is requesting a loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy boxes of tomato paste and bags of beans.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es:
La Señora Cynthia tiene 37 años, tiene un hijo, por quien ella lucha para poder darle una vida digna y sin privaciones, ella tiene montada una peluquería en su casa, donde también vender articuos de mercería, tiene ya una clientela bien formada ya que hace mas de 4 años realiza esta actividad.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, comenta que su marido también trabaja y de esa manera se ayudan para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Pide el préstamo para la compra de Medias, Ropas Interiores, Calzas, Zapatillas, Cremas etc., para poder vender en su mercería. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Cynthia is 37 years old. She has one son, and she struggles to give him a decent life without deprivation. She has a beauty salon set up in her home, where she also sells clothing and beauty supplies. She has a well-established customer base, since she has been doing this for four years.

She is a very hard-working woman. She remarks that her husband also works, and this way they help each other to be able to improve their living conditions.

She is requesting the loan to buy socks, underwear, leggings, slippers, creams, etc. to sell in her shop. She is grateful for this opportunity she is being given to be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy socks, underwear, leggings, slippers, creams etc.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 45-year-old married woman living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store for many years and generating income for his family. He sells general store items such as flour, sugar, milk packs, eggs, rice, and cookies among other retailers. He is a business-minded man. Nowadays demand for more quality products has increased but due to the unavailability of demanded items he has to refuse his valued customers. He does not have enough savings for further investment into the business. In fact his major generated income has been spent on household expenses and the family’s miscellaneous expenses.

Therefore Musarat requested a loan for her husband's general store to enable the buying of demanded items. She hopes that now her husband can grow this business and can generate more income as per his family's needs.

Musarat thanks Kiva and the field partner for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy general store inventory for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Mungo

texts.en:
Mungo is the age of 59, living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a weaver and knots blankets at home. For knotting blankets wool is used. There is no better kind of blankets than blankets made by hand; though this is far from implying that all hand-tufted blankets are superior to all machine-made ones.

Her husband is very expert and knots very fine blankets. This is a very slow and time consuming procedure; he knots blankets over nights. This is the reason her husband sells them at a high price but the problem is the customers do not agree upon the demanded cost. The demand for fine blankets has been increasing time to time.

Her husband wants to buy more raw materials for knotting blankets but he does not have enough savings to make this purchase possible. Therefore, Mungo requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy wool for knotting blankets and it could become the cause of an increase in income.

loans.use: to buy wool for knotting blankets for her husband's blanket selling business.

loans.name: Puni

texts.en:
Puni is a 27-year-old woman married to a farmer in a small village of Singijani in Falakata, West Bengal, India. The couple has two children (one son and daughter). Being a housewife, Puni takes care of the entire household.

In order to help with all the family expenses, Puni's husband has been involved in doing paddy cultivation and selling it to the distributors for the past four years. He has a sound experience in this field, and paddy cultivation is now his main source of income.

Through this business, he earns monthly a small income, and it is very difficult for him to maintain his family. After that, to get sufficient surplus and to reinvest in the business is practically impossible for him. He supplies his paddy rice to the rice dealers in the nearby market. In order to strengthen the business and respond to client demand, Puni and her husband want to grow paddy in larger quantities.

So Puni is requesting a loan from Kiva through BJS for purchasing more paddy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds, and to cover the operational costs of paddy cultivation in bulk. Their goal is to increase their business activity.

Puni hopes that this loan will help her family alleviate their financial crisis and provide a better education to her children. She dreams to buy a plot of land in the future.

Puni is very much grateful to her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Mamata

texts.en:
Mamata is a 28-year-old, young, rural woman. She hails from Parangerpar village in Falakata, Alipurduar district in West Bengal. She is married and lives with her family in the village.

A mother of two daughters, Mamata attended school up to grade 9 and could not complete her secondary education due to her family's financial crisis. Her daughters are very young; one has started attending school and the other is a preschooler.

Being a housewife, Mamata's priority duty is to look after her children and manage her household jobs. Besides that, she helps her husband in his agricultural activities. Her husband has been a vegetable grower for the last three years. He grows different seasonal vegetables on his own farmland, so agriculture is the main source of income for them.

Due to insufficient business capital, they are unable to invest more in their agribusiness. Being their only source of income, they want their agricultural production to be abundant. Now they have been planning to start cauliflower cultivation in the coming winter season.

For this reason, Mamata is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to buy manure, raw materials and good seeds of cauliflower. She hopes to earn good profit from this cultivation because of the huge demand for this vegetable and their prior experience in the agribusiness.

She hopes to raise the standard of living of her family with the additional income and fulfill her long-cherished dream of buying more agricultural land.

She will be ever grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for cauliflower cultivation.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is a 52-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are in school.

Fely is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Fely has been in this business for two years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Fely would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Maa Maulishg-C Group

texts.en:
Balamati, 32 years old, is standing to the extreme left in the photograph. She is living in a community of Titlagarh, India. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland that is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 10 years.

Balamati wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration.

Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind to the group members and their families. It will also mean that they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. So, together, they seek a loan of 45,000 INR to build a toilet at home.

As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses. Your loan will provide all three families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: to build a toilet at home.

loans.name: Greziel

texts.en:
For almost 13 years now, Greziel has run a sari-sari (variety) store, selling commodities such as sugar, eggs, biscuits, candies, fruit juice, canned goods, condiments, beverages and toiletries. She is a 43-year-old married woman with four children, aged between eighteen and seven. Her husband also has an income that helps to provide for the family's daily expenses.

Graziel is eager and determined to develop ways to manage her daily earnings. She has decided to buy stock for her store, such as rice, soft drinks, liquor and assorted goods. These are essential to improve her livelihood. With the additional capital, she will be able to display a variety of stock and attract more customers.

Greziel is hoping that her store's income will be sustainable and productive to support her children's needs

loans.use: to buy stock for her store, such as rice, soft drinks and liquor.

loans.name: Pataneswasi Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Ranjita, 28 years old, is standing in the middle of the photograph. She is living in a community of Titlagarh, Odisha. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a poultry business on a small piece of land that is located near her house. On average, she is able to make an income of 300 INR a day.

Ranjita wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration.

Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for all the group members and their families. It will also mean that they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. So, together, they seek a loan of INR 45,000 to build a toilet at home.

As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses. Your loan will provide all three families access with improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: to build a toilet at home

loans.name: Shobharani

texts.en:
Fifty-five-year-old Shobharani is an enterprising lady and mother of a daughter who has married now. Her husband is jobless now due to being overage. Shobharani is illiterate but can sign her name only.

She lives in a small village in Kandi of West Bengal.

Shobharani runs a puffed rice business to earn their livelihood. Locally, puffed rice is called "muri." Puffed rice is a type of puffed grain made from rice, commonly used in breakfast cereal or as snack foods, and served as a popular street food in India. It is usually made by heating rice kernels in a sand-filled oven.

Puffed rice is very much popular in rural areas. Shobharani makes puffed rice in her home and supplies them in her neighborhood. She has been running this business since 15 years ago, so gradually, she has obtained a good number of customers.

Now she wants to expand her business by serving more customers, which will also increase her income. But the problem she is facing is inadequate capital to invest in her business. Thus, she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy good quality rice and sand in bulk at a wholesale rate.

Now she hopes she can satisfy her customers’ demand on time by selling puffed rice in a huge quantity, which will generate better profit and enable her to expand her business.

Shobharani is grateful towards her lenders.

loans.use: to buy good quality rice, sand and necessary materials for her puffed rice business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with five children who describes herself as trustworthy. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows, poultry and goats. She has been involved in this business for three years.

Grace's business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES)loan to buy farm supplies to enable her to increase production. Her business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Sofia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Sofia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a married woman with three children who is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and has three children who are in school.

Marcelina has a fishing business in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Marcelina has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Majina

texts.en:
Majina is a rural, hardworking woman of only 27 years. She is married to Chhamiul, a 45-year-old farmer. They live in Uttar Altagram, a small village in Dhupguri, Jalpaiguri district, West Bengal, India. They are blessed with four children (three daughters and one son). Among them, her son is eldest and working as a daily laborer; her two daughters are studying in school; and the youngest daughter is a preschooler.

Majina’s husband is a very hardworking farmer. He cultivates on his own farmland. He mainly grows paddy rice. He thinks his business goes well because he has a lot of knowledge about its production and always offers quality products. He supplies his paddy and rice to the rice dealers in the nearby market.

In order to strengthen the business and respond to client demand, Majina is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to invest in the business. She will purchase more good-quality fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds for cultivating paddy on a large scale and to cover the operational costs.

With this investment, at the end of the harvest, they will be able to have a better production to sell, and with the earnings, Majina will be able to improve her family’s quality of life.

Majina is very thankful for Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs for growing paddy.

loans.name: Pataneswasi Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Kunti is a woman with great ideas and a creative mind, and she is a very ambitious woman standing to the extreme right in the photograph. She has a willpower that led her to be a productive woman in her community.

Kunti wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration.

So Kunti, along with her fellow group members, is seeking a loan of 45,000 INR to build a toilet at home.

As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses. Your loan will provide all three families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Maa Bastren Shg-A Group

texts.en:
The sanitation crisis in India is a result of poor infrastructure and lack of education. Debaki belongs to the locality of Titlagarh in rural Odisha. She is a 40-year-old lady who works as a daily wage laborer in the agricultural sector. She has five members in her family, including three children.

Her monthly savings are only 1,150 INR, and the monthly medical expense is around INR 800. She has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves.

Debaki, along with her fellow group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR to build a toilet in their homes.

As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses. Your loan will provide all three families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: to build a toilet

loans.name: Maa Bastren Shg-B Group

texts.en:
The sanitation crisis in India is a result of poor infrastructure and lack of education. This group of three, led by Ramani and living in Titlagarh, in the state of Odisha, has understood the importance of having a toilet at home.

Ramani is 31 years old and standing to the extreme right in the photograph. She has a family size of three. Her family does not have the means to build a toilet at home. With no access to a toilet, they have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private, in dense bushes or isolated fields. The women and girls, seeking privacy, often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves. The families, especially the women and daughters, are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

Seeking to improve their situation, the group members seek a loan of 45,000 INR to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help their families access basic sanitation and improved health and safety.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Maa Bastren Shg-C Group

texts.en:
The sanitation crisis in India is a result of poor infrastructure and lack of education. This group of three, led by Rukuni and living in Titlagarh, in the state of Odisha, has understood the importance of having a toilet at home.

Rukuni is 33 years old, standing to the extreme right in the photograph, and has a family size of four. Her family does not have the means to build a toilet at home. With no access to a toilet, they have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private, in dense bushes or isolated fields. The women and girls, seeking privacy, often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves. The family, especially the women and daughters, are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

Seeking to improve their situation, the group members seek a loan of 45,000 INR to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help their families access basic sanitation and improve their health and safety.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Jai Krishna Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Janaki, 30, is an industrious and enterprising lady from an interior village of Titlagarh, Odisha, India. She is the one standing to the extreme left in the photograph.

She is a daily wage laborer and has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family, and therefore, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR to build a hygienic toilet in her home.

Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for her and her family. As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses. Your loan will provide all three families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

Janaki and her group members are in dire need of your kind help and support.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet.

loans.name: Jai Krishna Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Rita, 32 years old, is living in a community of Titlagarh, India. The lady standing to the extreme right is Rita. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a grocery shop in her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around five years. On average, she is able to make an income of 400 INR a day.

Rita wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration.

Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for Rita, Ahalya and Jamuna and their families. It will also mean that they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. So, together, they seek a loan of 45,000 INR to build a toilet at home.

As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses. Your loan will provide all three families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: to build a toilet

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama is from the small village of Dhupguri in the Jalpaiguri district. Her family consists of her husband and her two sons. She is a 29-year-old housewife who studied up to grade 9. Her husband, 31-year-old Sudeb, is involved in farming work. This is an important source of income for them.

The low income is not enough to meet the basic needs of their family. They grow vegetables and sell the produce in the local market. Thus, they can somehow manage household expenses.

As the daily commodities get more expensive day by day, Rama and her husband want to grow their income. They want to cultivate eggplant, which is a popular vegetable and has a great demand in their locality. They now need to purchase seeds and fertilizer for eggplant cultivation, but they lack the capital.

So Rama is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She will purchase good quality seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and other necessary farm resources for eggplant for running their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the household expenses. She wants to give her best to have a successful and profitable business with which they can upgrade their living standard.

Rama is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for eggplant cultivation.

loans.name: Jai Krishna Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Santi is a woman of courage and strength. She is the one standing in the middle of the photograph. She hails from a small village of Titlagarh, Odisha, India.

Santi and her family do not have a toilet in their home. They have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private, in dense bushes or isolated fields. They often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves in private. She and her family are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

Therefore, Santi, along with her fellow group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR to build a clean and hygienic toilet at her home. Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for these families. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick.

These members are eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to build a clean and hygienic toilet

loans.name: Phova Group

texts.en:
Somkhid understands the difference a water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. She knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and that boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Somkhid purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent on buying charcoal and decreasing the time and financial costs of foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to buy bottled water if it is available.

Somkhid is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and is guaranteed for two years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to buy TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Mycil

texts.en:
Mycil is 33 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Mycil works very hard to provide for them.

Mycil runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Mycil would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en:
Vevencia is 58 years old and married with six children. One of her children is in school. Vevencia works very hard to provide for her family.

Vevencia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, home-care products, and other groceries. Vevencia has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. In the future, Vevencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, home-care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is 54 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Visitacion works very hard to provide for her family.

Visitacion runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, home-care products, and other groceries. Visitacion has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Visitacion would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, home-care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 48 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Her son is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his rickshaw.

Nasreen's son's rickshaw is always in bad condition. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now the rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Nasreen contacted Kiva’s Field Partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her son can repair his rickshaw. He wants to maintain the engine’s piston, one wheel and pay the labor costs for it. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers.

Nasreen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business. Nasreen thanks Kiva and Field Partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain the engine piston and wheel on her son's rickshaw, and to pay the labor costs for it.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada, a 45-year-old Lebanese woman, is single and lives alone in Beirut. She has been a tailor for more than 25 years but established her own business 11 years ago.

Ghada finished her studies in a technical institute before starting to work in the sewing industry. She is a talented woman; she loves her job and has a very good reputation among her clients and suppliers. She is the kind of women who is committed to her work and doing the best that she can in order to develop it.

For the first time, Ghada is asking for a loan of 2,571,003 Lebanese pounds from Kiva partner Ibdaa in order to buy a new sewing machine and some textile supplies. With a more modern machine, she will be able to take more orders, serve more clients and increase her income. Ghada will improve her work by getting this loan and will be providing herself with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and some textile supplies

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Watfa is a 24-year-old Lebanese married woman. She has only one child attending school. Her husband is the main income provider in the family. He works as a taxi driver.

At this time, Watfa is in real need of a little help from Kiva. For that reason, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., to pay her child's educational fees to register him in the coming school year. She said that she is happy that she will be able to provide for her child's education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her child's educational fees to register him in the coming school year.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 61 years old and has three children. She is married woman now.

Narcisa is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Narcisa has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

Josephine successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Josephine's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Ngina

texts.en:
Ngina is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a farm where she grows bananas, beans and other crops. She has been involved in this business for two years.

Her business is located in a fertile area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be crop pests.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs to enable her to increase production. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a thermal protection device, electric cables, nails, wood, and other supplies in order to install electricity in her home

loans.name: Bideshi

texts.en:
Bideshi is a 39-year-old, married woman from Kandi. She is illiterate but can sign her name only. She is married to Bapi, who is a van puller. His income is inconsistent.

This couple is blessed with three children (two sons and one daughter). Her eldest son works in a small hotel, and the other two children are students of a local village school.

Being a housewife, she does all her household chores but also runs her own animal husbandry. To give financial support to her family, Bideshi now wants to start her own milk-selling business. She plans to sell cow milk and cow dung to her neighbors, so she wants to buy one dairy cow. It will be her asset and increase her income through its milk production. It will also help in getting cow dung, which she can sell as fertilizer to the farmers or as fuel to her locality.

With the aim to start this business, Bideshi seeks a loan from Kiva's partner BJS.

With the starting of the business, she is expecting an increased monthly income and savings, through which Bideshi wants to strengthen the family economy to provide better education to her children.

She is thankful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to start a milk-selling business.

loans.name: Sibani Shg A-1 Group

texts.en:
Sangita is a 42-year-old, rural woman who resides in Titlagarh with her family. She is the one standing to the extreme right in the photograph.

She has a family comprised of her husband and two sons. Both of her sons are associated with some income-generating work.

Sangita is illiterate (only can sign her name). She has taken a great role in improving her family's livelihood.

Sangita and her family do not have a toilet in their home. She understands the importance of having a toilet at home, but due to lack of financial resources, she was not able to build one.

Therefore, she, along with her fellow group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR in order to build a toilet. Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for these families. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick.

loans.use: to build a toilet

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analiza is 43 years old and has three children who are in school.

Analiza has a buying and selling of scrap business in the Philippines. Analiza requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more scrap to sell.

Analiza has been in this business for two years. In the future, Analiza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more scrap to sell

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.es: Kenneth es un joven que se dedica a actividades de albañilería. Solicita un préstamo de setecientos dólares ($ 700 ) para la construcción de un pequeño apartamento, el cual proyecta alquilar para generar un segundo ingreso y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Kenneth is a young man who makes a living by doing building work. He is requesting a loan of $700 in order to build a small apartment, which he plans to rent out in order to generate additional income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es una mujer de 31 años de edad,  soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 10 años, y su negocio es la confección de mantas de cholita.
Ella es buena madre, honesta y muy constante. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘san josé de yunguyo’ área residencial alejada del centro de la ciudad.
Lidia es morena de cabello negro largo trenzado y vestir tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la realiza junto a sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos básico su negocio es la confección de mantas para cholita, estas mantas son usadas por personas de vestir tradicional y se las lleva en la espalda para cubrir del frio, “aprendí el oficio cuando trabajaba como ayudante, conseguí experiencia y me independicé…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con lista de clientes continuos, la desventaja es transportarse con sus mantas hasta las casas de sus clientes. Su sueño es convertirse en una vendedora mayorista, ella desea comprar una máquina de coser industrial y tela por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lidia solicita un préstamo para comprar una máquina de coser industrial y tela para confeccionar mantas de cholita.
texts.en:
Lidia is a 31-year-old woman. She is single and she has two children, who are eight and ten years of age. Her business consists of making ponchos.

She is a good mother. She is honest and very persevering. She sells her ponchos in the “San José de Yunguyo” area, which is a residential area away from the center of the city.

Lidia is dark-skinned. She wears her long, black hair braided and she dresses traditionally (hat, poncho, and skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymara and she also speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her children, who are at school. They live in their own house, which is made out of adobe and has all the basic amenities. She makes ponchos. These ponchos are used by people who dress traditionally and they are worn on the back to cover up from the cold. Lidia says that she learned the trade when she was working as an assistant and then she got more experience and started her own business. The advantage of the business is that she has a list of regular clients and the disadvantage is that she has to transport her ponchos to the houses of her clients. Her dream is to become a wholesaler. She wants to buy an industrial sewing machine and wholesale fabric. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the six years that she has been doing this work.

For these reasons, Lidia is requesting a loan in order to buy an industrial sewing machine and fabric so she can make ponchos.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine and fabric for making ponchos

loans.name: Mirleny

texts.es: Doña Mirleny es una mujer muy trabajadora. Ella solicita un préstamo de setecientos dólares ($700), para la compra de materiales de construcción, esto con el propósito de realizar mejoras necesarias en su vivienda y de esta manera poder asegurar las condiciones de su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mirleny is a very hard-working woman. She is requesting a loan of $700 in order to buy building materials. Her goal is to make the necessary improvements to her home so she can make it safe for her family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Anayansi

texts.es: Anayansi es una joven emprendedora. Ella solicita dos mil dólares ($2000), para la compra de terreno en el cual pueda construir apartamentos para alquilar, esto le permitirá generar un segundo ingreso y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Anayansi is an enterprising young woman. She is requesting $2,000 in order to buy land, on which she will build apartments to rent out. This will enable her to generate additional income and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy land for building apartments to rent out

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize, rice, sugar, fruit, vegetables, and other ingredients for making drinks

loans.name: Ledys Gioconda

texts.es:
Santo Domingo es un sector comercial y productivo,  ciudad perteneciente a la zona costera del país, aquí vive Ledys una señora de 43 años, habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y dos hijas. Su familia es muy unida y sencilla, actualmente su esposo es quien lleva los ingresos al hogar, tienen un taxi donde el mismo trabaja todos los días recorriendo, mientras Ledys pasa en su casa en las labores diarias.
Ella siempre ha tenido un espíritu de superación de poder ayudar a su familia, por ello se ha dedicado a vender ropa de manera ambulante pero por los estudios de sus hijas tuvo que mantenerse en su hogar, ahora tiene un sueño que lo está realizando poco a poco, necesita emprender un negocio al mismo que ya le ha comprado vitrinas y nevera, va a iniciar con una tienda de víveres que la ubicará en su casa así podrá estar cerca de su familia y ayudar en los ingresos del hogar para poder seguir apoyando a sus hijas en los estudios.
Ledys gracias a Kiva podrá comprar los víveres para ya iniciar con el negocio, comprará quintales de arroz, azúcar, aceites y todo lo necesario para iniciar lo más pronto. Se siente agradecida por permitir que los sueños se cumplan y ellos se puedan superar.
texts.en:
Santo Domingo is a commercial and productive sector. The city belongs to the coastal area of the country. Here lives Ledys, a 43-year-old woman. She lives in a house that she owns with her husband and two daughters. Her family is very united and modest. Currently it is her husband who brings an income to the home. He has a taxi that he works with every day, while Ledys spends her time at home doing the daily chores.
She has always had a spirit of improvement, of being able to help her family. This is why she has worked selling clothing as a street vendor. Because of her daughter's studies she had to stay at home. Now she has a dream that she is carrying out little by little . She needs to start a business, for which she has already bought displays and a freezer. She will start her food supply store, which will be located in her home, so she will be able to be close to her family and help with the household income to be able to continue supporting her daughters with their studies.
Thanks to Kiva, Ledys will be able to buy food supplies to start her business. She will buy a stock of rice, sugar, oil, and everything necessary to start as soon as possible. She is grateful for dreams allowed to come true, and that they can be realized.

loans.use: to launch her food supply store, and improve herself through her business.

loans.name: Ara Pyahu Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Ara Pyahu está en su ciclo número 8° del programa de comité de mujeres, todas trabajan de manera unida, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y es por ello que se ayudan.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, ella se dedica a la venta de leche, comenta que todos los días empieza su trabajo desde muy temprano, ya que empieza a repartir su leche a sus clientes para la hora del desayuno. Comenta que tiene muy buena clientela y que está luchando por poder mejorar cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de leche en cantidad, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con su trabajo, luchando por poder mejorar. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group is called Ara Pyahu. It is in its cycle number 8 of the program of the women's committee. They all work in a cooperative way. They are in the poverty elimination program, where they all want to improve their living conditions, and that is why they help each other.
One of the members is Maria, a hard-working and determined woman. Her work is the sale of milk. She says she starts her work very early, as she starts to distribute the milk to her clients for breakfast. She says that she has a very good clientele and that she is fighting to improve every day.
She asks for this loan to invest in the purchase of milk in large quantities, so that in this way she can continue with her work, working hard to be able to improve. She is thankful for the opportunity she receives to be able to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy milk in large quantities to put on sale.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama La Esperanza está en su ciclo número 29 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo antiguo que viene trabajando hace varios ciclos juntas. Son mujeres muy luchadoras, están dentro del programa de mujeres, y también dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde trabajan para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Juana quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de ropas que hace, lucha para poder dar a su familia una vida digna y sin privaciones. Ella lucha para que a sus seres queridos no les falte nada y para que no tengan que pasar por necesidades como las que ella tuvo que pasar. Se define a sí misma como una persona que lucha y quiere salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de ropas variadas, para poder seguir con sus ventas, quiere comprar remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones y otras prendas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas. Agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
This group is called La Esperanza (Hope). It is in its cycle number 29 of the program of the women's committee. It is an old group that has been working through several cycles together. They are determined women, they are in the women's program and also in the poverty elimination program, where they work to be able to improve their living conditions.
One of the members is Juana, who through a lot of effort and continuous work, and through the sale of clothing she does, fights to be able to give her family a decent life and without deprivations. She strives so that her loved ones will not lack anything and they will not have to have any unmet needs as she did. She defines herself as a person who strives and who wants to get ahead.
She asks for this loan to buy a variety of clothing to continue with her sales. She wants to buy t-shirts, jeans, shirts, and other garments, and in this way continue with her sales.
They are grateful for the opportunity they receive to be able to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing to put on sale, such as: t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, and others.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy greens, seasonings, meat, vegetables and other ingredients to prepare food for sale.

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Amistad está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ramona, quien se dedica al comercio, tiene una despensa bien surtida y que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio pudo montar y llevar adelante. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que sobresale en el grupo por ser una mujer muy luchadora y que siempre es positiva.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtir su despensa con verduras, carne, panificados, frutas, enlatados y otros, de manera a poder continuar con sus ventas, y de esa forma poder seguir teniendo los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group called "La Amistad (The Friendship)" is in its 1st cycle of the women's committee program, where they all work and help each other to get ahead.

One of the members is Ramona, who works in business. She has a well-stocked shop, and with lots of effort and sacrifice she was able to set it up and keep it going. She is a very hard-working person who excels in the group for being a very persevering woman who is always positive.

She is asking for this loan to be able to supply her shop with vegetables, meat, breads, fruits, canned goods and others. This way she can continue with her sales and be able to keep having ways to be able to help her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Paula De Jesus

texts.es: Paula de 41 años de edad vive junto a su hijo de 21 años y su nuera. Paula es madre soltera que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo, por lo que se siente muy orgullosa de él, ya que ha cubriendo las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Paula se gana la vida vendiendo prendas de vestir actividad que realiza de forma ambulante recorriendo las calles de su municipio.  Paula solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en: sandalias, sabanas, camisas, pantalones, blusas y de todo tipo de ropa para poder seguir con la venta de sus productos y así poco a poco ir mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Paula is 41-years old and lives with her 21-year old son and daughter-in-law. She is a single mother who, with lots of effort, has managed to support her son. She feels very proud of him because he has covered the basic necessities of the house.

Paula works selling items of clothing on the street, walking through the streets of her town. She is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy sandals, sheets, shirts, pants, blouses and all types of clothing to be able to continue selling her products. Little-by-little she can improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sandals, sheets, shirts, pants, blouses and all types of clothing to be able to continue selling her products.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Don Alberto se dedica a la siembra de diversos cultivos principalmente arroz y maíz. Solicita un préstamo de mil dólares ($1,000), para la compra de semilla y fertilizante necesarios para el desarrollo de sus cultivos. De esta manera podrá mejorar su producción agrícola y generar más ingresos provenientes de esta actividad.
texts.en: Alberto works planting different crops, mainly rice and corn. He is asking for a loan of one-thousand dollars ($1000) to buy seeds and needed fertilizer for the development of his crops. This way he will be able to improve his agricultural production and generate more income from this work.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and seeds.

loans.name: Griselda Rosibel

texts.es: Griselda de 34 años vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos un niño de 15 años y una niña de 4 años. Griselda tiene un pequeño negocio dentro del cual vende comidas en su domicilio, también vende pupusas y panes rellenos. Su esposo le ayuda los fines de semana ya que los días de semana labora en una empresa cercana en la cual se encargan de la elaboración de prendas de vestir. Griselda para ayudar en la economía del hogar solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: aceite, sal, azúcar, maíz, verduras, arroz, frijoles y demás ingredientes que utiliza en la elaboración de los diferentes platos que vende. Todo esto para maximizar los ingresos económicos y así lograr mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Griselda is 34-years old and lives with her husband and two children. Her son is 15-years old and her daughter is 4-years old. She has a small business in which she sells food in her home. She also sells pupusas (stuffed tortillas) and stuffed breads. Her husband helps her on the weekends because during the weekdays he works in a nearby company that is in charge of making clothing.

To help with the economy of the house, Griselda is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy oil, salt, sugar, corn, vegetables, rice, beans, and other ingredients that she uses to make the different dishes that she sells. All of this to maximize her income and thus improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy oil, salt, sugar, corn, vegetables, rice, beans, and other ingredients that she uses to make the different dishes that she sells.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
Martha es una señora de 59 años, viuda quien  vive junto a su hija y tres nietos en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, ciudad caracterizada por ser muy comercial y productiva.
Martha es muy trabajadora, cuenta con un restaurante varios años, lo tiene ubicado en su domicilio en una vía muy transitada, cuenta con la ayuda de su hija para la atención a los clientes, gracias a este negocio ha podido apoyar a sus tres nietos en la educación; ella es muy feliz porque los pequeños de casa pueden salir adelante. Además la señora los fines de semana va a trabajar en su pequeña finca cosechando cacao y plátano para poder sustentar a su familia.
Martha es clienta nueva para la Fundación, con este crédito podrá comprar la materia prima para el restaurante como pollo, arroz, aceite, carnes, aliños y demás.; también desea comprar unas mesas para dar mejor atención. Agradece a Kiva y a la institución por permitir que pequeños microempresarios puedan superarse con estos créditos, con sus ventas ella podrá seguir apoyando a sus nietos que son su razón de ser.
texts.en:
Martha is a 59-year old woman. She is a widow and lives with her daughter and three grandchildren in the city of Santo Domingo. This city is characterized for being very commercial and productive.

Martha is very hard-working and has had a restaurant for several years. It is located in her home on a very busy street. She has help from her daughter to attend to the customers. Thanks to this business she has been able to support her three grandchildren with their schooling. She is very happy because the children can get ahead. Also, on the weekends she works on a small farm planting cocoa and banana to be able to sustain her family.

Martha is a new customer to the Foundation. With this loan, she will be able to buy the ingredients for the restaurant such as chicken, rice, oil, meat, dressings, and others. She also wants to buy some tables to give a better service. She thanks Kiva and the institution for allowing the small businesses to exceed with these loans. With her sales, she will be able to continue supporting her grandchildren who are her reason for living.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food and some tables to better attend to her customers.

loans.name: Zoila Amarilis

texts.es:
Amarilis es una joven de 24 años, vive junto a su madre en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados. Ella es una chica muy responsable y trabajadora, además muy estudiosa, Amarilis actualmente se encuentra cursando la universidad, pero no por ello se ha descuidado de su negocio y trabajo, ella trabaja vendiendo ropa interior y además como secretaria en agropecuaria, es muy responsable y trabaja muy duro para poder pagarse los estudios.
Amarilis es clienta fidelizada de Fundación Alternativa y Kiva, ya que desde el 2013 siempre ha sacado créditos a corto plazo para poder pagarse el semestre universitario, ella siempre está agradecida por el apoyo brindado,   porque sin el crédito no podría continuar con los estudios superiores ya que se le complicaría reunir todo el dinero cada seis meses.
Ahora nuevamente va a invertir para el pago del semestre y seguir con su carrera, Amarilis agradece enormemente a KIVA que prestan apoyo a los microempresarios en sus sueños y proyectos, comenta que seguirá siendo muy cumplida para que nuevamente le apoyen en cada paso de su vida.
texts.en:
Amarilis is a young woman, 24 years old. She lives with her mother in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados. She is a very responsible and hard-working girl in addition to being very studious. Amarilis is currently in university but she hasn't neglected her business and work for this. She works selling lingerie and also as a secretary in agriculture. She is very responsible and works very hard to be able to pay for her education.

Amarilis is a return client with Fundación Alternativa and Kiva, as since 2013 she has gotten short-term loans to be able to pay for the university semesters. She always is grateful for the offered support because, without the loan, she wouldn't be able to continue with her higher education since it would be difficult to gather all the money every six months.

Now she will again invest in order to pay for the semester and continue with her program. Amarilis is enormously grateful to Kiva who offers support to micro-entrepreneurs in their dreams and projects. She says that she will continue to be very complimented that they help her again in each step of her life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and with this additional income she will pay for the semester at her university.

loans.name: Hugo Uladislao

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santo Domingo vive Hugo, un señor de 63 años, vive solo ya que sus hijos cuentan con hogar propio, pero siempre lo visitan.
Hugo trabaja en la compra y venta de chatarra, tiene  una camioneta de segundo uso donde recorre todos los días a diferentes pueblos a recolectar chatarra y venderla a las recicladoras en Santo Domingo; sale desde muy temprano, compra desde cobre, plástico y botellas de vidrio. Hugo comenta cuando el negocio está bajo no se queda de brazos cruzados, ahí sale a vender frutas para salir adelante, dice que gracias a estos ingresos ha podido incrementar otro negocio en casa para atender los fines de semana ya que esos días pasa ahí, ahora desde hace 8 meses cuenta con una pequeña tienda la misma que la ha surtido de a poco. 
Hugo es cliente nuevo para l institución, con este crédito él podrá invertir en mercadería para la tienda como arroz, azúcar, aceites y demás víveres, también va a capitalizar el negocio de la chatarra; con este crédito podrá fortalecer los negocios y así en un futuro contar con su propia bodega de reciclaje y poder dar trabajo a otras personas que deseen superarse. Hugo está muy agradecido con KIVA por el apoyo y la confianza en él depositadas.
texts.en:
In the city of Santo Domingo, Hugo, a 63-year-old man lives alone since his children have their own homes, but they always visit him.

Hugo works buying and selling scrap materials. He has a second-hand truck in which he goes around to the different towns every day to collect scrap materials and sell them to the recyclers in Santo Domingo. He goes out very early, purchasing everything from copper and plastic to glass bottles. Hugo says that when business is slow, he doesn't sit with his arms crossed, but he goes out to sell fruit to get ahead. He says that thanks to this income, he has been able to begin another business in his house which he works on weekends, since he spends those days there. For 8 months now, he has had a small store which he has stocked little by little.

Hugo is a new client for the institution. With this loan, he will be able to invest in merchandise for the store such as rice, sugar, oils, and other groceries. He will also will capitalize the scrap goods business. With this loan he will be able to strengthen the businesses and, so, in the future have his own recycling warehouse and be able to provide work to others who want to improve themselves. Hugo is very grateful to Kiva for the support and confidence given to him.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oils, and other groceries; with these earnings he will eventually have his own warehouse and provide work to other people.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a married woman and she has two children. She describes herself as polite. Paulina operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for five years and her primary customers are locals.

Paulina will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy beauty products for salon use.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Liliana Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santo Domingo vive Liliana una señora de 25 años, madre soltera de 2 niños. Ella es una señora muy responsable, gracias al apoyo de su madre quien cuida de sus pequeños Liliana aprovecha para trabajar en su negocio actual, que le ha permitido salir adelante con sus pequeños.
Desde hace un año cuenta con un camión propio que lo pudo obtener gracias al esfuerzo de varios años de trabajo como empleada contadora en empresa, desde ese entonces realiza fletes de frutas en un sector productivo de la zona, tiene un empleado que trabaja como chofer. Comenta Liliana que le ha ido muy bien, pero hace meses atrás tuvo un percance y tuvo que gastar para el mantenimiento del vehículo, poco a poco pudo salir adelante. Ahora tiene la oportunidad de poner su camión en una cooperativa de transportes que ahora es obligatorio para poder seguir con su negocio, por ello con este crédito ella podrá pagar la afiliación para poder seguir trabajando. Está agradecida con Kiva porque ellos han sido los primeros en apoyarle ya que otros le han cerrado las puertas, está feliz porque así podrá seguir con el negocio y poder apoyar a sus pequeños en la educación.
texts.en:
In the city of Santo Domingo, lives Liliana, a 25-year-old woman, the single mother of 2 children. She is a very responsible woman. Thanks to the support of her mother who cares for her little ones, Liliana takes advantage of being able to work in her current business which has allowed her to get ahead with her little ones.

For the past year, she has had her own truck, which she was able to get thanks to the effort of several years of work as a bookkeeping employee of a business. Since then she has transported fruits in the productive sector of the area. She has an employee who works as a driver. Liliana says that it has gone very well for her, but some months ago, she had a mishap and had to pay for maintenance on the vehicle. Little by little she has been able to get ahead. Now she has the opportunity to join her truck to a transportation cooperative that now is necessary to be able to continue with her business. So, with this loan, she will be able to pay the membership fee to be able to continue working. She is grateful to Kiva because they have been the first to support her since others have shut their doors to her. She is happy because in this way she will be able to continue with the business and be able to support her little ones in their education.

loans.use: to pay for the membership for her truck in a transportation cooperative and to continue working formally.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a rural smallholder farmer in the Nkubu area of Kenya. He is married and has four children. Patrick does dairy and crop farming for food, fodder, and income. He enjoys farming because it is his means of securing the basic necessities of life for his family.

Patrick is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer before planting seasons starts. These inputs will enhance his farm’s fertility and increase the quality and quantity of his harvest.
This loan will increase his family's income and improved their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as improved seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in French bread, sweet bread, and also beauty products to increase her income.

loans.name: Claudia Veronica

texts.es: Claudia de 24 años de edad habita en vivienda propia con sus padres por los que se esfuerza por salir adelante. Ella se dedica a la venta de platos típicos por las tardes además tiene una pequeña tienda y de esa forma ayuda con la economía del hogar. Claudia desea cambiar el techo de la cocina de su casa es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos, etc. para poder cambiar el techo de la cocina y darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres.
texts.en: Claudia, 24 years old, lives in her own house with her parents, for whom she works hard to get ahead. She works selling traditional dishes in the afternoons and also has a small store, and in this way she helps with the household economy. Claudia wants to replace the roof on the kitchen of her house and for this she asks FUSAI fro a loan to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails, etc. to be able to replace the roof on the kitchen and give her parents a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails, etc. to be able to replace the roof on the kitchen and give her parents a better quality of life.

loans.name: Ramon Antonio

texts.es: Ramón un joven trabajador y responsable de 22 años de edad habita en vivienda propia con su mama y su hijo de un año de edad por el que se esfuerza por salir adelante como padre soltero. Él se dedica a prestar sus servicios como vigilante en una empresa privada y de esa manera lleva el sustento a su familia.
