Ramón desea contar con una vivienda digna para su pequeña familia por lo que desea obtener un crédito con FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, hierro, grava y lámina e iniciar con la construcción de la base de la vivienda, ya que por el momento la tiene de lámina y madera.
texts.en: Ramón is a hard-working and responsible young man, 22 years old, who lives in his own house with his mother and his 1-year-old child for whom he works hard to get ahead as a single father. He works offering his services as a security guard in a private business and in this way brings sustenance to his family. Ramón wants to have a dignified house for his little family, so he wants to get a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, rebar, gravel, and metal sheeting to begin with the construction of the base of the house, since at the moment it is made of metal sheeting and wood.

loans.use: to invest in cement, rebar, gravel, and metal sheeting to begin constructing the base of his house.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 56-year-old woman with nine children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Emma has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business such as sugar and flour.

Emma has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business such as sugar and flour.

loans.name: Fabricio Fernando

texts.es:
Fabricio vive junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo recién nacido en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, sector caracterizado en el país por ser una zona productiva y comercial ya que en este punto se une la sierra de la costa, es por donde obligatoriamente tienen que pasar.
Fabricio vive en casa de familiares, la misma que la construyó gracias a su esfuerzo diario, él trabaja como albañil y además da servicio de puerta a puerta en la reparación de radios y televisores, ya en el sector lo conocen porque es muy dedicado en su trabajo.  Cuenta con clientela porque lo han referido poco a poco. Su sueño es en un futuro cercano tener su propio taller de reparación en donde dé un mejor servicio, por ello ahora con este crédito podrá adquirir herramientas necesarias y materia prima para seguir creciendo y fortaleciendo su negocio.
Esta feliz porque es la primera vez que una institución le ayuda para mejorar su negocio, agradece a Kiva por el crédito otorgado, está seguro que seguirá trabajado por mucho tiempo más para hacer su sueño realidad y poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Fabricio lives with his wife and their recently-born child in the city of Santo Domingo, a sector characterized in the country as being a productive and commercial zone since it is at the point where the mountains meet the coast; it is where everyone has to pass.

Fabricio lives in his relatives' house, which he built thanks to his daily efforts. He works as a bricklayer and also provides door-to-door service in repairing radios and televisions, since in the sector he is known because he is very dedicated to his work. He has a customer base because people have been referred to him little by little. His dream is in the near future to have his own repair shop where he can provide better service. For this, with this loan he now will be able to get necessary tools and raw materials to continue growing and strengthening his business.

He is happy because this is the first time that an institution has helped him to improve his business. He is grateful to Kiva for the granted loan, he is sure that he will continue working for a long time to make his dream a reality and be able to get his family ahead.

loans.use: to purchase tools and spare parts to grow his business, with this income he hopes to later have his own shop.

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es: Reina de 42 años de edad es una mujer con deseos de superación y es por ello que desde hace 21 años decidio poner el negocio de la venta de tortillas y es de esa manera que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos de 18 y 16 años de edad como madre soltera. Ella desea poner techo a su vivienda y por tal motivo ella solicita un credito a FUSAI para la inversión de: lamina, madera, clavos, etc. para poder ver realizado su sueño de contar con una vivienda digna para sus hijos.
texts.en: Reina, 42 years old, is a mother with desire to improve herself and for this, 21 years ago she decided to establish a business selling tortillas and in this way she has gotten her children, ages 18 and 16, ahead as a single mother. She wants to install a roof on her house and for this reason she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in metal sheeting, wood, nails, etc. to be able to realize her dream of having a dignified house for her children.

loans.use: to invest in metal sheeting, wood, nails, etc. to be able to realize her dream of having a dignified house for her children.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca es una mujer de 29 años de edad emprendedora y trabajadora que desde hace 4 años se dedica a elaborar platillos tipicos para apoyar con los gastos de la casa a su esposo y llevar el sustento a sus dos hijas de 7 y 4 años de edad. Ella desea hacerle unas mejoras a su vivienda por lo que esta solicitando un credito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, hierro, grava y ladrillos para poder mejorar la casa y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Blanca is a 29-year-old woman, enterprising and hard-working, who for the last 4 years has worked making traditional dishes to support her husband with the household expenses and bring sustenance to her two daughters, ages 7 and 4. She wants to make some improvements on the house so she is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, metal, gravel and bricks to be able to improve the house and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, metal, gravel and bricks to be able to improve the house and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.name: Genna

texts.en:
Genna is a 46-year-old married woman with one child. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.

Genna requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been raising pigs for seven years now and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Genna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Floridalma

texts.es: Maria, tiene 32 años de edad,  es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Mezapa, Tela Atlántida cerca del Progreso, Yoro.  Actualmente tiene una pulpería para la venta de productos de la canasta básica, y la tiene desde hace seis meses establecida en casa de su padre. Vende refrescos, arroz, maíz, frijoles, manteca, azúcar, sal, pan, café, churros, y productos de limpieza. Ella antes se dedicaba a la venta de ropa usada de forma ambulante. Ahora está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de 15,000 lempiras los que va invertir en la compra de más producto alimenticio como azúcar, frijoles, arroz, manteca, huevos, refrescos, churros, harina, productos de aseo, verduras, carnes y otros, para surtir el negocio y aumentar las ventas. Su meta es continuar fortaleciendo su negocio para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 32 years old, married, has two children, and lives in the municipality of Mezapa, Tela Atlántica near Progreso, Yoro. Currently, she has a general store where she sells basic pantry items, and she has had it for six months in her father's house. She sells soft drinks, rice, corn, beans, butter, sugar, salt, bread, coffee, churros, and cleaning products. Before, she worked selling used clothing as a street vendor. Now she is asking for a loan in the quantity of 15,000 lempiras which she will invest in the purchase of more food products such as sugar, beans, rice, butter, eggs, soft drinks, churros, flour, cleaning products, vegetables, meat and others to stock her business and increase her sales. Her goal is to continue strengthening her business to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more food products such as sugar, beans, rice, butter, eggs, soft drinks, churros, flour, cleaning supplies, vegetables, meats and more, to stock her business.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is a native resident of the town of Panglao, Bohol. Her husband is a fisherman. They were blessed with four children. The eldest is 14 and the youngest is 2. Josie helps her husband by selling fresh fish to the neighboring towns and this business serves as the family's main source of income. She has been engaged in fish vending for 20 years now.

Josie needs capital to improve her husband's business. With this loa, she could sold more fish and slowly improve her daily earnings. Thus, she could afford to buy healthy diets and provide better shelter to live.
She decided to take a loan to buy fishing net.

Josie would like to improve her fish vending livelihood activity to become sustainable in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Makhdoma

texts.en:
Makhdoma is a 40-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has requested a loan for her husband’s green grocery business. Her husband has been selling fresh vegetables for many years in his hometown. He had been using a four-wheel manual cart to carry the vegetables from one place to another.

Now, Makhdoma's husband has opened a shop for selling vegetables, but he does not have enough cash on hand to buy the initial inventory to run his shop in a proper manner. Their children are growing and their needs are growing, as well. To cope with the rapid increase in the school fees, books, utility bills, and household expenses, Makhdoma's husband wants to establish his business but he does not have enough savings to buy vegetables in bulk.

Therefore, Makhdoma has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy fresh vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy inventory in bulk for her husband's vegetable shop.

loans.name: Slilma Lila Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario SLILMA LILA, es vocablo miskito que significa “Etsrella Lila” está conformado por 3 mujeres, todas son indígenas  miskitas de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que  con sus ingresos aportan para las necesidades básicas de sus hogares. Se organizaron recientemente para acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. Decidieron nombrar al grupo solidario SLILMA LILA, en vocablo miskito significa "Estrella Lila".

SENAYDA: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una señora luchadora de 57 años de edad, casada. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar ropa usada en Managua y venderla a precios accesibles a su clientela de Bilwi. Ella sueña  en construir su vivienda de concreto.
texts.en:
SLILMA LILA is the name of this group and comes from a Miskito word that means 'Lilac Star'. The group is made up of three indigenous women from the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. The women are all businesswomen who use their earnings to cover the basic necessities in their homes. They recently joined forces so they could apply for micro loans through Pana Pana.

SENAYDA is the group coordinator, she is a strong woman, 57 years old and married. Senya's goal is to establish her own income source and contribute to the household earnings. She is seeking financing to buy used clothing in Managua and then sell for low prices to her clientele in Bilwi. Senya's dream is to construct her own home made out of concrete.

loans.use: to buy used clothing in Managua and then sell for low prices.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 54 years old and widowed with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years, selling a variety of items.

Gloria requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
As a farmer, MAO, who is a 49 years old man with four children, one married, can only make USD4 per day to support his family. MAO is residing in a rural area of Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He has been a seller for 10 years until now.

MAO would like to get a low interest loan from Kiva now in order to build a hygienic latrine for his house. He is very happy with this loan since it will promote his health, environment and living standard. MAO would like to thank for all lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like him.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
In the first years of managing her variety store business, Criselda thought that it would be difficult, considering the market competition and customers’ demands. However, she is grateful that with the help of the Lord and by using the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and all of the lenders, her prior loan of PHP 10,000 was approved. The loan was a great help in improving her business. Criselda wants to express her deepest gratitude once again for the financial assistance lenders have provided. She used the loan to buy grocery items for her variety store business.

Criselda has also been operating a Jeepney vehicle, in addition to running her variety store, for 10 years now. Indeed, it is not easy to make a living nowadays. Criselda dreams of growing her income and becoming successful some day. She plans to invest in her own car, house, and lot. For all of this to take place, Criselda applied for another loan of PHP 10,000 to buy grocery items for her variety store business and pay for maintenance of her Jeepney.

In spite of being busy managing her businesses, Criselda spares time to attend CCT group fellowship that consists of 10-15 individuals, where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hear testimonies from other CCT partners. She is also able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her variety store and pay for maintenance of her Jeepney.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 60 years old, married with seven children. One of whom is in school.

Luzviminda works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Luzviminda has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Luzviminda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business.

Charito has been in this business for 10 years. Charito earns more income from general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Blanca is 39 years old and has three children who are in school.

Blanca has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Blanca requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of vegetable to sell.

Blanca has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Blanca would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Romelie

texts.en:
Romelie is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from selling charcoal.

Romelie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. Romelie hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Sughra's Group

texts.en:
Sughra is a 47-years old married woman, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
Her son is a rickshaw driver by profession and drives a rickshaw in Lahore city which is a very populated area. A few days ago he had a road accident, when he was looking for a passenger by standing beside the road, a speeding car hit the rickshaw from behind. He did not get any injury but the rickshaw’s body was seriously damaged and needed replacement with a new one. He wants to replace the rickshaw body with a new one, but does not have enough cash in hand to fix it.
Therefore, Sughra has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son would be able to buy an auto rickshaw body and he can drive smoothly again.
She is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan, for this support.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body for her son's transportation services, so he can compensate against accidental damage.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
“Sari-sari” or variety store is a usual enterprise in the Philippines. The proliferation of this business makes the competition stiff, hence store owners try many techniques to make it stable and competitive.

Emelyn, 52, from Fatima, General Santos City adds photocopying services to her variety store business. In this way, students who want to photocopy some documents can be her captured buyers. Her income helps sustain their daily expenditures and supplements her husband’s salary as a government employee. But her forward-looking mindset drives her to further improve her business. She aspires to buy school supplies to combine with the photocopying services. Aside from this, she will also retail cellphone load, buy additional grocery items and sacks of rice. A loan worth PHP 50,000 would be enough for this purpose. It will surely bring higher profits for her and her family.

In due time, Emelyn hopes that she can convert her sari-sari into a big grocery store with wide array of merchandise. She prays for a more comfortable life in the near future. She regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, grocery items, and sacks of rice for her store

loans.name: Freddie

texts.en: Freddie  is married and lives in Oroquieta City with her family has been selling snacks to make a living. She sells puto cheese in her villages and also accepts orders for any occasion earning well for the family. She had repaid successfully her previous loan used for buying ingredients. To meet the current demands, she took a  new loan recently to buy additional ingredients to prepare puto cheese to increase her income. She was happy to say that worth this loan, rest assured to meet her desired income and to save more for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to additional ingredients for puto cheese  making.

location.town: Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City, Miss. Occ

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 54 years old, married and has five children.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Fe requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Fe has been raising pigs for 1 year now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Gerlie

texts.en:
Ma. Gerlie is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Gerlie is 40 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ma. Gerlie has a general store business in the Philippines. Ma. Gerlie requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Ma. Gerlie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is requesting for a loan to buy cows for slaughtering to sell. He is 30-years-old married with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Having used his small savings from cocoa to start a butcher shop to increase his household income, Wilson has reaped a lot from this business which has made him able to send all his children to school,pay back the loan and maintain the welfare of his home.

He dreams of expanding his business, though limited capital affects him. He used the previous loan to buy cows for meat to sell to his customers. Wilson is so grateful to Kiva lenders for the funds given to him and requests for more.

loans.use: to buy cows for slaughtering to sell

loans.name: Soknan

texts.en:
Living in Steung Mean Chey district of Phnom Penh city, Cambodia, Soknan is 22 years old and a university student. He can earn income to support his studying and living via working as an intern. This is Soknan first Kiva loan with VisionFund and he will spend this loan to pay for preparing some necessary documents such as passport and visa, as he has passed to join a vocational training for 3 months abroad.

Soknan wishes that he can get more knowledge, experiences and improve his skills so that he can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: to pay for preparing some necessary documents, such as passport and visa to join a vocational training for 3 months abroad.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is a 53-year-old hardworking woman with a great desire to get ahead. She is a divorced and lives with her daughter and pensioner father in Batumi. They live together in a small house.

Mzia works at local cafe and gets small monthly income. She has a great desire to run this kind of business and requested a loan for starting her own business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 8500 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase all the needed inventory to open a cafe.

Mzia has many years of experience in this field and a deep understanding of her customer's needs. Her cafe will be in a very good area with lots of customers passing by. So, Mzia hopes that her new cafe will be profitable and all the profits she will use to expand her cafe in future. Mzia awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a cafe

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
RAZIA is a 56-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. Her husband owns a clothing business. His practice is to buy clothing from a wholesaler and sell it to the retailers. He has lot of customers who like to buy clothing from him; sometimes he purchases clothing from out of the city at a low cost and sells it to the retailers. He has a good reputation in the market and his current customers refer his clothing to the other retailers which becomes good advertising. One of her sons also helps her husband in the clothing business; both give part of their time to the shop. 

RAZIA has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband will be able to buy more clothing of various colors and designs to fulfill the demand. She is in a repeated loan cycle and has shown an excellent repayment behavior. She has already been taking the loan from BRAC and investing in the business. RAZIA hopes that the savings will much increase so she can arrange the marriage ceremony for her daughter. 

RAZIA dreams of the bright future of her children, the establishment of their business, and a better living standard for her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more clothing of various colors and designs for her husband's cloth selling shop.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a widow with 2 children. She operates a farm where she grows maize. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs to enable her to increase production. Her business goal is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a married woman. She has 8 children. She describes herself to be polite and humble. She operates a farm where she grows bananas, beans and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be crop pests. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs to enable her increase production. Her business goal is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to enable her increase production

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
Selly is a married woman, with 5 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm in which she grows vegetables where she has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a fertile area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy farm inputs to enable her to increase production. Her business goal is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Marlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Marlyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Marlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and married. Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care, and other groceries.

Josephine has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Remia

texts.en:
Remia is 40 years old and married with four children, three of whom in school, Remia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a loading station in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional loads for her business and signal products.

Remia has been in this business for 8 years. 

In the future Remia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional loads for her business and signal products

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is 39 years old. He lives with his wife and pensioner mother in Zugdidi district. He earns a living by breeding cattle at home. Mamuka has been involved in this type of business for over eight years. He also makes a profit from selling milk. Mamuka has two dairy cows that give ten liters of milk every day. Besides this, Mamuka is involved in sowing agricultural crops on family-owned 0.5 hectare agricultural land.

Mamuka wants to start trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 2000 GEL. With the received credit, he will purchase a stock of nuts to resell at a higher price.
Mamuka hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to begin trading in nuts.

loans.name: Vangdouang Group

texts.en:
Khambai is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.
Khambai and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years. The water filter Khambai and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.

Khambai and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Khambai and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: purchase TerraClear water filters, so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Pholao Group

texts.en:
Bouasee understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Bouasee knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Bouasee purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Bouasee is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: To purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Betsy

texts.en:
Betsy is a thirty-four years old woman with two children ages 8 and 5 years old respectively. She owns and operates a sari-sari(variety) store. She sold items ranging from biscuits, fruit flavored juices, bread, noodles, condiments, assorted canned goods, and soft drinks.
She has been operating a sari-sari(variety) store for 4 years now.

Betsy has requested a loan to buy assorted stocks like soft drinks, liquor,and assorted groceries. With these she would like to improve her existing business and be able to maintain the stocks of her store. Thus, she could start to expand. She could now continue to support the needs of her children and at the same time improve her main source of income to become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy assorted stocks like soft drinks, liquor and assorted groceries.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is 34 years old, married with five children. Three of her children are in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Melissa has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. Melissa requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle passenger.

Melissa has been in this business for three years. In the future, Melissa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle passenger.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 51-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan and is the responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession.

For a long time, he has wanted to replace his old rickshaw's body. Because of this, he is unable to attract passengers due to the ugly looking vehicle and to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of the new rickshaw body.
Therefore, Shabana has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of the rickshaw body. This will help him to continue his business. She is so very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body for her husband because the old one was rattling during driving.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Judith is 36 years old and has one child in school.

Judith has a food vending business in the Philippines. Judith requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food like meat, spices, fish, etc..

Judith has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Judith would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food like meat, spices, fish, etc.

loans.name: Obinna's Group

texts.en:
Obinna is 28 years old. Still single and popularly known as the young pastor, presently he serves as an assistant pastor at his church in the village. Early this year, after learning the possibility of getting a loan for palm oil processing from Nke Anyi Cooperative Obinna organized his church members to form an association of palm oil millers in his locality seeing it as a way to help his members earn more annually.

As a new member of Nke-Anyi farmer’s multipurpose cooperative society, he hopes that income from this loan will help him achieve his dreams which include that of getting married and also supporting his parents. He is very excited about this new engagement and hope to bring more of his church members especially those that are presently unemployed to benefit from this life saving project.

Obinna and his group members appreciate all Kiva lenders in this regards.

loans.use: to process and store palm oil product.

loans.name: Delfin Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres sonrientes de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que trabajan día a día con el empeño de lograr el crecimiento de sus pequeños negocios de venta de productos básicos; se organizaron como grupo solidario desde hace aproximadamente 4 años, para obtener préstamo en Pana Pana. Decidieron nombrar al grupo solidario Delfín, porque es un animal amistoso y colaborador, cualidades que caracterizan a sus integrantes.

MICAELA: Es la integrante del grupo solidario, es una mujer luchadora, tiene 56 años, madre soltera de 6 hijos mayores de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos, estableció una pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda, poco a poco ha creado un anexo con plástico negro para cubrirse del sol. Está solicitando préstamo para comprar productos: Granos básicos, chiverías, entre otros productos. Ella sueña contener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three smiling women of Miskita ethnicity from the city of Bilwi, in the Puerto Cabezas municipality. They are entrepreneurial women who work everyday to try to grow their small grocery businesses. They organised themselves into a solidarity group about 4 years ago, in order to obtain a loan through Pana Pana. They decided to call their group 'Dolphin', because it is a friendly and cooperative animal, and both of these qualities characterise its members.

MICAELA is a member of the group. She is a hardworking 56-year-old woman. She is a single mother to six children who are now adults. In order to have her own source of income and to allow her children to get ahead, she set up a small grocery store in the corridor of her home. Gradually she has created an annex from black plastic to protect it from the sun. She is requesting the loan to purchase products: basic grains, snack foods and other products. She dreams of having a prosperous business.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, snack foods and other products

loans.name: Khamphaena Group

texts.en:
Onsee is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan. Onsee and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.

The water filter Onsee and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years. Onsee and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Onsee and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 1 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be drought which affects supply of animal feeds. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy animal feeds and other farm inputs. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
As a farmer, Sokly, who is a 35 years old woman with one child, can only make USD8 per day to support her family. She is residing in a rural area of Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been being as a vegetable and fish seller for 5 years.

Sokly would like to get a low interest loan from Kiva in order to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan since it will promote her health, environment and living standard. She would like to thank for all lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like her.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma’s desire to enrich her family’s life is tremendous. She combines all income generating ventures that she knows to help her husband, Dionesio, earn a living. She runs a variety store, sells rice and frozen foods, retails cellphone load, and buys scrap once in a while. She wants to earn and save enough to ensure the future and education of her children. 

They are living in Fatima, General Santos City which is a prolific place for many businesses because it’s a flourishing city. This is why Elma was encouraged to run all these enterprises. She still longs to improve her business by availing of additional capital worth PHP 50,000 which she can use to buy more supplies for her variety store and additional chicken meat, pork, hotdogs, sausages, and sacks of rice. She plans to set aside some money for her cellphone e-loading and scrap business. May you be God’s channel of blessings to her as she strives towards her dream to become a successful businesswoman someday. 

Elma consistently meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her variety store and additional chicken meat, pork, hotdogs, sausages, and sacks of rice

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 15 years. Rosalinda earns more income from buy and sell ready to wear.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Rencee

texts.en:
As a  parent of two children, Rencee works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising chicken. Rencee is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Rencee has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en:
RIZWANA is a 46-years-old married and responsible woman. She is living in populated area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her children are growing and their needs as well. She wants to educate them in higher colleges after school period, to meet the educational expenses in future; she wants to increase her husband's daily sales and savings as well. 
Her husband is a goods distributor by profession; he purchases goods of various types related to betel leaf and various kinds of tobacco and areca nuts. He wants to increase his distribution on daily basis and excess goods required as well. The major problem is the lack of availability of funds.  
Therefore, RIZWANA has requested a Kiva loan through Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband so he can buy stock of betel leaf, areca nuts and kind of tobacco. In this way he can easily cope with the increasing demand of retailers and can generate additional income to cherish his family. For this purpose he will ensure some savings through the additional generated income. 
RIZWANA is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stock of betel leaf, areca nuts and kind of tobacco for her husband's goods distribution work.

loans.name: Shahufia

texts.en:
Shahufia is 39 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his rickshaw which always remains in bad condition. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine.

She has contacted with Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can repair his rickshaw. He wants to maintain the engine’s piston, one wheel and want to pay labor cost over it. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers.

Shahufia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husbandand will bring positive changes to his business. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain the engine’s piston, one wheel of rickshaw  for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Uracan Group

texts.es:
Esta conformado por 3 mujeres (Dionicia, Kenia Irene y Florencia), pertenecen a la etnia miskita de la Ciudad de Bilwi, del Municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Se organizaron hace año y medio, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento con garantía solidaria, para incrementar la mercadería de sus pequeños negocios de venta de ropa usada y  productos plásticos, mejorar su nivel de ingresos y calidad de vida.

Dionicia: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una joven emprendedora de 25 años, con cualidades de líder y deseos de superación. Casada con 3 hijos: El mayor de 9 años estudia su tercer grado de primaria y 2 menores de edad. Recuerda con gran alegría que inicio vendiendo chiverías, gracias a las ganancias percibidas y a los créditos otorgados anteriormente por PANA PANA y financiados por KIVA, le han permitido incrementar sus productos, al ofertar productos y utensilios plásticos para el hogar. Solicita financiamiento para comprar En Managua ropa nueva y venderla a precios accesibles a su clientela de Bilwi. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
This group consists of 3 women (Dionicia, Kenia Irene and Florencia) who are of Miskito ethnicity from the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They organized themselves a year and a half ago in order to access loans with a joint guarantee, in order to increase their small businesses' stock. They sell used clothing and plastic products to improve their income and quality of life.

Dionicia is the coordinator of the solidarity group. She is a young entrepreneur who is 25 years old. She has leadership qualities and a desire to excel. She is married with 3 children: the eldest, who is nine, is studying third grade at primary school and she has two younger children. She remembers with great joy that she started out selling snack foods, and through her profits and loans granted previously by PANA PANA and funded by KIVA, she has been able to increase her range of products, to offer plastic products and utensils for the home. She is requesting a loan to buy new clothing in Managua and sell it at affordable prices to her customers in Bilwi. She dreams of being a successful businesswomen.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing in Managua.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet operates a retail shop where she gets daily income to support her family including her parents who are now at an old age. She gets additional income from tailoring by making ladies wear and uniforms for schools around her home town. She has faced a challenge of competition plus seasonality sales, that is to say her sales are high on festive seasons and school time season.while in business.

She is a very hard working lady with future plans of operating a large retail shop so she she can meet her increasing customer demands. Annet intends to use the loan to buy merchandise like margarine,cooking oil, powder soap and others to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like margarine, cooking oil, powder soap and others to sell.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a fifty years old married woman living along with her spouse and children in the backward area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her family members are running a single business which is sewing bags, each family member assigned a specific task according to their experiences. She sews bags along with her daughter, one of her sons fixes buckles and her husband sells it from his store. In this way her family generating money through mutual efforts.

Nowadays the household expenses and children's basic requirements have increased and need to be fulfill by generating more income. Razia wants to increase the stock of raw material on a daily basis, so her family members can sew more bags and can earn maximum profit against their efforts. Due to lack of availability of funds, she requested a Kiva loan through BRAC Pakistan, so that she can buy rexene, buckles and zippers for sewing bags and then her husband can sell them from his bags store.

Razia is very happy after receiving this loan and will be very thankful to the lenders for supporting her.

loans.use: to buy rexene, buckles and zippers for her family business, which is sewing bags.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John says, "I have been using firewood and charcoal as fuel in my homestead. These fuels are expensive and tedious to use. This biogas loan from Takamoto biogas will enable me to channel the savings I will make from buying fuel to buying more cattle." John believes in hard work to achieve success, and his faith in God. Please help is family to get a biogas system.

loans.use: to buy a bio-digester to generate its own, clean, renewable, free cooking fuel.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a Kiva borrower. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a farm where she grows bananas, maize, beans, vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy farm inputs to enable her increase productions. Her business goal is to have a large scale business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Promoviendo De Urubamba Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “HATUN SAYHUA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Lamay, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Braulia ella es soltera y tiene 57 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maiz,papa y trigo, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Hatun Sayhua communal bank. This bank is located in the Lamay district, Calca province, Cusco department.

Braulia, a member, is 57 years old. She is single and has two children. She works in her agriculture business. She has land where she grows corn, potatoes, and wheat. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00. She has been in this business for several years, and it is going very well for her.

Her dream is to expand her agriculture business.

She is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

The other members have businesses selling sweets, selling clothes, a grocery store business, and a restaurant business.

Braulia is grateful to those who form part of this dream through these means. She pledges to make her payments according to the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell ready to wear.  Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael, vive en compañía de su esposa, no tiene parientes que residan en el extranjero, su negocio es comprar y revender materiales de reciclaje como hierro, cobre y aluminio, dos hermanos le ayudaron a que adquiriera los conocimientos para desempeñar dicha actividad, de forma independiente está trabajando hace 15 años, con un horario de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, todos los días.
Comprará aluminio, hierro y cobre, para revenderlo a un mejor precio, espera que las ventas se mantengan y pueda tener mejores entradas de dinero para solventar los gastos de su hogar y pagar la deuda adquirida.
Su aspiración es seguir trabajando para tener un mejor futuro junto a su esposa.
texts.en:
Rafael lives with his wife. He does not have relatives that live abroad.

His business is buying and reselling recyclable materials like iron, copper, and aluminum. Two siblings helped him to get the knowledge to carry out this business activity. He has been working independently for 15 years. His schedule is from seven in the morning until five in the afternoon every day.

He will buy aluminum, iron, and copper in order to resell it for a better price. He hopes to maintain sales and to be able to have better income in order to pay the household expenses and to pay for the loan.

He aspires to continue working in order to have a better future together with his wife.

loans.use: to buy aluminum, iron, and copper to resell for a better price.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is 32 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rona has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Rona requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

Rona has been in this business for four years. In the future, Rona would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is a 46 years old widowed woman. She lives in Telavi district, Kakheti region. Lela is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she owns a vineyard and produces wine to sell locally at a good price.

Lela wants to start an additional business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 4900 GEL. With the received money she will open a car wash and will generate a stable income. Her brother-in-law is experienced in this business and he will help Lela to run the business properly. Lela is very hardworking woman and very motivated to start up a new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a car wash in order to generate a stable income.

loans.name: Napho Group

texts.en:
Chabkham understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Chabkham knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Chabkham purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Chabkham is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Zubida

texts.en:
Zubida is 50-years old lady and is the mother of two daughters and one son. Her son owns a workshop in which he provides the services to maintain bicycles. He is professional in his techniques and can easily fix the bicycles in no time. He has to use various types of tools for this. A few days ago he shifted his workshop to another place and due to the move, some of the important and expensive tools have been misplaced.

Zubida requested a loan so that her son would be able to compensate against this loss. He will buy repair tools, spare parts, tires, brake shoes etc for his bicycle repair workshop.

She wants to provide better education and living standard to her children. She is hopeful that her son will utilize this amount in positive way and his monthly income would be increase.
Zubida thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy repairing tools, spare parts, tires, brake shoes etc for her son's bicycle repairing shop.

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Sidra is 40 years old, married and has four children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
She belongs to a poor family, living hand to mouth. Her husband owns a small clothing shop in which he sells used clothing. He has been running this business for many years. His business is unable to generate sufficient income for his family.
It is necessary to grow the business to meet the family's needs but a lack of capital is the major problem for him.

Therefore, Sidra took out a loan for her husband’s business. With help from this loan, he will purchase more used clothes to sell.
Sidra thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for her husband's clothing selling business, so he can be able to generate more income to his cherished family.

loans.name: Papaya Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario PAPAYA, está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras, viven en la ciudad de Bilwi; municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Se unieron hace 12 meses con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para poder tener acceso a préstamos en Pana Pana, que les permitiera incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar poco a poco las condiciones de vida de sus familias.

SANTOS BENITA: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una mujer amable,  Tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar. Su esposo trabaja como conductor de una institución del gobierno. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y apoyar con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos, vende de manera ambulante accesorios de acero. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua: cadenas, pulseras, aretes de acero y oro laminado y venderlos a precios accesibles a su clientela.  Sueña con tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
The solidarity group PAPAYA is made up of three women entrepreneurs. They live in the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They got together twelve months ago with the goal of working together as a group to receive access to loans from Pana Pana. This has allowed them to increase the inventory of their small businesses, grow their incomes and in this way slowly improve the quality of life of their families.

Santos Benita is a member of the solidarity group. She is a kind woman, 36 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. Her husband works as a driver at a government institution. With the goal of having her own source of income and helping to cover household expenses and her children's education, she works as a peddler selling jewellery accessories. She is requesting a loan to buy chains, bracelets and steel and gold coated earrings in Managua to sell to her clients at accessible prices. She dreams of having a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy chains, bracelets and steel and gold coated earrings in Managua.

loans.name: Los Apus Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS APUS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Kosñipata, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yulicia ella es conviviente y tiene 55 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.
	
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The members belong to the community bank "Los Apus." This bank is located in the district of Kosnipata, in the province of Paucartambo, department of Cusco. Mrs. Yulicia is a common law wife, she is 55 years old and she has 4 children. The member works in her restaurant business. She prepares dishes such as chicken with potatoes, soups, and beef stews. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. She has been doing this for 10 years and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand her restaurant business. She is asking for a loan to buy products for cooking such as chicken, beef and vegetables. The other members work raising animals, selling cereal grains, running a grocery store, and a food stand. The member thanks those who form part of this dream through this medium, and she is committed to make her installment payments in the established period.

loans.use: The member requests a loan to buy products for cooking such as chicken, beef and vegetables.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria, necesita de un crédito para abastecer su negocio comprando maíz, cal y leña, para tener materia prima para seguir preparando la venta de tortillas, su deseo es mantenerse trabajando y contar con clientes satisfechos.
Al saber utilizar los créditos Gloria puede ir poco a poco progresando junto a su familia, hoy en día tiene nuevos clientes que visitan su tortillería.
texts.en:
Gloria needs a loan to be able to stock her business with corn, lime and firewood, so that she has the basic supplies available for continuing to prepare and sell tortillas. She wants to continue working and to count on satisfied customers.

Because Gloria knows how to to use the credit, she can continue to progress little by little with her family. Nowadays she has new customers who come to visit her tortilla store.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime and firewood, in order to have the basic supplies for continuing to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es:
Ana, de 45 años de edad, es ama de casa y estudio hasta primer grado, no continúo sus estudios debido a la falta de recursos económicos en que se vivía; está casada y junto a su esposo tienen 4 hijos de los cuales dos aún se encuentran estudiando y dos trabajan y su esposo se dedica a la albañilería. 

Ana, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 30 años, trabajo que lo aprendió de sus padres quienes siempre se han dedicado a este negocio, para llegar a su cultivo tiene que caminar 3 kilómetros y su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. todos los días.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, semilla y pesticidas para el cultivo de 3,750 metros cuadrados de maicillo y 3,750 metros cuadrados de frijol, así lograra tener una buena cosecha. 

Ana, sueña con trabajar mucho y ahorrar para cumplir todos sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Ana, age 45, is a housewife. She went to school through the first grade. She did not continue her education due to the lack of financial resources she experienced. She is married, and she and her husband have four children. The children go to school, and two of them work. Her husband is a bricklayer.

Ana has devoted herself to agriculture for 30 years. She learned this work from her parents, who always worked in this business. In order to get to her crops, she needs to walk three kilometers. Her work schedule is from 7:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m. every day.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides for her 3,750 square meter crop of sorghum and her 3,750 square meter crop of beans. This way she will manage to have a good harvest.

Ana dreams of working a lot and saving in order to complete her projects.

loans.use: to buy agriculture supplies like fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides for her sorghum and bean crops.

loans.name: Blanco Group

texts.es:
Está integrado por 3 mujeres sonrientes (Tatitana Diarniris, Loira y Daysi) pertenecen a la etnia miskita de la Ciudad de Bilwi, Municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Se organizaron hace 2 años, con la esperanza de acceder a financiamiento con garantía solidaria, para comprar mercadería para sus pequeños negocios de: venta de bastimentos y productos básicos. Incrementar sus ingresos y cubrir los gastos del hogar.

Tatitana Diarniris: Es la Coordinadora del Grupo Solidario, tiene 28 años de edad, casada, con un hijo de 5 años de edad, que estudia su primer grado de primaria. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y apoyar con los gastos del hogar y estudios de su hijo, estableció en el corredor de su vivienda de tambo y madera una pequeña pulpería. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar: Chiverías, granos básicos. Ella sueña con vender pollo y productos lácteos.
texts.en:
This group consists of 3 women (Tatitana Diarniris, Loira and Daysi) who are of Miskito ethnicity from the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They organized themselves two years ago, with the hope of accessing funding with a joint guarantee in order to purchase merchandise for their businesses which sell basic provisions and grains, and to increase their income and cover household expenses.

Tatitana Diarniris is the coordinator of the Solidarity Group. She is 28 years old and married with a child 5 years of age who is studying first grade. In order to have her own source of income and to assist with the household expenses and her son's studies, she set up a small grocery store on the verandah of her wooden stilts home. She is requesting a loan to buy: snack foods and basic grains. She dreams of selling chicken and dairy products.

loans.use: to purchase snack foods and basic grains.

loans.name: Nabor Group

texts.en:
Seesawan understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group member's family. Seesawan knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Seesawan purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Seesawan is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Yunis

texts.en:
Yunis is a married woman with four children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates an M-pesa business where she offers mobile phone based money transfer services.

Yunis has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to add M-pesa float credit. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float credit.

loans.name: Airen

texts.en:
Airen is 35 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Airen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, junk foods, home product care items, and other groceries. She has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Airen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, junk foods, home product care items, and other groceries.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a 40-year -old married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marissa has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Marissa requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

Marissa has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie is 34 years old and married with three children.  With all three children in school, Gerlie works very hard to provide for them.

Gerlie has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Gerlie has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Gerlie would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is a 42-year-old married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Analie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Analie requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more variety of fish to sell.

Analie has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Analie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en:
Marivel is 36 years old and married with four children, all of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marivel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, canned goods, beverages, home products, and other groceries.

Marivel has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Marivel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, canned goods, beverages, home products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 52 years old, married and has four children.

Nancy is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Nancy requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Nancy has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nancy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Aníbal, dice que al utilizar el préstamo anterior para realizar sus trabajos agrícolas ha podido tener buenas cosechas y mejorado su situación económica, su núcleo familiar ha crecido y por el momento todos se encuentran en buenas condiciones de salud.
Él está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar alambre de púas para cercar los terrenos y arrendarlos para tener otros ingresos, con los que podrá seguir atendiendo sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Anibal says that the loan he previously took out to carry out his agriculture business has allowed him to reap a good harvest and to improve his economic situation. His family has grown and currently everyone is in good health.
He is requesting a new loan to buy barbed wire to enclose his lots and rent them out to have other sources of income, which will allow him to continue attending to his responsibilities.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire to enclose his lots and rent them out to have other sources of income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens for fattening and to have a small farm.

loans.name: Acero Group

texts.es:
Esta conformado por 3 mujeres alegres (María Alinda, Jahaira y Indira Julieta), pertenecen a la etnia miskita de la Ciudad de Bilwi, Municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Se organizaron recientemente con el propósito de mejorar sus pequeños negocios de venta de bastimento y productos básicos, a través del acceso de financiamiento con garantía solidaria y contribuir a cubrir los gastos del hogar.

María Alinda: Es la Coordinadora del grupo solidario ACERO, tiene 36 años de edad, casada. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, vendiendo productos ambulantes. Tiene 3 hijos: 2 adolecentes que estudian su secundaria y un pequeño de 4 años de edad. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su familia y contribuir con los gastos del hogar, estableció su pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda de tambo y madera. Recuerda que con sus ahorros de lavar y planchar ajeno le permitieron emprender su negocio. Solicita financiamiento para comprar: Granos básicos y chiverías. Ella sueña con vender ropa y calzado nuevo.
texts.en:
This group consists of 3 cheerful women (Maria Alinda, Jahaira and Indira Julieta) who are of Miskito ethnicity from the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They organized themselves recently in order to develop their small businesses, which sell basic grocery items, through access to loans with a joint guarantee and to contribute financially to household expenses.


María Alinda is the coordinator of the ACERO solidarity group. She is 36 years old and married. Her husband works informally as a street vendor. She has three children: two teenagers who are studying at high school and a little one who is 4 years old. In order to help her family to move forward and to contribute to the household expenses, she set up a small grocery store on the verandah of her wooden stilts home. She recalls that she used her savings from doing washing and ironing for others to start her business. She is requesting funding to purchase basic grains and snack foods. She dreams of selling clothing and new shoes.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains and snack foods.

loans.name: Mirno

texts.es:
El Sr. Mirno es de la ciudad de Lambaré, es dueño de un Depósito de bebidas, tiene su Camión con el cual realiza sus repartos, su esposa tiene también un negocio de ven-tas en su despensa. Son una pareja muy trabajadora que lucha y se esfuerza por poder salir adelante.
Él es una persona que se esfuerza para poder crecer y salir adelante, pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas de todo tipo para poder surtirse y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Mirno is from the city of Lambare. He is the owner of a drinks business. He has a truck which he uses to carry out his deliveries. His wife also has a sales business in his storage area. They are a hardworking couple who struggle and make a great effort in order to get by.

He works hard in order to be able to grow and get ahead. He is requesting this loan so he can purchase drinks of all types to stock his business and be able to meet his customers' orders. He is grateful for the opportunity that he has been given to be able to continue selling.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Stellah is a single woman. She has 3 children.

She operates a restaurant which is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing food.

She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Sifa Group

texts.en:
Nsobi is in his late 30s and is married with three school-aged children. He has been running a business of selling electronic money transfers (m pesa and tigo pesa) for two years now. He works from 07am to 06pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Nsobi's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to increase the money transfers he does to serve more people. He dreams of expanding his business by selling other electronic money transfer services (like Airtel money, etc.)

Nsobi will share this loan with his loan group, Sifa, which consists of seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his money transfer services to serve more people.

loans.name: Rufiji Group

texts.en:
Rehema is in her early 30s and is married with four children. One of them is small and the other three are st school.

She has been selling clothes and hand bags for two years now. She works from 9am to 7pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Rehema's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy up-to-date clothes and handbags to meet her customers' interests. She dreams of expanding her business.

Reheman will share this loan with her loan group, Rujigi, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date clothes and hand bags to meet her customers' interests.

loans.name: Teófilo

texts.es: Don Teofilo se dedica a la venta de pescado, el producto lo hace llegar a sus clientes mediante su vehículo de transporte. Solicita un préstamo de dos mil cien dólares ($2,100), para realizar reparaciones necesarias en el garage de su vivienda, para proteger y dar seguridad al vehículo que utiliza para la venta del producto.
texts.en: Teofilo sells fish. He gets the product to his customers with his transport vehicle. He is asking for a loan of two thousand one-hundred dollars ($2,100), to make necessary repairs on the garage of his house to protect and provide security for the vehicle he uses to sell the product.

loans.use: to buy materials to make improvements on his garage.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as honest.

She operates a farm where she grows vegetables and other crops. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is a Kiva borrower. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and beauty products. She has been involved in this business for five years.

Her business is located in a strategic place, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will have a large business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Antonieta is 45 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Antonieta has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Antonieta requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to dry and sell.

Antonieta has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Antonieta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dry and sell.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 54 years old, and she is married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.
