Cynthia has a business selling fish crackers in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 23,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Cynthia has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rubia Concepcion

texts.es:
Rubia, se encuentra acompañada, vive con su pareja y dos hijas de 17 y 15 años de edad, con su pareja luchan para tener en su hogar lo necesario para que sus hijos tengan una vida digna; Rubia se dedica a vender ropa y tortillas, durante el día, no tiene un horario establecido, tiene esté negocio desde hace 5 años aproximadamente y no representa dificultades para mantenerse desarrollándolo.
El crédito que ha solicitado le servirá para comprar ropa, de esta manera tendrá su negocio más competitivo y sus clientes encontrarán lo que necesiten, no representa dificultades, ya que el producto no tiene riesgo de perecer.
Ella sueña con tener estabilidad económica y darle a sus hijos oportunidades de tener una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Rubia is in a relationship and lives with her partner and two daughters, aged 15 and 17. She and her partner work hard to ensure that their home has everything needed for their children to have a decent life. Rubia sells clothing and tortillas during the day, but has no fixed working hours. She has been running her business for about five years, and foresees no difficulties in keeping it going.

She has requested a loan to buy clothing, so that she can make her business more competitive, and that her customers will find what they need. This should pose no problems, as the product won't perish.

She dreams of having economic stability and being to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy clothing, so that she can make her business more competitive and ensure her customers find what they need.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Born in 1993, Ahmad, a Palestinian young man, lives with his mother and younger brothers in a camp for Palestinian refugees located in North Lebanon.

During the day, Ahmad works as an employee in the city of Tripoli. However, given that he is an responsible and ambitious person who does his best to improve his living situation as well as his family's, Ahmad opened a computer shop/internet cafe in the area where he lives three years ago.

Ahmad is asking for a 1,028,145 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva's partner, Ibdaa. He needs the loan to buy new computers which will allow him to create new accounts and attract more clients to his shop.

This loan will improve Ahmad's financial and social situation by increasing his income and profits. This will automatically reflect positively on his family's living conditions, too, which is Ahmad's main goal.

loans.use: to buy new computers

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. Her business is located in a strategic place, and her primary customers are locals.

Alice will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy water pipes to connect water to her home. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her life. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy water pipes to connect water to her home

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a female Kiva borrower. She has one child. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions, and other vegetables.

Rebecca has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be drought, which affects supply. She will use the loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy more stock of vegetables. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She has a clothing retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like blouses, pants, curtains and ready-to-wear clothing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Theresa dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, pants, curtains and ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Venus works hard to support her family.

She has a business of buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling firewood. Venus is borrowing 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her charcoal business.

Venus has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ramiro Segundo

texts.es: Ramiro es un microempresario domiciliado en un barrio de Cartagena de Indias un municipio de Bolívar que goza de atractivos turísticos por sus paradisiacas playas y su ciudad cargada de historia y de recuerdos hispánicos, en ella este emprendedor inició su negocio de reparación de llantas y su servicio inicia con la inspección; sí tiene una pinchadura o perdida de presión, quizás no sea necesario cambiarla, de ser posible repararla de acuerdo a técnicas cómo parches artesanales, cambio de válvula,  cambio de neumáticos entre otros.  Ramiro considera que sus servicios favorecen a la comunidad porque hasta los conductores más precavidos en cualquier recorrido pueden toparse con vidrios, clavos e incluso piedras filosas y generales un daño a sus llantas, sin embargo hacer un servicio de reparación a tiempo de la llanta pinchada o desinflada puede prolongar su vida útil. . Actualmente tramita su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que proyecta invertir en la compra de llantas de motocicletas y neumáticos.  Con esta inversión ofrecerá un servicio más oportuno.  Su meta a largo plazo es continuar en su negocio comprometido y ofreciendo un excelente servicio.
texts.en: Ramiro is a small businessman who lives in a neighborhood of Cartagena de Indias, a municipality of Bolívar, which has tourist attractions and heavenly beaches, and a city full of history and Spanish culture. Here, this motivated man started his business of wheel repair. His service starts with inspection. If there is a small hole in the tire or it has lost air, it might not be always necessary to change it. Rather, it would be fixed according to techniques such as handcrafted patches, valve change, tire change, among other services. Ramiro thinks that his services favor the community, because even the most careful drivers may find glass, nails, or even sharp rocks which may damage their tires.  However, having holes or flat tires fixed can make them last longer. Currently, he is applying to his first Credikiva with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He plans to use it to buy motorcycle wheels and tires. With this investment he will offer prompt service. His long term objective is to continue in his business and offer excellent service.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle wheels and tires.

loans.name: Naldis De Jesus

texts.es:
Naldis, actualmente vive con su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad, manifiesta no tener parientes en el extranjero que le ayuden con remesas, su actividad económica es la venta de pan y sorbetes de forma ambulante, tiene 5 años de tener su negocio, por lo que ya tiene clientela que prefieren sus productos.
El financiamiento le permitirá comprar al contado cajas de sorbete para trabajar por una larga temporada, de esta manera tendrá mayores ganancias y cubrirá las necesidades de su hogar.
 Sus aspiraciones son superarse y darles un ejemplo a sus hijos para que ellos también sean personas que aporten para tener una mejor sociedad.
texts.en:
Naldis lives with his wife and two minor children. He says he has no relatives abroad who help him with remittances. His financial activity is selling bread and sorbets as a street vendor. He has had his business for 5 years, because he has customers who prefer his products.

The loan will allow him to pay for boxes of sorbet upfront to work for a long season. This way, he will have more profits and cover the household needs.

His aspirations are to get ahead and be an example for his children so that they can also be people who contribute to having a better society.

loans.use: to pay for boxes of sorbet up front to work for a long season.

loans.name: Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS HORMIGUITAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gavina ella es soltera y tiene 35 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva plátanos, café, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These borrowers belong to the “LAS HORMIGUITAS” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Santa Ana, which belongs to the province of La Convención and the department of Cuzco.

The borrower named Gavina is single and 35 years old. She has 1 child. She works in her fruit growing business. She has a plot of land where she grows plantains, coffee, tangerines, and oranges. She works from 6:00 a.m until 5:00 p.m. She has had this business for several years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her cropland. She is asking for the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

The other members work in the business of selling animals, agriculture, a grocery store and a selling food.

Gavina is thankful to those who are a part of her dream in this way and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Apolinaria is 59 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Apolinaria has a buying and selling of herbal products business in the Philippines. Apolinaria requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more herbals to sell.

Apolinaria has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Apolinaria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more herbal products to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es:
Rosa, tiene un comedor donde vende desayunos y almuerzos, vive con dos hijos de 30 y 25 años de edad, además tiene bajo su responsabilidad a dos nietos de 14 y 10 años de edad, comenta que no tiene familiares en el extranjero; el negocio lo tiene desde hace 20 años, cuenta con una empelada, trabaja de seis de la mañana a tres de la tarde, aprendió a desarrollar esta actividad con la ayuda de su familia y no representa problemas para seguir trabajando.
El financiamiento le permitirá a Rosa comprar insumos para elaborar la comida que vende diariamente y el resto le servirá para remodelar el local del negocio, cambiara en totalidad el techo, pintara las paredes y otros arreglos que sean necesarios, la finalidad es tener una mejor presentación, atraer nuevos clientes y seguir contando con su fuente de ingresos, la dificultad que se aprecia es la delincuencia.
Sus aspiraciones son ampliar su negocio, generar nuevos ingresos y apoyar a sus nietos para que estudien.
texts.en:
Rosa has a dining room where she serves breakfast and lunch. She lives with her two children, aged 30 and 25, and is also responsible for two grandchildren, aged 14 and 10. She comments that she has no family living abroad. She has been running her business for 20 years, and works from 6am to 3pm. She learned how to run her business with the support of her family, and foresees no problems in continuing to work.

The loan will allow Rosa to buy supplies for making the food which she sells daily, and also to remodel her business premises by replacing the roof, painting the walls and making other necessary changes so that it looks more attractive and will attract new clients. She will be able to rely on future income, but also understands the difficulties that crime could present.

Her dream is to expand her business, generate new income, and be able to support her grandchildren so that they can have an education.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make the food she sells daily, and to remodel her store's premises.

loans.name: Liliosa

texts.es:
La Sra. Liliosa proviene de una familia muy humilde, vive en  la ciudad de Carapeguá,  muy joven formó pareja, se dedica a la venta de queso y es también vendedora ambulante en la zona.
Liliosa es una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha y se esfuerza por poder mejorar su vida de familia y darles una vida digna. 
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar sobrecamas, sabanas y otros productos y así seguir con la venta ambulante que hace, y poder así seguir cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Liliosa comes from a very humble family, and lives in the city of Carapeguá. She has been in a relationship since she was very young. She sells cheese, and is also a street vendor.

Liliosa is a very hard-working woman, who struggles hard to improve her family's wellbeing and ensure they have a good life.

She is requesting a loan to buy bedspreads, bed linen and other supplies, in order to continue working as a street vendor and be able keep up with customer demand.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, bed linen and other supplies.

loans.name: Jose Isidro

texts.es:
José, ha tenido una experiencia agradable al utilizar los créditos que solicita en Padeocmsm, nuevamente requiere de capital para comprar insumos agrícolas y concentrado para alimentar al ganado y los cerdos, podrá realizar la siembra de granos básicos en el tiempo indicado además seguirá cuidando de los animales de corral que posee.
El financiamiento anterioridad le ha sido de apoyo para que su negocio se mantenga y él pueda tener a su alcance los ingresos que necesita para cumplir con todas sus obligaciones financieras y familiares.
texts.en:
José, has had a pleasant previous experience with the loans he requests from Padeocmsm, and, once more he is in need of capital to buy agricultural supplies and concentrated feed for his cattle and pigs. He will be able to cultivate basic grains during the suitable time and, also, he will continue to take care of the farm animals he owns.
His previous loan allowed him to support his business and himself to meet his income needs for all his financial and family obligations.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and concentrated feed for his cattle and pigs.

loans.name: Omar Antonio

texts.es:
Omar ha utilizado el crédito anterior para que su negocio de cultivo de maíz y pipían siga creciendo, también dice que ha sido de mucho a apoyo para enfrentar la crisis por la falta de lluvia, en este momento se encuentra esperando que el cultivo de pipián que tiene en una manzana de terreno le dé una buena cosecha, ha enfrentado problemas de salud personal y de su familia, pero están recuperándose y luchando por salir adelante.
El nuevo crédito que está solicitando le ayudara a comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar los costos de preparación del terreno para sembrar maíz para venderlo en jilote, elote y en granos, espera que la cosecha sea mucho mejor que la anterior.
texts.en:
Omar utilized his previous loan so that his business cultivating maize and squash continues to grow. He also says that the loans have helped greatly to deal with the crisis caused by the lack of rain. In this moment he hopes that the cultivation of squash that he has on a block of land will give him a good yield. He has dealt with personal and family health problems, but he is recuperating and fighting to succeed.

The new loan that he is applying for will help him buy agricultural supplies and pay for the costs of preparing the loan to sow maize to sell young corn, regular corn, and corn seeds. He hopes that his crop will be much better than before.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies and pay for the costs of preparing the land to sow maize to sell young corn, regular corn and corn seed.

loans.name: Santos Estela

texts.es:
Santos utilizo el crédito anterior para poder variar la venta de mariscos, teniendo como resultado mejores ingresos y estilo de vida totalmente diferente al que tenía, ha iniciado a elaborar manualidades para vender y tener otro tipo de producto que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Ha decidido solicitar otra vez apoyo por medio de un crédito para poder comprar papelería, pegamento, alambre, etc., para elaborar flores, guirnaldas entre otras manualidades, está motivada por seguir mejorando su negocio y espera que sus ventas se mantengan.
texts.en:
Santos used her previous loan to expand her business beyond selling shellfish. As a result she has achieved higher earnings and a lifestyle completely different from what she had before. She has begun creating handcrafts to sell, and has a different kind of product to offer her customers.

She has decided to apply for another loan to buy paper, glue, wire, etc. for making flowers, garlands and other handcrafts. She is motivated to continue to improve her business, and hopes to maintain her level of sales.

loans.use: to purchase paper, glue, wires, etc. for making paper flowers, garlands and other seasonal gifts and decorations.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea and also keeps cows. She has been involved in this business for 6 years now. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en: Genoveva is 45 years old, married with five children. Two of her children are in school and she is a very hard working entrepreneur. Genoveva has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Genoveva has requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell. Genoveva has been in this business for 24 years now. In the future, Genoveva would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 30-year-old mother of five children. She  lives in Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days now, his rickshaw has not been working properly and because of this, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair his rickshaw as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to buy a loading rickshaw body. Therefore, Abida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, in order to help her husband cover the cost of the rickshaw body. This will help him to continue his business. Abida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a loading rickshaw body for her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Calal

texts.en: Calal is a 33-year-old married man and he has 3 kids. Calal is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar region. He buys and sells cattle - this helps him to earn a living. He buys calves and bullocks, and then sells them for a profit after fattening them. This is his main source of income. His wife, who works at the market, helps him with the business. Calal  wants to get a loan of 1200 AZN in order to purchase more cattle and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle and expand his business.

loans.name: Ñane Mbae Teete Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Ñane Mbae teete  está en su ciclo 14 del programa de comité de mujeres, 19 integrantes de las cuales todas trabajan en variadas actividades. Todas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando y esforzándose  por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias. 
Cada una de las integrantes de este grupo está luchando y se está esforzando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Dolly, una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, ella es empleada y también se dedica a la venta de carbón, y por medio de sus actividades se gana la vida de una manera digna y honesta.
Dolly pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de carbón en cantidad, y de esa forma poder tener su producto para la venta, y así seguir cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The Ñane Mbae Teete Group is in its 14th loan cycle in a women's committee program. The group has nineteen members, all of whom work at various different occupations. All of them are part of a program to eliminate poverty, and struggle hard to be able to improve living conditions for themselves and their families.

Among the group's members is Dolly, who is hard-working and enterprising. She has a job, and also sells coal, earning a living with dignity and honesty.

Dolly is requesting a loan to buy coal wholesale, so that she has supplies to be able to sell and fulfill her customer orders. She is very grateful for the opportunity she has received to continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy coal in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is 38 years old and has three children. She is married and has three children, who are in school. Mary Ann is in the poultry business in the Philippines. Mary Ann has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins to raise her chickens. Mary Ann has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins to raise her chickens

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures such as selling sea shells. Violeta dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business as well as to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo acude a Padecomsm nuevamente, por el apoyo que siente que se le brinda cuando lo necesita, solicita un crédito con el que comprara una caja de velocidades para el vehículo que maneja los fines de semana, ya que da el servicio de chofer, y los costos de los daños que sufre la unidad cuando él lo maneja son descontados de su sueldo.
Para Eduardo el crédito anterior le sirvió para cubrir otros costos de reparaciones a vehículos que utiliza cuando da su el servicio de motorista, ha logrado mantener su negocio, cancelar su deuda, mejorar sus ingresos y estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Eduardo comes to Padecomsm once again for the help that he feels they provide when he needs it. He is applying for a loan with which he will buy a gearbox for the vehicle he drives on the weekends, since he provides driver services and the costs of damage to the unit when he uses it are deducted from his pay.

For Eduardo the previous loan helped him to cover other costs of repairs to vehicles that he uses when he provides driver services. He has succeeded in maintaining his business, repaying his debt, and improving his earnings and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a gearbox for the vehicle he drives on the weekends for his chauffeur service.

loans.name: Reginah

texts.en: Reginah is 41 years old and lives in rural Mpigi as a single mother. She has four children. She has been operating a food stall where she sells mainly vegetables. Her house has been affected by a hail storm and the roof was partly destroyed. So Reginah has applied for a loan request to reroof the house so she will buy new iron sheets. She hopes to be able provide her children with the best of life conditions; Reginah is very grateful to everyone who helps her.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for re-roofing her house.

loans.name: Muthanga

texts.en: Muthanga is a married woman. She has 4 children and describes herself to be ambitious. Muthanga operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years now. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of clothes.

Consolata will use this 30,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have more business outlets within five years. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Angel Enrique

texts.es:
Angel es hombre trabajor que tiene 37 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con la madre. Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de papas y mais ademas cria ganado, cerdos y pollos, el dinero lo solicita para la compra de vacas para que den leche y alimento para los pollos y cerdos como son los balanceados de engorde y crianza.

El sueño de Angel es comprar un terreno para seguir sembrando, en los tiempos libres se dedica a conversar con la gente de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Angel is a hardworking 37-year-old man who is single and has no children. He lives with his mother. He makes a living farming, growing potatoes and maize and also breeding cattle, pigs and chickens. He is applying for a loan to buy cows so that they will give milk and feed for the chickens and pigs so that they will be balanced for growing and breeding.

Angel's dream is to buy land to continue cultivating, and he spends his free time talking with other people in the community.

loans.use: to buy cows so that they will provide milk and feed for the chicken and pigs so that they will have a balanced diet for growing and breeding.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn is 39 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, Merlyn works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items for resale such as junk foods, home care products as well as other groceries. Merlyn has been in this business for 5 years now and sells a variety of items. In the future, Merlyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items for resale such as junk foods, home care products as well as other groceries.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a widowed woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Norma is 52 years old now.

Norma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 27 years. Norma requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy a variety of fish to sell. In the future, Norma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is requesting a loan in order to pay his children's school fees. He is the father of 6 children and 2 dependents, all whom attend school. Robert lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a cocoa plantation, where he gets an income to earn a living and support his family. He is hardworking and determined to take his business to a level of self sustainability. Robert performs contracts with the district to get additional income, though he complains of low returns to finance his businesses. He hopes to raise enough money through his endless efforts and educate his children to the university level. Robert will use the loan facility to pay the school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Angela Del Rosario

texts.es:
Ángela, vive junto a su familia, ella tiene la responsabilidad de cubrir las necesidades que puedan surgir en su hogar, para generar ingresos ella elabora tortillas para vender, lo tiene ubicado en su casa desde hace 4 años, su riesgo más evidente es la delincuencia de la zona.
El crédito lo utilizara para comprar maíz en mayor cantidad, será de ayuda para mejorar la productividad de su negocio, atender a sus clientes como ellos se merecen y tendrá mejores ganancias.
Su sueño es construir su vivienda con materiales que le den mayor protección a su familia.
texts.en:
Angela, who lives with her family, is responsible for covering household costs. She generates income by making tortillas to sell. Her business has been located in her home for the last four years. The biggest risk to the business is the crime in the area.

She will use the loan to buy corn in larger quantities, which will help her to improve productivity, give her customers the service they deserve, and thus increase her earnings.

Her dream is to be able to build her home with materials which will provide better protection for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn in larger quantities, which will help her to improve her business productivity.

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es: Don Celestino trabaja en labores agrícolas.El solicita un préstamo de dos mil cien dólares ($2,100), para la compra de un vehículo que le permita transportar sus productos agrícolas y comercializarlos en el mercado, de esta manera poder vender sus cosechas y aumentar los ingresos provenientes de esta actividad.
texts.en: Celestino works in agricultural labor. He requests a loan of two thousand one hundred dollars ($2,100), to buy a vehicle that will allow him to transport his agricultural goods and sell them in the market. In this way he will be able to sell his crops and increase his earnings from this activity.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Norma Yolanda

texts.es:
Norma es una mujer joven de 22 años de edad ella es soltera aun no tiene hijos vive con los padres. Ella se dedica a la agricultura junto con su madre ellas siembran papas y maiz a demas tienen chanchos y pollos, el dienro lo solicita para la comprar de ganado vacuno y alimento para crianza y ençgorde de chanchos, ya que tienen suficiente espacio como para criarles.

Ellas son muy felices cuidando de estos animalitos, el suñoo de ellas es comprar una casita propia, en los tiempos libres disfrutan viendo la television juntas.
texts.en:
Norma is a young, 22-year-old single woman. She does not yet have children and lives with her parents. She makes a living farming with her mother. They grow potatoes and maize, and also have pigs and chickens. She requests money to buy food for cattle and breeding and fattening of pigs, since they have sufficient space to raise them.

They are very happy caring for these animals. Their dream is to buy a small house of their own. In their free time they watch television together.

loans.use: to buy food for cattle and raising and fattening of pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more vegetables such as cabbages, carrots, tomatoes, water spinach, chilies, etc.

loans.name: Marian

texts.en: Marian is a married woman with three children: two attend school in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is a cocoa trader mainly buying cocoa to sell along with selling foodstuffs from her market stall for additional income. She started her business in the cocoa trade in 2011 with the aim of taking care of her family needs. She also grows cocoa on family land and harvests it for sale to cocoa companies. She requests a loan to buy cocoa seeds to sell and pursue her family dream of educating her children to university.

loans.use: to buy cocoa seeds to sell.

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.ru: Мухабат простая и добрая женщина из Хуросонского района. Она замужем и мать четверых детей. Муж Мухабат работает таксистом. Сама Мухабат занимается животноводством. Таким образом, они живут. У них нет высшего образования, но они желают, чтобы их дети получили его и стали образованными людьми. Они накопили некоторую сумму, однако не хватает еще немного денег. С этим намерением Мухабат обратилась за кредитом. Она мечтает, что её сын будет хорошим специалистом. Пожалуйста, помогите Мухабат осуществить свою мечту и мечту ее сына. Спасибо!
texts.en: Muhabat is a simple and kind woman from the Khuroson region. She is married and has four children. Her husband works as a taxi driver and she works in animal husbandry. In such a way they live. Neither of them has a higher education but they want their children to receive one and become educated people. They have saved some money but it isn't enough. Therefore Muhabat is looking for a loan. She dreams that her son will be a successful professional. Please help her achieve her dream and the dream of her son. Thank you!

loans.use: to pay her son's university tuition

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita, 56 years old, is a married woman with four children. Her youngest child is 16 and still attending school. Her main source of income is raising and selling pigs. Her husband's occupation is carpenter. She is facing financial problems and in need of funds to support her livelihood.

Anita has decided to ask for a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos to buy piglets. In this way, she will increase the number of pigs to sell in a few months to come. Thus, she will be able to handle her income and provide for the needs of her children.

Anita is hoping that she can continue finance the schooling of her children by expanding her hog raising business to improve the family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Capis

texts.en: Capis is a married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 20 years. He describes himself to be resilient. He operates a farm where he grows sugarcane. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are sugar factories. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy farm inputs. His business goal is to have a large scale business within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables, bananas and other crops. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. Her business goal is to have a large scale business within 5 years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Mai Group

texts.en:
Lerng understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Lerng knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Lerng purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Lerng is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: terto purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking wa.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en: Peris is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future, she will have a large scale business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 44 years old and married with three children.

Marilou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marilou successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothes.

Marilou aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, coffee, milk, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Gemma dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, coffee, milk, etc.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gemma works hard to support her family.

She has a drugstore business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Gemma is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of medicine for her drugstore business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of medicine for her drugstore

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is a hardworking male entrepreneur with four children.

He has a home products retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of home products to sell.

He industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming rice and a general store.

Rolando dreams that one day, He will be able to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of home products to sell.

loans.name: Los Gigantes De Santiago De Chacan Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS GIGANTES DE SANTIAGO DE CHACAN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco

La socia es la Sra. Alicia ella es soltera y tiene 27 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Los Gigantes de Santiago de Chacan." This bank is located in the district of Anta, which in the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Alicia is single, is 27 years old, and has 1 son. She works in business selling cereals; she sells corn, wheat, and quinoa. She works from 8:00am until 5:00pm. She has spent 4 years working on this business, and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a location where she can sell cereals. She requests the loan to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa.

The other members are dedicated to businesses selling cereals, selling animals, running a grocery store, and running a restaurant.

The member is thankful to those who make up part of this dream by funding the loan, and she promises to make her repayments according to the repayment schedule.

loans.use: buy wheat, corn, and quinoa.

loans.name: Mayra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mayra tiene 21 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas ademas cria pollos para luego venderlos, el dinero los solicita para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para el cuidado de los cultivos.

En los tiempos libres libres le gusta hacer deporte ademas disfruta mucho las fiestas navideñas.
texts.en:
Mayra is 21 years old and is single with no children. She is dedicated to agriculture, specifically growing potatoes as well as raising chickens to sell.

The money she requests is to buy manure and fertilizers for her crops.

In her free time, she likes to play sports, and she enjoys Christmas parties.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lider

texts.es:
Lider es un hombre de 28 años de edad, soltero, tiene un hijo de 8 meses y su negocio es la panadería. 
Él es buen padre, constante y muy activo. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por albergar a los sobrevivientes del desborde del rio años atrás.
Lides es de piel morena, baja estatura y físico delgado. su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español, su vida la comparte con sus familiares que trabajan viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la panadería, él se dedica a la panadería tradicional como; cuñapes, arepas, roscas y otros, “horneo durante las noches y durante el día vendo ambulantemente…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de harinas y otros insumos. Su sueño es tener su propia casa, el desea comprar harina e insumos de panadería por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lider solicita un préstamo para la compra de  harina para hornear pan tradicional.
texts.en:
Lider is a 28-year-old man, is single, and has an 8-month-old son. His business is a bakery

He is a good father, diligent, and very active. His business is in the "Plan 3000" neighborhood, characterized by being home to the survivors of river flooding years ago.

Líder has brown skin, a short stature, and thin physique. His mother tongue is Guaraní, and he speaks Spanish. He shares his life with family members who work and live in a house belonging to the family. The house is made of brick and has all basic services.

His business is a bakery. He is dedication to traditional baking, making cuñapes (cheese bread balls), arepas, roscas (bagel-shaped bread), and other things. He says that he bakes at night, and sells his products in the street during the day. The advantage of his business is that he makes daily sales. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy flour and other supplies. His dream is to have his own house. He wants to buy flour and supplies for baking wholesale. This is his first sequence of loans with the institution in the 3 years he has been doing this work.

It is for these reasons that Lider requests a loan to buy flour to bake traditional bread.

loans.use: to buy flour to bake traditional bread.

loans.name: Monise

texts.fr: Monise a 36 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère de trois enfants. Elle revend des sucreries. Quoique très petite, l’activité l’aide à gagner les revenus nécessaires pour prendre soin de sa famille. Mais son rêve est de parvenir à être autonome financièrement. Elle cherche un appui financier pour pouvoir développer son commerce au fur et à mesure.
texts.en: Monise is 36. She is divorced with three children. She sells sweets. Although her business is small, it enables her to earn sufficient income to take care of her family. However, her dream is to become financially autonomous. She is looking for financial support to develop her business little by little.

loans.use: to buy bags of sweets and biscuits.

loans.name: Emma

texts.fr: Emma, 45 ans, est commerçante de produits alimentaires. Mariée et mère de trois enfants, elle est très expérimentée dans la vente en détail. Pour mener son activité, elle a préparé un espace dans la maison familiale, avec l’aide de son mari, pour arranger les marchandises. Elle a beaucoup de clients, mais sa boutique tombe souvent en rupture de stock. Elle demande un microcrédit pour acheter du riz, de la farine et du riz pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Emma is 45. She sells food products. She is married with three children and is very experienced in retail sales. To run her business, with her husband's help she has fitted out an area in her home to arrange her merchandise. She has many customers, but her business often runs out of stock. She requests a micro credit to buy rice and flour to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar and crates of oil.

loans.name: Jean

texts.fr: Jean a 52 ans. Il a deux enfants. Il gère une activité qui lui permet de gagner un revenu. Il vend des produits de première nécessité sur le bord de la route depuis plus de 9 ans. Il demande un microcrédit pour mieux approvisionner ses stocks. A l’avenir, il espère augmenter ses ventes et ainsi subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Jean is 52. He has two children. He runs a business that enables him to earn a living. He has been selling basic necessities on the side of the road for over nine years. He requests a micro credit to manage his stock more efficiently. In the future, he hopes to increase his sales and in this way provide for his children.

loans.use: to buy crates of milk.

loans.name: Nataly Yamileth

texts.es:
Nataly, elabora quesadillas para para vender, para ella está actividad es la generadora de ingresos, su negocio está funcionando desde hace seis años, ya tiene clientela establecida; vive junto a sus hijos y no cuenta con el apoyo económico de sus parientes.
Invertirá el capital en la compra de leche, levadura, cuajada, huevos, canela y otros materiales para preparar las quesadillas, abastecerá su inventario para tener una producción mayor y cubrir las demandas de sus clientes, tiene la esperanza que sus ingresos se estabilicen y así pueda disminuir las necesidades de su familia.
Nataly tiene la visión de mantenerse trabajando, sacar a sus hijos adelante y que estos sean en un futuro profesionales.
texts.en:
Nataly makes quesadillas to sell. For her this activity is her generator of income. Her business has been functioning for six years and she has an established clientele. She lives together with her children and she does not have the economic support of her parents.

She will invest the capital in the purchase of milk, yeast, curd, eggs, cinnamon and other materials to prepare quesadillas. She wants to stock her inventory to have greater production and cover the demand from her clients. She hopes that her income will stabilize and in this way diminish the needs of her family.

Nataly has the idea of continuing to work, getting her children ahead so that in the future they can be professionals.

loans.use: to buy milk, yeast, curd, eggs, cinnamon and other materials to prepare quesadillas.

loans.name: Avaz

texts.en:
Avaz is 50 years old. He and his family are Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) and they live in an IDP settlement. His wife is a housekeeper. For the past 15 years, Avaz has raised livestock, such as sheep and cows. He sells milk, meat, and sheep wool at the local bazaar and earns 230 AZN monthly.

The region where Avaz lives is very cold in autumn. That’s why the demand for wool is very high. People make coats, jackets, gloves, and socks to keep themselves warm. They also use meat to prepare dishes every day and drink milk because it is healthy.

Avaz wants to increase his income because his current earnings are not enough to cover expenses. He applied for a 1200 AZN loan in order to buy more livestock.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Maria Manuela

texts.es:
Maria tiene 29 años de edad es soltera tiene un bebe de 1 año vive con la madre. Se dedica a lña agricultura a la siembra de papas, maiz quinua y naranjilla ademas a la crianza de pollos cerdos y un poco de ganado vacuno.

El dinero lo solicita para la comprar de semillas de naranjilla, fertilizantes, y abonos para el cuidar el cultivo.

El sueño de Maria es poder comprarse una casa para vivir con la madre y el hijo en los tiempos libres le gusta ver la television.
texts.en:
Maria is 29 years old, single and has a one year old baby. She lives with her mother. She works in agriculture growing potatoes, corn, quinoa and narajillas (little oranges). She also raises chickens, pigs and some cattle.


The money she is requesting is to purchase naranjilla seeds, fertilizer and manure to care for her crops.


Maria's dream is to be able to buy a house to live with her mother and son. In her free time she likes to watch television.

loans.use: to buy narajilla (a local fruit), fertilizer and manure to care for her crops.

loans.name: Thaheua Group

texts.en:
Teryang’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Teryang and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.

Teryang and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Teryang’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una sala de belleza ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 3 años, tiene muchos clientes por su buen trabajo, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: The youth with her face pixelated is 23 years old and lives in a high risk zone. She has had a beauty salon in her house for three years and she has many clients due to her good work. She lives in her own house with her life companion. She is requesting a loan to buy creams, shampoo, hair clips and scissors amongst other things that she needs. Doing this she will be able to make greater profits which will help her to have more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoo, hair clips and scissors amongst other things.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen owns and operates an agriculture business growing coconuts for sale. Helen has been engaged in this business for many years and she earns sufficiently from these activities.  Her farm is still doing well and yet, she needs financial assistance to improve it. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro to pay for labor costs of harvesting the coconuts. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs of harvesting coconuts.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy seeds to plant. Her business goal is to have a large scale business within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant

loans.name: Elizebeth

texts.en: Elizebeth is a hard-working widow and mother of 4 children who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She earns a living from rental income alongside selling coffee, sugar cane, and bananas, working at least 8 hours a day. She needed to find a way to earn money after her husband died, since he had been solely responsible for the family's needs. She started to continue the work of her late husband, including the construction of rental houses, which had stalled. Therefore, Elizebeth is looking for funds to purchase materials to construct rental houses.

loans.use: to construct rental houses.

loans.name: Hyginu's Group

texts.en:
Hyginus is 40 years old and a father of 4. He lives with his wife, a small trader. At his home, he processes palm oil annually for the local market, rears chickens, pigs and also cultivates vegetable for the local market. His major problem is finance to enable him utilize his wisdom to generate more income.

As a full member of Nke-Anyi Farmers Multipurpose Cooperative Society, he is presently volunteering as a unit head of the cooperative. Income he hopes to generate from this loan will help him build more chicken houses, stock more birds and also support his family, especially that of paying his children's school fees. Hyginus and all his group members appreciate all Kiva lenders who support this loan.

loans.use: to process and store palm oil products.

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
María, de 48 años de edad, no fue a la escuela, está soltera, tiene 5 hijos pero todos están acompañados, solo vive con ella su hijo menor de 11 años de edad, quien asiste a la escuela.

María, se dedica a la recolección de conchas marinas (curiles) desde hace 34 años, el trabajo lo heredo de su familia y actualmente es de ese trabajo que obtiene el sustento diario, el mangle donde van a recolectar las conchas está a 2 kilómetros de su vivienda y viajan en lancha, el horario de trabajo es de 5:00 a.m. se levanta hacer el desayuno para ella y su hijo y al trabajo entra a las 6:00 a.m. y regresa a las 11:00 a.m. y luego hace los quehaceres del hogar como, lavar, barrer, limpieza, etc.
 
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar gaseosas, golosinas y dulces, porque quiere iniciar un pequeño negocio vendiendo este tipo de productos, pero siempre seguir recogiendo conchas marinas para vender también.

El sueño de María, es poder mejorar su vivienda y ayudar a su hijo para que se prepare academicamente.
texts.en:
Maria is 48 years old, did not go to school, is single, and has 5 kids who are all in relationships.  She lives only with her youngest son, who is 11 years old and goes to school.  

Maria gathers clams for a living (curiles), and has done so for 34 years.  She inherited this line of work from her family, and it's currently how she gets her daily sustenance.  The mangrove swamp where they collect the clams is 2 kilometers from her home, and they go there in a boat.  Her workday schedule involves getting up at 5:00 AM to make breakfast for her and her son, leaving for work at 6:00 AM, getting back at 11:00 AM, and then doing chores around the house, such as washing laundry, sweeping, cleaning, etc.

She'll use the loan to buy carbonated soft drinks, candies and sweets as she wants to start a small business selling these kinds of goods, but will always continue to gather clams to sell as well.

Maria's dream is to be able to improve her home and help her son prepare himself academically.

loans.use: buy carbonated soft drinks, candies and sweets to start a small business

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a hard working mother. She has six children. Her youngest child is 17. Two of her children are still attending school.

She raises hogs to support her family. She has been engaged in selling hogs for more than ten years now. She needs capital to improve her main source of income.

She has requested a loan to purchase piglets and feeds. It could enable her to maximize the resources and start to raise quality hogs. Thus, her income will augment and she could start to expand and roll-out her capital.

Beatriz is determined that she could be able to continue send her children to school to provide them with better future and coupled with hard work to improve her livelihood for the welfare of her family .

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics, lotions, and clothes among other items, which she sells by catalog, considering that having a better inventory will better satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man. He has six children. Their ages range from 4 years to 18 years old. He describes himself as God-fearing.

Stephen operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in a good area. He will use the KES 29,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 32-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of one child, and her husband has been doing a scrap recycling business.

Shabana's husband needs to buy scrap material in bulk to recycle but due to some financial constraints her husband is not in a suitable position to buy the scrap in bulk. Therefore Shabana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

This loan will enable her husband to purchase the scrap material in bulk so that he can easily adopt the recycling procedure and earn a profitable income derived from his business.

Shabana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to increase her husband's scrap recycling business.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a 29-year-old lady and a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own shoe business for the past eight years.

Zainab's husband needs to purchase different types of shoes (e.g Bata, Servis, Borjan, etc.) for his business. However, due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase this merchandise.

To fulfill her husband's needs, Zainab has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will help her husband to buy this merchandise for his business. This will be good for him to earn more income and it will enable him to fulfill his family's needs.

Zainab is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband expand his shoes business.

loans.name: Mubina

texts.en:
Mubina is a 40-year-old married woman. She is a mother of seven children. She is in the business of manufacturing boxes which are used for multiple purposes. She has tremendous skill in making them and has become famous in her community, catering to a large number of customers.

She makes enough to provide for her family. Her husband also assists her by selling them in the town. In order to expand her business, Mubina contacted Kashf Foundation and requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase hard boards, cardboard, glue, and scissors, along with cutters, in large quantities to increase her sales.

She wishes to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to purchase hard boards, cardboard, glue, and scissors, along with cutters, in large quantities to increase her sales.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo); he also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years.

She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices, and juices to handle the increasing demands of her customers efficiently to get a boost in her earnings for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices, and juices to handle the increasing demands of her customers efficiently.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is married with two children. He operates a retail shop and also earns a government salary. Through this work, he is able to meet his family's needs.

Julius desires to improve his commercial house and fully furnish it. He wants to pay school fees for his children as well. Julius has failed to get full installments for his children. Therefore, he is requesting money to pay school fees for children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida, 35, is married. She has been in the beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials. By providing her best services, she has become very famous on her street.

To meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a greater variety of cosmetics for the beauty parlor. This is why she has applied for a loan of 40,000 Pakistani rupees. She will use the loan to buy skin products, hair care products and hair rollers to serve more customers, thus increase her profits and build her own house.

loans.use: to buy skin products, hair care products and hair rollers to serve more customers, thus increase her profits and build her own house.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is married with children; he operates a retail shop, which also acts like a tea room. Apart from that, Wilson also does farming as a business. He has managed to build rentals out of what he does.He used the previous loan to buy building materials such as cement and bricks to add more rentals and he is very grateful for the funds.

He desires to educate his children so much that he will go an extra mile for them. Wilson lacks some money to complete payment of his children’s school fees. He requests for money to pay his children's school fees for this semester and nothing can stop him from paying back the loan in installments. The fact is that he is a committed man of his word.

loans.use: to pay his children's school fees for this semester.

loans.name: Edmarben

texts.en:
Edmarben is a 31-year-old man, who lives in the City of Baybay, Leyte, Philippines. He is married and has two children ages seven and two years old.

He raises his family by doing various businesses such as welding shop, barber shop, and often times he drove his “habal-habal” (local term for motorcycle with extended seat), just to earn a living.

Edmarben works hard to provide for the needs of his family. He plans in the future to own a welding shop to improve his livelihood and have better means of living. Thus, he is asking for a loan to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine

loans.name: Jahana

texts.en:
Jahana, 57 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo). They offer a variety of daily use products and have a good client base.

In order to avoid shortages, Jahana needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 60,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at their store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc to consistently meet the increasing demand at the store and make better earnings.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is 45 year old married woman living with her spouse and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a shop where he sells chicken. His daily practice is to buy broilers from the market, prepare chicken and then sell it from his shop.

Recently he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills which reduced his purchasing power for new inventory. Due to a shortage of money, he is compelled to borrow money but no one will lend to him. This is the reason that Sughran has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy broilers for producing chicken to sell from his shop.

She dreams of providing all the facilities of life to her children.

loans.use: to buy broilers for her husband's chicken shop.

loans.name: Dora Ruth

texts.es:
Dora, de 47 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la crianza de cerdos, aves de corral y ganado, estudio hasta segundo grado, pero por diversos problemas no pudo continuar; está acompañada y junto a su pareja ha procreado tres hijos.

Dora, tiene experiencia en estas actividades que desempeña, porque desde pequeña aprendió, porque sus padres criaban cerdos, para tener ingresos porque eran de escasos recursos económicos.- Dora, actualmente tiene tres cerdos y una vaca de la cual obtiene leche y ella elabora queso para vender.

El dinero del préstamo lo necesita para comprar dos terneros para seguir trabajando y ampliar más su negocio, a manera de generar más ingresos, los cuales serán de mucha utilidad para los gastos de la familia y en la educación de sus hijos y para comprar concentrado para los cerdos y comprar más para engordarlos.

Dora, sueña con construir una vivienda digna para su familia, porque en la que vive es de lámina y además desea que sus hijos estudien hasta que se gradúen de la universidad q y tengan mayores oportunidades de empleo.
texts.en:
Dora, 47 years old, dedicates herself to household chores and the raising of pigs, chicken and cattle. She studied up to second grade, but for various reasons could not continue. She is in a relationship and has had three children with her partner.

Dora has experience in the work she does. She learned the trade as a child because her parents bred pigs as a form of income, since their financial resources were scarce. Dora currently has three pigs and a cow, from which she gets milk and makes cheese to sell.

She needs the loan in order to buy two calves to continue working and growing her business in order to earn a higher income. This will be very useful to cover family expenses, the education of her children, and to buy concentrated feed for the pigs and buy more to fatten them up.

Dora dreams of building a decent home for her family, because the one they live in is made of metal sheets. She also wishes that her children will graduate from university and have better employment opportunities.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Umera

texts.en:
Umera, 34, is married and runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sews the cloth and sells her products to people in her area. She always has a great selection of products to offer and she earns a good income, which contributes to her family's well-being. The garment-selling business has enabled Nusrat to earn money for her household, thus ease the expenses and improve her family's standard of living.

To improve her business, Umera has requested a loan of 55,000 Pakistani rupees. She will use the loan to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colours to meet customer demand consistently, thus increase her net income to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colours to meet customer demand consistently, thus increase her net income to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.name: You Raise Me Up - N06Tsơn1Psơn Group

texts.en:
Nguyên is 52 years old and she is married.

She has had a service business providing internet cafe services for one year.

Nguyên lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village; moreover the market need is low in this region. And because nowadays most people have computer or smartphone and internet, her income is unstable.

The main hardship that Nguyên faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more computers to expand her business.

In 2012, Nguyên joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Nguyên has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa micro-finance institution. She is the group leader of "You raise me up - N06TSơn1PSơn", which consists of four members.

In the future, Nguyên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more computers to expand her business.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is 44 years old. She is married and has five children.

Her business is farming and also selling fruits. She has been in the business for six years.

She earns a monthly income of thirty thousand Kenya shillings. This is her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya to buy seeds, fertilizer, and an irrigation system.

She will use the profits from the expanded business to buy a cow.

Her hopes and dreams are to be successful in business and to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and an irrigation system.

loans.name: Nduku

texts.en:
Nduku is 35 years old. She is married and has two children.

Her business is farming and selling fruits, mostly oranges and papayas. She has been in the business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of ninety thousand KES (Kenya shillings).

This is her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stocks of oranges and papayas.

She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to provide well for her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of oranges and papayas.

loans.name: Linah

texts.en:
Linah is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be ambitious.

She operates a retail business where she sells potatoes, tomatoes, kale, and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of products.

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Marsela

texts.en:
Marsela is a married woman. She operates a retail business where she sells potatoes, tomatoes, kale, and other vegetables.

She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be competition.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Ales

texts.en:
Like for many women, financial constraints played a potent factor in encouraging Ales to approach Kashf Foundation in search of a loan. Ales, 56, is married and a mother of three children. To help her husband in taking care of the family, she began a business selling milk. She owns buffaloes for milking and she is known in her town for providing good quality milk.

Ales is happily supporting her family with the income she generats. She has requested a loan of 40,000 Pakistani rupees to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida is a married woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business selling cloth. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and provide for their education.

Rashida is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors and earn substantial profits through this investment.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a Kiva borrower. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be reliable.

Grace operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy salon equipment.

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 54 year old, married lady woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community.

Some years ago she started her tailoring business to help run her household activities. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide the income for her family's everyday expenses. She has now requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for stitching up more dresses on time to get a boost in her earnings. She wishes to spend it on providing a quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Due to poor financial circumstances, Rubina needed to start her own business for meeting her household financial expenditures. She is a 48-year-old, married woman and a mother of five children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community.

Rubina has been in this business for many years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help Rubina continue operationing her business, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy stitching materials, such as spools of thread in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons, etc. to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching materials, such as spools of thread in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons, etc. to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 13 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the KES 26,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 34-year-old married woman. Her financial condition is not good. She has to think many times to start any task.

Previously, her husband was working in a small firm for low wages. Now, her husband has just started to drive a moto-rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw that includes a motorbike). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads and for short distances. Its body is made of polyester, which is not strong enough to withstand the bumpy roads. Now, the rickshaw body needs to be replaced because it rattles when driven. This is the reason he wants to buy a new body for his moto-rickshaw.

Razia has requested a loan so that her husband can buy the moto-rickshaw body and drive it smoothly.

Razia thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a body for her husband's moto-rickshaw.

loans.name: Icela Del Carmen

texts.es: Icela de 25 años de edad, vive junto a su madre. Icela es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, ella trabaja como asistente dental, labor que desempeña aproximadamente desde hace 3 años, siendo así este el medio por el cual logra cubrir sus necesidades básicas y las de su madre. Icela solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: hierro, duralita y en mano de obra para cambiar el techo de su casa, para poder estar más tranquila y segura en esta época de lluvia.
texts.en:
Icela, 25 years old, lives with her mother. Icela is a very responsible and hardworking person. She works as a dental assistant, a job that she started approximately 3 years ago, this being the means by which she achieves covering her basic needs and those of her mother.

Icela is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: iron, roofing material and labor to change the roof of her house, to be able to be more peaceful and secure in this rainy season.

loans.use: to invest in: iron, roofing material and labor to change the roof of her house.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 55 years old. He is married and has three children. His business is farming and livestock keeping.

He has been in this business for six years. He earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

This is his second loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy cattle and goats to rear and sell later at a profit.

He will use the profits from the expanded business to open a butchery for selling goat meat.

His hopes and dreams are to have a successful business, educate his children, and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy cattle and goats to rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
