This farmer from Lchashen village in the Gegharkunik region lives with his wife and two pretty daughters. This will be his third Kiva loan, and he will be thankful for the support again this time.

For a long time, Harutyun worked as a driver, which he then gave up. Now, he is busy only with farming and agriculture. On his farm, he takes care of cows, calves, a bull, pigs and sheep. On his plot of land, he cultivates potatoes and grains, both of which he sells at the city’s wholesale market, along with an assortment of his farm products, such as milk, cheese, butter and some meat.

Harutyun is thankful in advance for this Kiva loan, which he wants to use to purchase animal fodder for all of his farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase animal fodder for all of his farm cattle.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a large business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 57 years old. She is married and has three children.

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for ten years. She earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

This is her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase water pipes and pay for ploughing the farm.

She will use the profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to purchase  water pipes for ploughing the farm

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be patient.

He operates a posho mill where he sells maize flour. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of maize. His business goal is to open another outlet within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be hardworking.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is married with children. He operates a retail shop as his only source of income. His shop helps him meet his family's needs. Emmanuel would love to add food to his stock to attract more customers and also improve his income. He requests a loan to buy food to sell, such as bananas, potatoes and rice. He would anticipate an increase in income despite complaints about price fluctuations for food basics during peak seasons and times of scarcity.

loans.use: to buy food to sell, such as bananas, potatoes and rice.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 55 years old, married, and has six children, one of whom is in school.

Alejandra is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for eleven years.

In the future, Alejandra would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Zohrap

texts.en:
Despite many hardships in farming, this cheerful farmer earns his living through farming and agricultural works. Zohrap is 40 years old. He lives in the village of Tsovagyugh, in the Gegharkunik region, with his wife and two school-aged children.

Zohrap’s wife works as a baker at a bread factory and she also helps her husband on their farm. On his farm, Zohrap has cows, calves, bulls, sheep, and chickens. Zohrap has farm products for sale such as milk, meat, cheese, and eggs. He also earns an income from potato cultivation.

Zohrap mentions that he lives happily in his native village and he would like to make his farm richer with cattle. Therefore, with his Kiva loan, he wants to buy one more cow and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Nosheen

texts.en:
Nosheen is a 28-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. He sells fruits such as apples, bananas, grapes, etc. Her husband is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Nosheen's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in a condition to purchase fruits for his business purposes.

Therefore Nosheen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to increase his fruit business.

loans.name: Jafarbay

texts.en:
Jafarbay is 66 years old. He lives with his family in the district of Shahrituz. Jafarbay is a hardworking and responsible person. He is engaged in farming and livestock husbandry. Jafarbay started this activity four years ago.

Currently Jafarbay has a problem from lack of money. He decided to get loan to expand of his work. He wants to buy a few head of calves.

Jafarbay has many perfect plans for the future and tries to realize them. Jafarbay really needs for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a few head of calves.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 27 years old, married to Kiptarus and blessed is with two children, 10 and 4 years old. She has operated her shop for the last six years, earning a monthly income of Kshs.6,000.
Caroline has applied for her first loan of Kshs.15,000 from VisionFund Kenya and she plans to purchase goods like sugar, rice, bars of soap and cooking oil for her shop.

She plans to use the anticipated profits from her business to pay school fees for her children. Her future dreams are to become financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase goods like sugar, rice, bars of soap and cooking oil for her shop.

loans.name: Molly

texts.en:
Molly is a married woman. She has three children.

She operates a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, soda, bread, eggs, cooking oil, rice, and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years.

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of products.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil, rice, and other items. Her business goal is to open a wholesale business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil, rice, and other items.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: Shabana is a 49-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting in the shop. Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of their three children. Currently, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to maximum customers for generating a healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to maximum customers for generating a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Yoselin

texts.es: Yoselin es una joven comerciante de 19 años de edad que reside en Cartagena de Indias en una localidad de esta ciudad mágica y desde de su vivienda exhibe una gama de productos misceláneos, negocio que inició con el apoyo de su abuela quien al palpar el carisma y el espíritu emprendedor de su nieta, no dudo ni un instante en ayudarle a crecer comercialmente. Desde niña comercializaba a sus amigas, compañeras de estudio y conocidos todo tipo de artículos; accesorios, manualidades, comestibles y golosinas, Yoselin manejaba su propio capital el cual obtenía de sus ahorros, hoy en día ésta comerciante innata, cuenta con cinco años de funcionamiento y desea que su negocio siga creciendo, para ello está aplicando a su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en una nueva colección artículos entre ellos prendas de vestir, calzado, bolsos, productos capilares, maquillajes, colonias, shampoo y una vitrina más grande, con la finalidad de manejar un inventario de productos acorde a su demanda.  Esta inversión potencializará su negocio al ofertar más variedad,  su meta a futuro es adquirir un local y velar por un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Yoselin is a young merchant, 19 years old, who resides in Cartagena de Indias in a town of this magical city. From her home, she displays a range of miscellaneous products: a business she started with the support of her grandmother who, upon feeling the charisma and entrepreneurial spirit of her granddaughter, didn't hesitate an instant in helping her grow commercially. From a young age, she sold all types of articles to her friends, classmates and acquaintances: accessories, crafts, food and snacks. Yoselin managed her own capital, which she obtained from her savings.

Today this innate merchant has five years of operations and wishes for her business to keep growing - for this, she is applying for her first Kiva loan with the Mario Santo Domingo foundation. She will invest in a new collection of articles, among them, apparel, shoes, bags, hair products, makeup, cologne, shampoo and a larger display case with the goal of managing an inventory of products in accordance with her demand. This investment will empower her business to offer more variety. Her goal in the future is to acquire a storefront and ensure a better future.

loans.use: to invest in a new collection of articles, among them, apparel, shoes, bags, hair products, makeup, cologne, shampoo and a larger display case.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine is 51 years old and she lives alone in Ddmashen village of the Gegharkunik region. She has a son who now lives with his family in the Russian Federation. From there he tries to support his mother with finances. While in her nice and cute farm Karine takes care of her farm cattle. She has a cow, a calf, sheep, piglets and chickens.  She sells some milk, a little cheese, meat and eggs from her farm. Karine also cultivates tomatoes, cucumbers and greens on her plot of land. All her farm products she sells at the city’s wholesale market during the week. She hopes to have her Kiva loan in the amount of 200,000 Armenian drams as she wants to buy some fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy some fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, 48, is married and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has requested a loan for her husband’s greengrocer business.

Her husband has been selling vegetables for many years. He sells seasonal fresh vegetables in his hometown. He had been using a four-wheel manual cart to carry the vegetables from one place to another. He has since opened a shop for selling vegetables, but he does not have enough cash on hand to buy the initial inventory to run his shop well.

His children are growing, and their needs are increasing. To cope with the rapid increase in the cost of school fees, books, utility bills and household expenses, he wants to establish his business, but he does not have enough savings to buy vegetables in bulk. Therefore, Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to buy fresh and seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal vegetables for her husband's greengrocer business.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 39-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children and she is equally responsible for all of them.

Asma belongs to an ultra-poor family and that is why she cannot afford their educational expenses. Most of her children are doing jobs as laborers for daily wages.

Asma's husband owns a blacksmith shop in which he provides welding services. He also provides door-to-door services to his customers. Due to the increase in the price of iron, he is unable to buy sufficient welding materials such as welding rods, soldering rods, etc. to carry on his business.

To meet his customers' demands and run his enterprise, he needs some capital to buy welding materials. Asma has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so that he will be able to buy welding rods, soldering rods, and iron rods for manufacturing iron accessories.

Asma is very glad and thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw welding materials (welding rods, soldering rods, and iron rods) for her husband's blacksmith work.

loans.name: Moyopata-San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MOYOPATA DE SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Jerónimo, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Geprgina ella es soltera y tiene 23 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cria cuyes y gallinas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere poner su tienda de abarrotes ya que es su sueño tener su propio negocio, la socia también quiere tener un lugar más amplio para que pueda vender sus animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y también alimentos para los animales.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de chicha, negocio de carpintería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, crianza de animales menores, panificadora, servicio de mudanza.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Moyopata de San Sebastian village bank. This bank is located in the district of San Jerónimo, belonging to Cusco province and Cusco department. The member is Gepringa; she is single and 23 years old. The member works in her business raising animals. The member raises guinea pigs and hens. The member, by means of this business, wants to open up her grocery store since it is her dream to have her own business. The member also wants to have a more ample space so that she can sell her animals.

The other members work at selling chicha [corn beer], a carpentry business, a grocery store, raising small animals, a bakery, and a moving service. The member is thankful for those who form part of this dream through this means and she commits herself to comply with the payment of her payments in the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and hens and also feed for the animals.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be faithful.

She operates a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, soda,bread,eggs, cooking oil, rice and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil, rice, and other items. Her business goal is to open a wholesale business within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, soda, bread, cooking oil, rice, and other items.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is 47 and the mother of six children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a fruit shop in a nearby town for many years. He offers seasonal and fresh fruits to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the income generated from this fruit shop.

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other resources to cope with these needs, so he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so he can maximize sales of the fruit selling shop.

Therefore, Shahida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy additional seasonal fruits to sell. Shahida thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy additional seasonal fruits to sell at her husband's fruit shop.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 70 years old and widowed, with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a home products retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of home products to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of home products to sell.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 30-year-old married woman. Her financial condition is not good. She has to think a long time about starting any task. Her husband has been driving a moto rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw which consists of a motorbike). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads, and for small distances. He has been driving it over rough roads, which caused it to break down. Now the rickshaw has fully depreciated and it rattles when being driven. This is the reason he wants to buy a new moto rickshaw.

Kalsoom has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy a new moto rickshaw and can drive it smoothly. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new moto rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar  has successfully built her general store business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more stock of more grocery items such as grains, sugar, flour and rice. It will help her to meet her customers' demands on time. She is shown in the photo with her son.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of more grocery items such as grains, sugar, flour and rice

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Perveen has successfully built her business selling animals with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase more animals to increase her sales and gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales and gain more profits.

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en:
Annastacia is 48 years old. She is a widow and has three children. Her business is farming. She has been in the business for five years. She earns a monthly income of twenty-five thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase water tanks for storing water to spray her crops when there is no rain. She will use the profits from her expanded business to reinvest in her farm.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase water tanks for storing water to spray her crops when there is no rain

loans.name: Varazdat

texts.en:
Varazdat is 57 years old. He lives in the village of Ddmashen, in the Gegharkunik region. He is married and has two sons; the elder works as a contractual military serviceman and the youngest son is now fulfilling his military service in the army. Varazdat’s wife is in the Russian Federation and he now lives with his sister, who is a great help to him in his farming work.

On his farm, Varazdat has cows, calves, heifers, pigs and chickens. He also has a plot of land on which he cultivates potatoes, greens, cabbages, cucumbers, and tomatoes. Varazdat sells these vegetables, along with his farm’s milk, cheese, macun (national dairy-product), meat, and eggs, at the city wholesale market. This is the only way he earns income to support his family's needs.

With this Kiva loan, Varazdat wants to buy a lot of fodder for his farm cattle, as he has a great need of it now.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for his farm cattle, as he has a great need of it now.

loans.name: Jose Mario

texts.es:
José es un hombre dedicado a comercializar ganado, lo hace en la zona donde reside desde aproximadamente 10 años, ya cuenta con popularidad; él disfruta día con día de su familia formada por su esposa e hijos, ellos no cuentan ayuda de remasas de parientes en el extranjero.
Tendrá recursos para comprar ganado a un precio bajo que posteriormente ofrecerá en el mercado a sus clientes, espera lograr vender el ganado a un precio alto para recuperar la inversión y tener ganancias con las que respaldará el pago de las cuotas de la deuda.
Sus aspiraciones son continuar siendo una persona responsable con sus compromisos, luchar por que su negocio siga con vida y que sus hijos puedan tener un futuro más prometedor.
texts.en:
José is a man dedicated to selling cattle. He has been doing it in the area where he lives for approximately 10 years. He already has popularity; he enjoys his family day by day, made up of his wife and children. They don't have help from remittances of family members abroad. He will have resources to buy cattle at a low price that he will later offer to his clients in the market. He hopes to achieve selling the cattle at a high price to be able to recuperate the investment and have profits with which he will support the payment of his debt installments.

His aspirations are to continue being a responsible person with his commitments, fight for his business to stay alive and that his children can have a more promising future.

loans.use: to buy cattle at a low price which he will later offer to his customers in the market.

loans.name: Zoila Del Carmen

texts.es:
Zoila, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, es madre soltera, su pareja emigró hacia los Estados Unidos y con él tuvo 3 hijos, que están en la escuela y son los que dependen de ella.

Zoila, vende tortillas desde hace 6 años, pero además vende pupusas tres veces por semana desde hace 2 años, la necesidad la llevo a dedicarse al negocio y el deseo de sacar a sus hijos adelante la motivo a trabajar para ellos; antes solo era ama de casa, pero cuando el papá de sus hijos se fue, la situación fue difícil y gracias a Dios y al negocio sigue adelante con sus hijos.- Su día comienza a las 4:30 a.m. pues hay que coser el maíz porque a las 8:30 a.m. ya están esperando las tortillas y termina su jornada a las 6:00 p.m. su familia le ayuda en el negocio.

El crédito será invertido para comprar maíz por mayor, porque así se consigue mas cómodo y también para la compra de leña.

Su sueño es cambiar su negocio de lugar a otro más céntrico, que sus hijos se preparen academicamente y mejorar su vivienda pues la falta repello y piso.
texts.en:
Zoila, 32 years old, studied until sixth grade. She is a single mother, her partner emigrated to the United States and with him she had three children that are in school: they are the ones that depend upon her. Zoila has sold tortillas for the last six years, but in addition, she has sold pupusas three times a week for the last two years. Necessity led her to dedicate herself to the business and the dream of getting her children ahead motivated her to work for them. Before, she was only a homemaker but when the father of her children left, the situation was difficult and thanks to God and the business she moves forward with her children.

Her day starts at 4:30 AM; she has to cook the corn because at 8:30 AM people are already waiting for the tortillas. She finishes her workday at 6:00 PM. Her family helps her with the business. The loan will be invested to buy corn in bulk because she can get it more cheaply and also for the purchase of firewood. Her dreams are: to change her business to a more central location, that her children prepare themselves academically and to improve her home; it lacks plastered walls and a floor.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk, because therefore she gets it cheaper and also to buy firewood.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 28-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She is living happily with her family in the area of Multan, Pakistan.

She owns an embroidery shop. She has been selling embroidery material for many years. She sells sequins, pearls, threads, precious stones, silk, needles and wooden frames for embroidery. She needs to buy raw materials for herself. Through this amount she will buy a stock of threads, fancy cloth, sequins, precious stones and pearls of various colors.

Sumaira is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw materials for herself.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a housewife and the mother of four children. She requires funds to buy a new rickshaw for her husband. The family's income is generated through the transportation business and they barely make ends meet. Razia's husband is the main earner of the family and generates all his income from driving the rickshaw.

Unfortunately the current rickshaw has completely broken down, halting the inflow of income. This has resulted in Razia's children skipping school due to a lack of resources at their mother's disposal. Hence, Razia wants a loan to help her husband to buy a new rickshaw and start generating income once again, which would streamline all her activities and thus send her children back to school to get an education.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband so he can generate income for cherishing his family.

loans.name: Omorden Bor Group

texts.en:
The group "Omorden Bor" is made up of five women who are responsible mothers of very sizable families. They come from Accra, Chorkor. They are known for being hardworking and responsible women with a desire for self-improvement. Currently, they want to improve their businesses. They also want to provide for their children and give them the stability that they need.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, their group representative is Sabina, who earns a living from selling cosmetics to her customers. The business is located in her home. She spends twelve hours a day working to sell cosmetics so that in the not-too-distant future she can earn a better income. Her aim is to invest in buying cosmetics to satisfy the demands of her clients.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to satisfy the demands of her clients.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde desde hace 10 años comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo, su suegra y sus tres cuñados todos trabajan y ayudan en la casa, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda contruyendo un muro de contencion pero no posee de suficiente capital por esa razon solicita un credito para la compra de materiales de construccion y asi poder vivir junto cn su familia mas seguros.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face has been pixelated because of being 26 and living in a high risk area has worked raising broiler chickens for the past 10 years. She sells her products in the nearby villages and with the profits she obtains, she achieves getting ahead. The young woman lives in her own house with her husband, her mother in law and her three brothers in law. All work and help in the house.

She wants to improve her home, constructing a containment wall but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she is applying for a loan for the purchase of construction materials and to therefore be able to live with her family more securely.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is 27 years old. She is married with two children. She has had a retail shop business for four years, and it has been profitable.

She will be using the loan to purchase stock of washing powder and other detergents, cooking oil, sugar, and toiletries for resale at a profit.

With the anticipated profits, Evaline will be able to start another business, which she is currently in the process of deciding.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be a successful businesswoman and live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase stock of washing powder and other detergents, cooking oil, sugar, and toiletries for resale at a profit.

loans.name: In Him Is Life Group

texts.en:
The group "In Him Is Life" will begin its sixth cycle with ID-Ghana. As part of its branch loan provision, the group comprises three members, represented by Esther, a member of the group. The members' businesses vary: secondhand clothing, underwear and fruit. This loan will benefit their small microbusinesses.

Esther joined ID-Ghana through an invitation from a friend, who is a customer of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling secondhand clothing. This loan is intended to increase her income. She will buy secondhand clothing at wholesale prices from the wholesale venders in the city of Accra to sell to her customers.

This form of work enables her to have a job and resources to support herself economically. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she says she likes the training and the savings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing at wholesale prices from the wholesale venders in the city of Accra to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en:
Stepan is from Beregovo. It is not his first time coming to Kiva for help. Stepan invested funds received from Kiva last time in a new boiler, which helped him have substantial savings on heating expenses.

However, since Stepan received financial assistance from Kiva, many things have drastically changed in Ukraine: the economy is struggling even more, and natural gas prices went up, which makes a gas boiler very inefficient at this point.

This is why this time Stepan is hoping to use 20,000 hrivnyas to implement another strategy to keep his house warm through the cold winter season. Stepan is planning to buy and install two tile stoves and burn wood in them. This should help him save on heating expenses eventually, compared to using natural gas.

loans.use: to upgrade the heating system in his house.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, 37 years old, is not married and has one child. For the past ten years, Grace has operated a green grocery business, and it has been profitable.

Grace has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya to purchase additional stock of indigenous vegetables and other assorted fresh groceries for resale. She will be able to support her family with the anticipated profits.

Grace's hopes and dreams for the future are to have a better family and better life in general.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of indigenous vegetables and other assorted fresh groceries for resale

loans.name: Ana Gilma

texts.es:
Ana, invirtió el crédito en mejorar el inventario de la crianza de ganado, cerdos y aves de corral, su cartera de clientes ha crecido, su economía ha mejorado un poco y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen. 
Nuevamente solicita un crédito para comprar cerdos y concentrado para alimentar a todos los animales de su negocio, se siente deseoso de seguir teniendo beneficios por utilizar los créditos que le otorga Padecomsm.
texts.en:
Ana invested the loan in improving her inventory for raising livestock, pigs, and poultry. Her client list has grown, her finances have improved a little, and her family circumstances have been maintained.

Ana is applying for a loan again to buy pigs and animal feed to feed all the animals in her business. She would like to continue reaping the benefits of using the loans that Padecomsm offers.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal feed to feed all the animals in her business.

loans.name: Abagambakamu Kiziranfumbi Group

texts.en: Eric, a member of the Abagambakamu Kiziranfumbi group, is a terribly hardworking man. He cares for four children, all of whom attend school in Hoima, Uganda. He repairs motorcycles and bicycles for a living, which has earned him a lot of income. He also practises farming, predominantly growing cassava and beans, for additional income. He intends to expand his business but faces the challenge of inadequate capital. He is seeking a loan to buy more oil and other tools for repairing motorcycles and bicycles.

loans.use: to buy more oil and other tools for repairing motorcycles and bicycles.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is female individual client, aged 28 years. She is a single lady with one child. She runs a retail shop at Kaggaba in Nakirebe town. Besides, she deals in buying and selling of phones.

She has hopes of growing her businesses and educating her children, but competition is her challenge in that business field. She believes that with the boost, she will be able to sustain her business. She is hardworking and innovative.

loans.use: to boost her retail trade.

loans.name: Jaylaxmi Tejavarao And Group

texts.en:
Jaylaxmi leads a group of four women in the Kutch district of Gujarat. She is a 34-year-old widowed woman. She runs a tiffin service business to sustain her household of three.

Jaylaxmi works hard to earn an income every month. She single-handedly manages her household. She cannot keep up with increasing prices with the income from her current business. She has thus decided to expand her business. She hopes this will help her earn a better income.

Jaylaxmi expects to earn an additional 3,000 INR every month. She needs a loan to expand her business. She will use the loan to sell lunch, dinner, snacks, sweets, etc. Jaylaxmi, along with the three other members of her group, seeks a group loan of 64,000 INR. Your loan will help this group of women earn more and lead better lives.

loans.use: To expand her tiffin service business by selling lunch, dinner, etc

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela is a student. She is single and lives at her parents' house. Gabriela sells instant coffee and needs a loan to buy more coffee to sell.

Gabriela is studying business administration. She works hard and supports her family. She doesn't have children but she gives her best.

Gabriela hopes you can help her. She has experience in the coffee business. In the picture, Gabriela is helping a customer at the office where she sells coffee.

loans.use: to buy more coffee to sell.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov, 54 years old, is from Podgorodneye. She owns a little store right downtown, selling men's, women's and children's clothing and footwear. Lubov is an experienced entrepreneur; she has been in this business for eighteen years. Lubov is married and has two grown sons.

Not long ago, Lubov lost a good vending location in Dnepropetrovsk, a city with about a million residents, due to a fire accident. However, she didn't lose heart and started everything from scratch, moving her location to the smaller town of Podgorodneye, where she lives with her family at the moment.

Lubov needs to restock her inventory before the cold fall/winter season arrives in Ukraine. She is planning to buy quality jackets for men and women, as well as boots for children. The weather changes radically in September and many people come shopping for warmer clothing for themselves and their families. Lubov has built a loyal clientele since she started her business many years ago. She wants to be able to offer a nice selection of merchandise to her potential customers when they come to her location this fall.

loans.use: to buy quality jackets for men and women, as well as boots for children

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 34 years old. She is married and blessed with five children.

Stella has had a poultry business for one year and it has been profitable.

She has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase chickens, as well as chicken feed. With the anticipated profits, Stella will be able to invest the funds back into her business as well as repay her loan.

Stella's hope and dream for the future is to live a happy life.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, as well as chicken feed.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old. She is married and has six children.

Her business is farming. She has been in this business for ten years.

She earns a monthly income of 4,000 Kenya shillings. This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase a water tank and fertilizer.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and fertilizer.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 67 years old. She is a widow and supports 10 children.

Her business is farming and livestock keeping. She has been in the business for 10 years and it has been profitable.

She earns a monthly income of 8,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase a water tank and water pipes.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and water pipes.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 30 years old. She is married with five children.

She has had a poultry business, which she has run for six years and it has been profitable.

Grace has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya, which she will be using to purchase chicks for rearing as well as chicken feed.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to repay her loan as well as educate the children.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be a successful woman and share her business skills with other women in her community.

loans.use: to purchase chicks for rearing as well as chicken feed.

loans.name: Soniben Krushnamate And Group

texts.en:
Soniben leads a group of four women in Ahmedabad, Gujarat. She is 29 years old and lives with her husband and child. Her child is below the age of 12, and as her child is growing up, she is finding it hard to cope with the rising expenses.

She finds the need for an additional source of income. Thus, she has decided to start a business of selling ready-made clothes. For that, she needs funds to purchase clothes like salwars, kurtis, leggings, etc. She currently does not have that kind of money to invest in her business. She thus seeks a loan.

The other three members, just like Soniben, need funds to invest in their respective businesses. A loan will help them earn better and will help them contribute more to their respective household income. These women are grateful to their lenders for their timely support and encouragement.

loans.use: to purchase leggings, salwars, etc. to start her ready-made clothes selling business.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz, 48, is married and lives with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is an ice cream vendor. He buys various flavours of ice cream from different companies and sells the ice cream from a bicycle with a thermos flask box and umbrella. His bicycle was accidentally broken, and he is in need of a new one. He has already spent his savings on the ingredients for making ice cream and does not have cash on hand to buy a bicycle.

Therefore, Shahnaz has contacted BRAC and requested a Kiva loan for her husband. He will use the loan to purchase a new bicycle, a thermos flask box, an umbrella and more ice cream.

Shahnaz is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new bicycle, a thermos flask box, an umbrella and more ice cream for her husband's ice cream vending business to compensate for an accidental loss.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa, 54 years old, is from Novomoskovsk. She has worked in the business sphere for seven years selling bed linens, sheets, pillows and women's jeans. Larisa owns three separate vending kiosks at one of the biggest local marketplaces. She is married and has two grown daughters.

Larisa needs an additional 40,000 UAH to stock her inventory of jeans, jackets, vests and shirts to sell to her customers this fall. There are always increased numbers of seasonal shoppers looking for warm clothes at the beginning of fall in Ukraine when temperatures go down and it gets chilly outside. Jeans are the type of clothing that is always in high demand in this season, which is why Larisa is hoping to have good sales and get good profit as a result.

loans.use: to stock inventory of jeans, jackets, vests and shirts to sell to her customers this fall.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana, 50 years old, is a private entrepreneur from Melitopol. She is married and has two grown children. Svetlana runs a small enterprise selling pastries and candy in a local marketplace in her home town. Her business is close to the local train station, where there are always a lot of potential customers shopping for snacks on the road.

Svetlana is seeking 15,000 UAH to diversify her assortment of hard candy, chocolate candy, cookies, pastries and other sweets at her vending location. Svetlana is hoping to see her venture expand and grow even further as she adds new locations to the existing one in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an additional shipment of merchandise.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 28 years old. He is married with no children.

He has had an agriculture business for five years and it has been profitable.

He has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya, which he will be using to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

With the anticipated profits, he will be able to expand the business further as well as repay his loan.

His hope and dream for the future is to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 24 years old. She is not married and has no children yet.

She has been selling milk as her core business for the last two years and she enjoys it.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to open another business.

Mercy has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya, which she will be using to purchase additional gallons of milk to meet the demands of her growing customers.

Her hope and dream for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of milk to meet the demands of her growing customers.

loans.name: Lilik

texts.en: Lilik, 44, lives with her daughter (a student) in the city of Gavar in Gegharkunik region. Her husband works abroad in the Russian Federation. Lilik has a higher education and a specialty in linguistics. She teaches Armenian Language and Literature in a school and simultaneously runs a farm, which is cute but also provides some source of income for her family. Lilik has 10 cows on the farm. They provide very tasty milk, which she sells. She also makes cheese and butter, both to sell and for family use. With this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams, Lilik wants to buy a lot of fodder for her farm cows.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for her farm cows

loans.name: Anush

texts.en: This nice young lady is 26 years old and she lives in Vanadzor city in Lori region. Anush graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute in the faculty of psychology. Anush is a very intelligent and clever pedagogue and now she works in her specialty; at the city school, she is a children psychologist. Anush also knows good English and at her house she gives private courses to a group of pupils. This lady is a very hardworking person and she is greatly involved with a self-development process nearly every day. She asks for this Kiva loan as she must take part in training courses in psychology and some part of her loan amount she will use for the purchase of professional literature.

loans.use: to purchase professional literature.

loans.name: Jennifer Abigail

texts.es:
Yennifer había solicitado el crédito anterior para surtir la venta de calzado, al realizar sus planes tuvo buenos resultados en su momento, pero también inicio a vender comida rápida, decidió dejar de vender calzado y quedarse con el nuevo rubro, debido a que le genera más utilidades y de esa forma puede ayudar más a que su familia tenga mejor vida.
En esta oportunidad solicita el crédito para comprar pan, embutidos, aceite, carnes, bebidas, gas propano, tomates, cebollas, etc., para elaborar tortas mexicanas, espera poder mantener las ventas y seguir teniendo buena calificación crediticia.
texts.en:
Jennifer had applied for a previous loan to stock her shoe sales business. When she carried out her plans, she had good results, but she also started selling fast food. She decided to stop selling footwear and stick with her new line of work, since it generates more profits for her. In this way, she can help her family have a better life.

This time, Jennifer is applying for a loan to buy bread, cold cuts, oil, meats, drinks, propane gas, tomatoes, onions, etc., to make Mexican sandwiches. She hopes to be able to maintain her sales and continue having a good credit rating.

loans.use: to buy bread, cold cuts, oil, meats, drinks, propane gas, tomatoes, onions, etc. to make Mexican sandwiches.

loans.name: Taraben Kantibhai And Group

texts.en:
Taraben is a 49-year-old entrepreneur who runs her own jewelry business, selling bangles, rings, artificial ornaments, etc. She lives in the Ahmedabad district of Gujarat. With her monthly income of INR 3,500, Taraben is finding it hard to manage the growing expenses of her household of three. She needs to address the problem of insufficient income and feels she can do that by expanding her jewelry business. Taraben expects to earn an additional INR 2,000 every month if she expands her business. She will be able to sell more products and earn a higher profit. She thus seeks a loan of INR 20,000.

Taraben leads a group of four women who need funds to expand their respective businesses to meet their families' needs. They all hail from the same village and have come together to seek a loan of INR 80,000 (INR 20,000 each). Your loan will help these women to manage their household expenses and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase stock of bangles, earrings, etc. to expand her existing jewelry business.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, juntos tienen 5 hijos, 2 ya están acompañados y los demás están estudiando.

Blanca, desde la edad de 14 años comenzó a vender frescos y panes con pollo, pero cuando se acompaño empezó a trabajar en la agricultura con su pareja; ellos siembran maíz, pipían y maicillo, su día laboral empieza a las 5:00 a.m. para poder llegar temprano a su cultivo y tiene que caminar 40 minutos, luego laboran 5 horas y regresa a casa para atender su hogar, en el cultivo se involucra toda su familia.

El crédito será invertido para comprar abono y pesticidas para sus cultivos.

Su principal sueño es ver a sus hijos graduados en una carrera universitaria y además le gustaría tener una pupusería.
texts.en:
Blanca, 38 years old, studied up to third grade, is in a relationship and her partner works in agriculture. Together, they have five children. Two of them are already in relationships and the others are studying.

Starting at age 14, Blanca sold soft drinks and chicken sandwiches, but when she entered a relationship she started to work in agriculture with her partner. They grow corn, squash and sorghum. Their work day begins at 5:00am, in order to get to their crops early. They have to walk for 40 minutes, then they work for five hours and return home to tend to their house. The entire family is involved in the cultivation.

The loan will be used to buy fertiliser and pesticides for the crops.

Her greatest dream is to see her children graduate from university. She would also like to own a shop selling Pupusas (stuffed tortillas).

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and pesticides for her crops.

loans.name: Arkadi

texts.en: Arkadi is 64 years old and he lives in Shahumyan village in the Lori region. Arkadi is engaged in farming and he also works as a keeper at the school. On the farm, Arkadi has cows, a horse and chickens. From his farm, this farmer sells milk, meat and eggs. All his farm products he sells at the city’s wholesale market during the week. Now, like many farmers, Arkadi is getting prepared for the coming cold season. So with this Kiva loan, Arkadi wants both to enlarge his farm with cattle and buy a bull. He will also organize the transfer of the hay for his cattle to his farm from the hayfield and for this, he will rent a big truck. He greatly hopes that Kiva lenders will help him to cover all these financial expenses.

loans.use: to enlarge his farm with cattle, buy a bull and organize the transfer of the hay for his cattle.

loans.name: Zhibek

texts.en:
“I am proud to be born in a friendly family of economists. I have elder and younger sisters; we live with grandmother in her house in the countryside. My elder sister is married and lives with her family separately; my younger sister is a school girl. My grandmother is retired, before she had worked as a needlewoman at the factory all her life. Lately she often has health problems, so we take care of her and my parents support her financially.

I am a freshman at one of the best universities in Central Asia. To enter it I had studied hard and spent one year for preparation for the entrance exams. Everyone in our country knows that it’s hard to study here and it costs much. However, my parents are set seriously now to give me AUCA education, because some years ago they weren’t able to support my elder sister, who doesn’t have a higher education and is married now. My sister is not able to find a job without education and it horrifies the rest of us, that I also may have such a fate. Not to repeat her destiny, I was a diligent student at school and was active in after-class activities. Choosing AUCA and having passed the entrance exams successfully, my parents started to search for funding, as their salaries don’t enable them to pay the tuition. The Scholarships and Financial Aid Office of AUCA told us about interest free Kiva loan for AUCA students, so we thought that we found what we were looking for. I would like to note that Kiva is the only interest free loan given for education in our country, so it is my last variant to find money for tuition. I would be grateful to be given an opportunity to receive such loan.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education in the MATH Program at AUCA.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Nairobi’s Shauri Moyo Estate. She is a community leader who is passionate about empowering young people and women in her community through representing them at the ‘maendeleo ya wanawake’ movement.

She recently learned about the Fresh Life franchise gaining popularity in her area and was thrilled at the opportunity it provides for the many jobless youth in Nairobi. Aong them is her son who recently completed his secondary education and is awaiting to join college. In mentoring him towards entrepreneurship, Margaret wants to support her son in joining the Fresh Life movement. She sees this as an opportunity for her son to learn entrepreneurship skills while providing clean and hygienic toilet services to their community at Shauri Moyo.

Margaret is seeking to acquire two Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.use: to pay for two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Maria Amparo

texts.es:
María agradece el apoyo que la institución le da para que su negocio tenga un lugar en el mercado, con el capital pudo mejorar el inventario de la venta de bebidas y fruta picada, sus clientes están satisfechos, su negocio ha crecido, su familia mantiene el mismo núcleo y todos se encuentra bien de salud.
Requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar gaseosas, gatorade, jugos, agua y fruta, tendrá oportunidad de tener suficiente producto para atender mejor a sus clientes, además piensa hacer mejoras en el puesto de venta para dar una buena impresión y atraer a nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
María is grateful for the support that the institution gives her so that her business can have a place in the market.  She managed to improve her inventory of drinks and chopped fruit with the money.  Her customers are satisfied, her business has grown, her family keeps the same core, and everyone is healthy.

She needs a new loan to buy soda, gatorade, juice, water, and fruit so that she will have the chance to have enough products to serve her customers better.  Additionally, she is thinking of making improvements to her sales stand in order to give a good impression and attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy soda, gatorade, juice, water, and fruit in order to have enough products to serve her customers better

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is a 45-year-old doctor. He is married and has two children, a 19-year-old son who is attending college and a 14-year-old daughter who is in high school. Ricardo provides for his family by working for a government hospital on the night shift; during the day, he works at his office, giving private consulting. His office is at the same hospital where he works at night. He thinks this is easier in case any patient has an emergency.

He managed to get one of his children into college, but he is still missing one, and lately he has been struggling to pay the tuition. He thinks if he can remodel his office in order to be able to treat a vast majority of health issues, he may get extra income and stop the harsh times that he has been facing.

With the remodeling of his office, Ricardo will be able to raise his monthly income and stop struggling with the bills. He is looking for a 15,790 MXN loan that will let him renew his office.

loans.use: to remodel his office.

loans.name: He Muong 13 Group

texts.en:
Hanh, 28, lives with her husband and her two school-aged sons in a small, remote village. Her family's source of income is mainly from agricultural production such as cultivating rice, raising buffalo and chicken. She is a hard-working farmer with good experience in farming so she has continuously expanded production to increase yield and improve income for her family.

This is the fourth time she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy piglets and pig feed. She believes that with the support and advice of the program's agricultural worker and her experience, the pigs will grow fast and be healthy, then she will reap a good profit.

Hanh dreams that her family will have a better life and her children will live in a bright future. In the picture, she is the first person starting from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Shehanajbanu Najarmohamed And Group

texts.en:
Shehanajbanu is a 33-year-old woman who stays with her husband and child in a village in the Kutch district of Gujarat.

She runs a wood selling business to supplement the income her husband earns. Though she currently earns 3,000 Rupees every month, she believes expanding her business will allow her to earn an additional 1,000 Rupees every month.

She plans to sell soft firewood, hard firewood, timber and dry firewood. She does not have the required funds to expand her business and thus seeks a loan. With the loan amount, she will purchase sharpening tools, a weighing scale and woodcutting tools.

Shehanajbanu leads a group of five women who are seeking a group loan of 64,000 Rupees. Just like Shehanajbanu, they need funds to expand their respective businesses. They are grateful to their lenders as the loan will allow them to expand their businesses and lead a better life.

loans.use: to purchase a weighing scale, sharpening tools, etc. to expand her wood selling business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.fr: Rosita a 30 ans. Elle vit en union libre et elle a trois enfants. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille, elle vend des produits alimentaires. Elle exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans. Elle demande un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock. À l’avenir, elle souhaite faire progresser son activité.
texts.en: Rosita is 30. She lives in a de facto union and she has three children. To provide for her family, she sells food products. She has been in this business for five years. She requests a micro credit to increase her stock. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of food products.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde desde hace varios años, comercializa sus prodcutos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas pollos y materiales para contruir una nueva galera donde mantiene a los pollos y asi poder continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: This young woman has her face blurred because she is 28 years old and lives in a high-risk area.  She has worked raising broiler chickens for many years.  She sells her products in the area surrounding her home, where she resides with her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more chickens and materials to construct a new chicken coop where she keeps her chickens and thus, she will be able to continue her work.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and materials to construct a new chicken coop.

loans.name: Denele

texts.fr: Denele a 25 ans. Elle vit en union libre et a un enfant à charge.  Elle est revendeuse de sandales. Cela fait 2 ans qu’elle mène cette activité. Elle souhaite l’agrandir afin d’y gagner plus de revenus. Elle sollicite un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Denele is 25. She lives in a de facto union and has one dependent child. She sells sandals. She has been in this business for two years. She would like to expand her business to earn more income. She requests a loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy sandals.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is most proud of her family and her farm. She says, "I live on a small farm in my village. I therefore have to buy firewood, charcoal and LPG gas for fuel. This loan from Takamoto Biogas will enable me to save money spent on fuel every month. I will use the money saved to getting more cattle for my zero grazing unit".

Please help Margaret to get a biogas system to better care for her family.

loans.use: to buy a biodigester for clean, renewable cooking fuel for her family.

loans.name: Donara

texts.en:
Donara is 38 years old and she lives in Gavar city of the Gegharkunik region. She is divorced and lives with her daughter, who is a student, and her school-aged son.

Donara's profession is accounting, and with those skills she runs a clothes trading business at the city wholesale market.

Donara also has a farm with cows and heifers. Thanks to her farming she makes a profit from the sale of farm products and also provides fresh farm foods for her children. She sells milk, macun (a national dairy product), cheese and meat.

Donara is a hardworking woman who overcomes any problem and hardship that may arise in her farming work. With this loan of 500,000 Armenian drams, Donara plans to purchase fodder for her farm cattle for the upcoming Autumn season.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for her farm cattle for the upcoming Autumn season.

loans.name: Janakamma Dilirao And Group

texts.en:
Janakamma is a 38-year-old entrepreneur hailing from the Kutch district in Gujarat. She lives with her husband and her teenage child. She runs a tiffin service business in her locality.

She earns a monthly income of 5,000 Rupees from her business. She believes that if she expands her business, she will be able to earn an additional 1,500 Rupees every month. This additional income will help sustain her family of 3. She needs funds to purchase tiffin boxes, vegetables, other cooking ingredients and vessels. Hence, she seeks a loan.

Janakamma is joined by four other women – Ratnalu, Parvati, Chandravati, Sarojani - in seeking a loan. They all hail from the same village and have come together to apply for a loan of 87,000 Rupees to expand their respective businesses. A loan will help these women contribute more to their household income and lead a better quality of life. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: to purchase vessels and tiffin boxes to expand her tiffin service business.

loans.name: Lourdia

texts.fr: Lourdia a 23 ans et elle vit en union libre. Elle a deux enfants et elle vend des produits alimentaires près de chez elle. Ses enfants sont encore trop jeunes pour aller à l’école et ainsi Lourdia peut économiser un peu d’argent. Elle demande un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock d'huile. À l’avenir, elle souhaite envoyer ses enfants dans une très bonne école et elle travaille dur pour économiser suffisamment.
texts.en: Lourdia is 23 and she lives in a de facto union. She has two children and she sells food products near her home. Her children are too young to go to school, so Lourdia is able to save up a little bit of money. She requests a micro credit to increase her stock of oil. In the future, she would like to send her children to a very good school and she works hard to save up sufficient means to do so.

loans.use: to increase her stock of oil.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is 21 years old, single and supporting his brother who is six years old.

He does business in Kapsabet where he operates a hotel. He has done this for the last five years, earning a monthly income of 5,000 Kenyan Shillings.

Sammy has applied for his first loan of KES 8,000 from VisionFund Kenya. With the loan, he plans to purchase sugar, rice, flour and cooking fat for his hotel.

He plans to use the anticipated profits from his business to pay his brother's school fees.

His future dreams include becoming self-sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, flour and cooking fat for his hotel.

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary is 27 years old, married to Everline and blessed with one child who is 2 years old.

He grows cabbage, green vegetables, irish potatoes and tomatoes in Kapsabet. He has been in horticulture for the last three years earning a monthly income of KES 16,000.

Hillary has applied for his first loan of KES 10,000 from VisionFund Kenya. With the loan, he plans to purchase fertilizer, seeds and pesticide.

He will use the anticipated profits from his business to pay back the loan and save with VisionFund Kenya to grow his loan limits.

His future dreams are to become financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and pesticide.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 27 years old. She is married and has one child.

Her businesses are running a beauty salon and vegetable farming. She has been in the business for five years. She earns a monthly income of twenty thousand Kenyan shillings.

This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy a water pump for her vegetable farming business.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to open another beauty salon.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a line of beauty salons and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a water pump for her vegetable farming business.

loans.name: Andrea Avelina

texts.es: Su pasión por la cocina permitió que Andrea una Cartagenera de 60 años emprendiera su propio negocio y se convirtiera en propietaria de un restaurante, ubicado en su vivienda en un barrio con gran afluencia de personas.  Esta actividad la realiza en compañía de su cónyuge quien es su coequipero en la cocina, así que este par diariamente preparan exquisitos platos con los que deleitan a sus clientes todos los días de la semana, entre ellos para los desayunos; arepas de huevo, empanadas, caramañolas, tortillas de huevo y jugos de todas frutas o café con leche, para el almuerzo; filetes de pescado, camarones, carnes asadas o pollo que acompañan con arroces típicos entre ellos de coco, fideos y guisado, ensaladas de verduras al vapor o frescas, patacones, tajadas o papitas fritas y de refresco agua de panela con limón o jugos de frutas naturales.  La comida de Andrea  con su sansón y toque personal, enloquece a los Cartageneros y no la cambian por nada, en la actualidad ella está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en víveres al por mayor y continuar con su actividad sin contratiempos.  Su meta a futuro es comprar otra casa e independizar el negocio para tener más capacidad y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Her love for cooking has allowed Andrea, a 60 year old woman from Cartagena, to start her own business and become the owner of a restaurant. It is located in her house in a very busy neighborhood. She does this business in company with her spouse who is her co-worker in the kitchen. This pair prepares delicious dishes each day to delight their clients every day of the week. Amongst them, for breakfast; egg arepas, empanadas, caramañolas, omelets, all kinds of fruit juices or coffee with milk. For lunch; fish filets, shrimp, steaks or chicken accompanied by traditional rice, including coconut rice, noodles and stews, vegetable salad, steamed or fresh, plantains, fried plantain or potatoes and to drink sugar water with lime or natural fruit juices.

Andrea's food with it's seasoning and personal touch drives the people of Cartagena crazy and they won't trade it for anything. She is currently applying for a loan from Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in supplies wholesale and continue with her business with no setbacks. Her goal for the future is to buy another house and make her business separate to have greater capacity and a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to invest in wholesale supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Phonxay Group

texts.en: Home is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Home and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Home and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Home and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Home and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is 26 years old. He is currently a second year student at Sigalagala Technical Training Institute in Kakamega, pursuing a Diploma in Quantity Survey.

He is the 3rd born in a family of 9, and 4 of his siblings are in school. His parents are both unemployed and not able to provide for his higher education. As a result, after finishing high school in 2012, he began working as an unskilled laborer at a local sugar company for a year. After that he worked in a bread factory for about 4 months and then worked as a casual laborer to raise funds to enable him enroll in higher education.

Abdallah's goal is to become a Quantity Surveyor after college and be self-employed. This goal will allow him to develop his career and also support his parents in raising his younger brothers and sister.

He requesting that Kiva provide financial assistance to pay for his school fees and expenses. This will facilitate achieving his goals.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition and expenses.

loans.name: Marlen Tatiana

texts.en:
Marlen is 20 years old and lives in Medellín. She has a little baby boy who only is 3 years of age and that has become her motivator to work and move forward in life. She wants to give him the best quality of life that she can, so she’s searching for a way to improve their lives.

For some time she’s been wanting to start studying, but she lacks money and hasn’t had the opportunity to do it. Now that she has found Interactuar and Kiva, she feels like this is her big chance. She’s asking for a loan to start studying cooking, especially to make cakes.

Marlen has many dreams, but most of them regard her baby boy. She wants to give him a good education. By starting her own business, she will be able to support her baby and family. Help her now with just a loan.

loans.use: to start studying cooking.

loans.name: Ebenezer Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Emily, a member of Ebenezer Women group. She is 43 years old and a mother of seven. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in November 2013.

She does poultry and dairy farming. Emily is grateful to Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) for the enterprise training. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy grains that will help her to start a cereal selling business. She hopes her business will thrive and thus she will have more income to cater for family needs such as food and clothing.

Emily is happy for Kiva and the lenders for their support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy grains that will help start a cereal selling business. She hopes her business will thrive and thus have more income to cater for family needs such as food and clothing.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a 44-year-old married woman. She lives in the Khashuri district with her husband and 2 children.

The family is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a cow, calves and 2 pigs. In addition, they cultivate family-owned agricultural land to grow maize and haricot beans. Marina is a very hardworking woman and does her best to ensure a good harvest both to sell and to nourish her family.

Marina needs money to purchase a minibus. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of GEL 5,000. With the credit received she will purchase a minibus. Her husband will work on a minibus line to transport people and generate income. With this income they will be able to improve the living conditions of their family. Marina awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus for her husband to work on a minibus line and generate income.

loans.name: Yadis Lucia

texts.en:
Yadis is 29 years old and lives in the municipality of Sahagun on the Colombian Atlantic coast. She has a little baby boy who only is 2 months of age; he is the reason she wants to improve her quality of life. She owns a business selling products from magazines that she buys to sell later.

A friend helped her to begin with this job. Now she wants to start investing in it so it becomes successful, by increasing her profits and making it more competitive. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy some products from a magazine to sell.

This new mother has many responsibilities in the new role she’s assuming. Since she knows that she has to think about the education and quality of life her son will have, she wants it to be the best. Help her accomplish her dream with just a loan.

loans.use: buy some products from a magazine to sell

loans.name: Kaba Thayu 2013 Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Francis, a member of Kaba Thayu 2013 Women Group. He is 50 years old, married and blessed with three children.

He operates a butchery, a business he has been running for the last 20 years. Having undergone Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management, he learned how to draw his budget, minimize his costs, keep track of his business returns and plan well for the future.

He is borrowing from Kiva with the intention to buy more goats and sheep for the sale of mutton. He plans to use the profit generated from the enterprise to re-invest in the business, buy food for his family and cater for school fees for his children.

Francis is grateful to Kiva and Hand in Hand Eastern Africa for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more goats and sheep for slaughter thus earning more income from his butcher shop.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is an artisan from Peru who specializes in alpaca apparel and accessories. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca wool.

Alfredo has been selling through NOVICA since 2001. This is his story:

"When I was but a small child, I learned from my parents the best weaving techniques. Like me, they had learned from their own parents. This makes us a family entirely devoted to the world of textiles, and we have been for generations. Nowadays I combine knitting techniques, remaining true to Inca and colonial motifs."

"I will use this microcredit to purchase the wool I need to build up my collection ahead of the holiday rush. Buying in bulk makes a huge difference for me, as it ensures that I will be able to acquire all of the colors I need, including those that are in high demand. Many thanks to all of you."

Use the link below to view Alfredo's alpaca apparel and accessories on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/2891

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca wool

loans.name: Faviola

texts.es:
Faviola es una joven mujer de 20 años, soltera, sin hijos, y estudia enfermería.
Ella es inteligente, constante y  muy responsable. Sus estudios los realiza en una unidad educativa campesina en ‘pucarani’ ubicado a 30 km de la ciudad y se halla a 3.865 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Faviola es morena de cabello largo y físico mediano, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que trabajan, viven en una casa construida de ladrillo que cuenta sólo con energía eléctrica. Ella estudia la carrera de enfermería y se encuentra en 1 año de 3 que dura, le gusta entender los síntomas de alguna enfermedad, estudia y memoriza las formulas químicas de los medicamentos su carácter es de servicio, “estudio y trabajo en el negocio de mi mamá…” comenta. Paralelamente a sus estudios trabaja ayudando en el tejido de mantas del negocio de su mamá para estudiar por las noches. La ventaja de sus actividades es que no se cruzan entre sí, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una computadora portátil para continuar estudiando. Su sueño es lograr obtener su título profesional, ella desea comprar una computadora portátil para continuar estudiando. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Faviola solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora portátil para continuar estudiando.
texts.en:
Faviola is a young, single, 20-year-old woman who has no children and is studying nursing.

She is intelligent, reliable and very responsible. She studies in a rural educational unit in Pucarani, which is located 30km from the town and is 3,865 metres above sea level.

Faviola has a dark complexion with long hair and medium build. Her mother tongue is Aymará which she speaks at home and she speaks Spanish. She lives at home with her parents who work. They live in a brick house that only has electricity. She is studying for a nursing degree and she is in her first of three years. She likes understanding the symptoms of illnesses, studying and memorising the chemical formulas of medications. Her heart is for service. She says: "I study and I work in my mother's business". Whilst studying she also works weaving blankets for her mother's business so that she can study at night. The advantage of her activities are that they do not interfere with each other, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy a laptop computer to keep studying.

Her dream is to be able to achieve her professional qualification. She would like to buy a laptop to continue her studies. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in year 1 of her activities. It is for these reasons that Faviola is asking for a loan to buy a laptop computer to keep studying.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer to continue her studies.

loans.name: Aida Maria

texts.en:
Aida is 35 years old, and lives in the municipality of Chinu. She has three children, two boys and a girl, who have become her reason to work hard and find ways to give them a good quality of life. She has owned a business raising pigs since 2010. This was something she learned thanks to her father.

She wants to improve her business by increasing her sales and making her business sustainable. She expects that someday with her business, she can offer jobs to people who need them. She asked for a loan so she can buy pigs to fat them up.

Aida has many dreams, but like the mother she is, she wants the best for her children. Therefore, she wants to pay for a good education for them. You can help this responsible woman to accomplish her dreams with a loan.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fat them up.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee un taller de estructuras metálicas (elabora puertas, balcones, rejas, etc.) tiene mas de 2 años de dedicarse a este negocio, ya tiene mucha clientela pues lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo, el joven vive en casa propia con sus tres hijas, el solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar hierro, metal, herramienta etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: This young man, whose face has been pixelated because he's 25 years old and lives in a high-risk zone, owns a metallic structure workshop where he builds doors, balconies, fences, etc. He's been running this business for more than 2 years. He now has many clients and they look to him because they want quality. This young man lives in his own house with his three daughter.
