He is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy iron, metal, tools, etc., in order to increase his earnings.

loans.use: buy iron, metal, tools, etc.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es: Milagros es una mujer muy trabajadora. Ella solicita un préstamo de mil ciento doce dolares ($1,112),para la compra de materiales de construcción necesarios para realizar mejoras y ampliar su vivienda, esto le permitirá mejorar la seguridad y comodidad de su familia.
texts.en: Milagros is a very hard-working woman. She is asking for a loan of one thousand, one hundred and twelve dollars ($1,112) to buy the building materials necessary for expanding and making improvements to her home. This will allow her to improve the security and comfort of her family.

loans.use: to make improvements in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 4 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica  al cultivo de maiz y a la venta de ganado, inicio con capital propio desde hace 10 años y gracias a su trabjo es como ha podido salir adelante, la joven vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de insumos agricolas abono, pesticidas, fertilizantes, etc. asi como muestra en la fotografia y poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face is pixelated based on her age and the fact that she lives in a dangerous region works growing corn and selling livestock. She started this business with her own money 10 years ago and thanks to her work, she has been able to get ahead. She lives with her two children in a home that she owns.

She is seeking a loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as: manure, pesticides, fertilizers, etc., as is shown in the picture. This investment will allow her to increase her earnings.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies, such as, pesticides, fertilizers, etc...

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is 54 years old and widowed with five children. Belen works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, detergent, shampoo, candies, etc. to sell.

Belen has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year, and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Belen aspires to saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, detergent, shampoo, candies, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 26 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is currently in school.

Nancy is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Nancy has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 51 years old and is married with three children.  

She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Rebecca has been in fattening pigs for six years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eleven years and earns more income from a general store.

Elvira is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, spices, fish, vegetables, etc. for her food vending business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, spices, fish, vegetables, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es:
María, tiene la necesidad de un nuevo crédito para comprar frutas, verduras y legumbres, considera que sí su inventario está surtido con productos de calidad sus clientes continuaran visitando su negocio.
Con el crédito anterior ha tenido un impacto positivo en su negocio, por lo que agradece el apoyo, manifiesta que cuenta con nuevos clientes, genera ingresos suficientes para cumplir con sus obligaciones, la familia se mantiene y se apoyan para seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Maria needs a new loan to buy fruits, vegetables and legumes. She believes that if her inventory is stocked with quality products then her customers will keep visiting her business.

Her previous loan has had a positive impact on her business and she is grateful for the support. She says that she has new customers, generates sufficient income to meet her obligations and takes care of her family who support her to keep progressing.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables and legumes.

loans.name: Elsa Ester

texts.es:
Elsa, de 62 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado y está acompañada, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres. 

Elsa, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, en las parcelas que posee, este oficio lo realiza durante la mañana junto a su esposo, ella se levanta a las 5:30 a.m. para realizar sus actividades y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a ordeñar las vacas y a vender la leche o elaborar quesos para venderlo en los alrededores de la comunidad. 

Elsa, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca, que le ayudará a incrementar la producción de leche y así poder generar más ingresos para su sustento.
texts.en:
Elsa, 62, is married and has a sixth grade education. She works in agriculture and livestock, trades that she learned from her parents.

Elsa farms her own land and she works in the mornings along with her husband. She wakes up at 5:30am to go to work and in the afternoon, she milks the cows, sells their milk and makes cheese to sells throughout the community.

Elsa is seeking a loan to purchase a cow that will allow her to increase her milk production and generate greater earnings.

loans.use: purchase a cow.

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is 61-year-old married man from Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. He lives with his wife, and both are temporarily unemployed.

To generate some income and cover even basic needs, Teimuraz started renting out rooms in his house. Now, he needs financial support to renovate the rooms and raise the rent and get more income.

The startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables poor people to get loans for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1,000 USD and start renovation activities.

He will get more clients by having good living conditions in his house, that will satisfy all his clients' needs. This credit will be a great support for the family.

Teimuraz is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to increase his productivity.

loans.use: to renovate the house and rent rooms at a good price.

loans.name: Quang

texts.en:
Quang is 28 years old and she is married. Quang lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She has been operating a food stall selling fish for 5 years.

Her family is a low-income household in her village, moreover the market need is low in this region. Her income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs be comfortable in her life. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

This is Quang's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.

In the future, Quang hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita lives in the municipality of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married, with three adult children. 

Cristita has been operating a sari-sari store business for 30 years. It started very small and with expansions she was able to make it bigger. She would like to increase her inventory and refill her shelves, but lacks capital for her planned expansion. She is asking for a loan to buy medicines, gift items, canned goods, chips, seasoning, and toiletries. Cristita hopes to manage her business well for a better return on her investment. Her income will be for food, savings and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy medicines, gift items, canned goods, chips, seasoning, and toiletries for her business.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina has received a number of loans in the past which really helped grow her wholesale/retail business. She feels grateful for the untiring support of CCT and Kiva.

She would like to apply for another PHP 20,000 loan to buy several sacks of rice to sell either at wholesale or retail prices. Rice is a main staple in the Philippines, it constitutes a dominant portion of the standard diet of Filipinos. At times she encounters difficulty collecting her receivables but her faith and pleasant disposition carry her through. With the increasing population in their area she has gained good new customers.

Lina hopes to expand her rice selling business so she her children can finish their college education. She values education as a path to better opportunities for her children. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of rice for her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 22 years old and married with one child.

Virginia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Virginia has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gelverie

texts.en:
Gelverie works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Gelverie has been in this business for seven years now.

Gelverie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Gelverie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha works hard to support her family. Juditha is married, and has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

Juditha requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials such as woods, paints, nails, etc. for her business. Juditha has been in this business for 10 years now.

Juditha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials such as woods, paints, nails, etc. for her business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard- working entrepreneur. Juliet is 41 years old, and has one child who is currently in school.

Juliet has a furniture making business in the Philippines. Juliet requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her furniture making business. Juliet has been in this business for 10 years.

Juliet would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her furniture making business

loans.name: Elita

texts.en:
Elita is 51 years old and is married with five children. 

She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Elita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Elita has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Edgar Benjamin

texts.es:
Edgar, de 38 años de edad, creció con sus padres quienes le enseñaron la agricultura y la ganadería; estudio hasta noveno grado, su familia se conforma por su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, él se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. junto a su esposa que le apoyan en las actividades que realiza.

Edgar, se dedica  a sembrar durante la mañana en las parcelas que posee cerca de su residencia y en el transcurso de la tarde cuida y ordeña las vacas que posee y su esposa vende la leche en los alrededores de la comunidad.

Edgar, necesita el préstamo para comprar una novilla, porque espera que en el futuro le ayude a incrementar la producción leche, para elaborar lácteos que comercializara su esposa.

Edgar, sueña con comprar un terreno en donde pueda sembrar y pastar sus animales.
texts.en:
Edgar, 38, grew up with parents who taught him farming and animal husbandry. He studied up to grade 9. His family includes a wife and 4 children. He wakes up at 4:00 a.m. with his wife, who supports him in his activities.

Edgar spends the morning planting his parcels of land near his home and during the afternoons, he milks and takes care of the cows he has. His wife sells the milk in the surrounding areas of the community.

Edgar needs this loan to buy a heifer because he hopes that in the future it will help him increase milk production to make dairy products that his wife will sell.

Edgar dreams of buying land where he can plants and put his cows out to pasture.

loans.use: buy a heifer.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.en:
Angela is a 47-year-old-married woman who lives in the municipality of Copacabana. She has two children, a boy and a girl, whom she loves very much and who have made her life better. Angela has a big talent; she is an excellent cook. She prepares delicious food, but just for her family.

Her family has some economic problems nowadays, because a while ago she started a business selling some recognized health products and she made a bad investment. Now, trying to recover from that, she wants to study so someday she can start her own cooking business.

She’s asking for a loan so she can pay for her studies in fusion cooking. You can help her with the loan and let her learn a lot so she can start making her way professionally.

loans.use: pay for her studies in fusion cooking

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew has applied for a loan of ugx2,500,000 in 12 months. He is 26 years old. This is his second loan from UGAFODE MDI.

Andrew is an agriculturalist and has a bar as a side business. He works for 8 hours a day. He also gets income from poultry. He started these businesses so he can raise money and improve the lifestyle for himself and his dependents. He says he will use this loan to buy more poultry which will help him generate more income. His dream is to build a house. His main challenges are pests and diseases that affect his poultry. He is honest and says the UGAFODE MDI staff have been very helpful.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Pastor

texts.en: Pastor is a well known farmer mainly dealing in coffee farming in akayanja village, kitojo parish, Bushenyi District.  He was born in 1991 and started this business in 2006.  He cares for his wife and one child.  His side business is a retail shop that also generates income to support his family. His child is one year old and not yet in school. He has applied for a loan of UGX3,000,000 (three million shillings) to buy fertilizer.  The fertilizer will help increase the coffee yield and his family's income. He is an honest man and works six hours a day. He sells to coffee factories around the Bushenyi District. He faces challenges with pests and diseases which can affect the harvest. He dreams to build a big house.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Rakhi

texts.en:
Rakhi is from a small village called Latapota, in Falakata, West Bengal, India. She is a homemaker who is 32 years old and looks after her husband and two children (one son and one daughter). Her daughter reads in grade nine and her son is in grade seven.

Her husband has been engaged in agriculture for many years. He cultivates different crops and sells the gathered harvest in the local markets. Now they are thinking of cultivating a crop that is profitable and is an all-season crop. So they have decided to grow paddy on their farmland. Because of having inadequate capital, they have decided to take some financial help for cultivation.

Rakhi has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) and the requested loan is very important for Rakhi to be able to purchase fertilizer and seeds and bear the operational costs of paddy cultivation. The loan will greatly help this family to organize the cultivation work and they hope for a good harvest. They hope it will be a lucrative business as the crop is in tremendous demand in the market. She dreams of purchasing new land and to expand their agribusiness.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and bear the operational cost of growing paddy.

loans.name: Shibani

texts.en:
Shibani is a very active lady of 40 years. She lives with her husband in the small village of Ramthanga in Falakata. She is a homemaker, blessed with three children (two sons and a daughter). Her daughter is married and her two sons are involved with some income-generating work. To make a living for the family, Shibani's husband has been farming various crops and vegetables on their own plot of land. He has been doing this for four years. He works arduously to get ahead with the great support of Shibani. He sells the produce from his agribusiness to the local markets. This agribusiness supplies them with the necessary finances to provide themselves with clothing, food, medicine etc.

Now they want to expand their business by cultivating paddy. Being a staple, paddy is in great demand in their locality and is widely used in India. So Shibani has taken a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase good quality seeds, fertilizers and other agricultural inputs that will help her to have a smooth cultivation of this nutritious and profitable crop. This loan will also help her to bear the operational cost of paddy cultivation throughout the season.

Shibani’s goal is to continue increasing the paddy cultivation, strengthening her family's economy and saving money for enhancing their agribusiness.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase good quality seeds and fertilizers and bear the operational cost for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is 41 years old and married with seven children. With five children currently in school, Lerma works very hard to provide for them.

Lerma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store. Lerma has been in this business for five years, and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, soft drinks, beers, etc.

In the future, Lerma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is 59 years old and married with five children.

Lily is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Lily requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs. Lily has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lily would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 51 years old and married with three children.

Lolita is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lolita has been raising livestock for 5 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 6 times in the past to sustain her business.

Lolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 43 years old with three children, all of whom are currently in school. She also has a a live-in partner with six children. Irene is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Irene has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Irene requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Irene has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Irene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Vivincia

texts.en:
Vivincia is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Vivincia has been in this business for two years. Vivincia earns more income from buying and selling bananas.

Vivincia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 51 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marilyn has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 3 years. Marilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Marina De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Marina, convive con su esposo e hijos en un ambiente muy familiar, su fuente de ingresos para aportar al sustento de su hogar es la crianza de cerdos, actividad que práctica desde hace tres años por lo que ya es conocida en la zona por su negocio.
Pide ayuda con un crédito para comprar concentrado y vitaminas para los cerdos, podrá tener a su alcance materiales para mejorar lo forma de cuidarlos, pretende tener más cerdos sanos y gordos para atender a sus clientes y así seguir teniendo recursos económicos para disminuir necesidades en su hogar.
Su visión es seguir trabajando y enseñar a sus hijos a luchar para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Marina lives with her husband and kids in a familiar environment. The source of income for the maintenance of her home is the breeding of pigs, a business she's been running for the last 3 years and for which she is known in the area.

She's requesting a loan to buy pig feed and vitamins for the pigs in order to have the materials to better take care of them within her reach. She hopes to have more healthy and fat pigs to provide her clients and that way maintain an income that will cover the household expenses.

Her vision is to continue working and teach her children how to fight to move ahead in life.

loans.use: buy pig feed and vitamins for the pigs in order to have the materials to better care of them within her reach.

loans.name: Luz Francely

texts.en:
Luz is a 40-year-old married woman who lives in the municipality of Sonson. Thanks to her father, last year she started her own business, all because she had some economic needs and needed to find a way to provide for her family. She owns a growing products business, where she works all week so she can offer quality products.

The inputs she needs for her crops are really expensive and she wants to invest in her business so she can increase the profits and her crops. She is asking for a loan so she can buy a pump that will help her with her growing and the irrigation.

Luz dreams about paying for her children's education so they can grow up as good people that can give themselves a good quality of life like she’s trying to do right now. Help Luz accomplish all her dreams with just a loan.

loans.use: buy a pump that will help her with her growing and the irrigation

loans.name: Kellen

texts.en:
Kellen is a repeat entrepreneur and well known farmer. She mainly deals in tea farming in Kigondo village, Kakanju parish, Busheny District. She started this business in 2005 and she has managed to sustain her family with it. She is married with four children, ages 16, 13, 10 and 7 years old. All of her kids are in school. She makes additional income from rearing goats and coffee farming. This has also helped her earn some good money to support her family. This is her second loan cycle from UGAFODE MDI. She has applied for a loan of shs 1,000,000 (one million shillings) to buy fertilizer for her tea farm to increase the yield and support her family. She is an honest lady in her business and she works hard to achieve more.

She sells to all coffee factories around Bushenyi District. She is faced with challenges from price fluctuations that affect the harvest. Her dream is to educate all of her children.
She appreciates the support and partnership.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
Ana, de 58 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, sus padres le enseñaron las actividades de la ganadería y la agricultura, está acompañada y junto a su pareja cultivan la tierra y cuidan las vacas que poseen.

Ana, se dedica a trabajar en las parcelas junto a su esposo durante la mañana y en el transcurso de la tarde recoge fruta de temporada para ir a venderla al mercado de la localidad.

Ana, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca, para que en el futuro le ayude a producir más leche para la elaboración de lácteos.

Ana, sueña con comprar una yunta de bueyes para arar la tierra y sacar la cosecha.
texts.en:
Ana, 58, has a ninth grade education. Her parents taught her to farm and raise livestock. She is married and works farming and raising cattle with her husband. In the mornings, Ana works the fields with her husband, and in the afternoons she picks fruit, based on the season, to sell in the local market.

Ana is seeking a loan to purchase a cow so that in the future they can increase their milk production to make dairy products. Ana dreams of purchasing a pari of oxen to plow their land and harvest their crops.

loans.use: purchase a cow.

loans.name: Maria Amelia

texts.es: Maria de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos y gallinas desde hace 10 años comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra salir adelante con su familia, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando puertas y ventanas nuevas, pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para comprar los materiales necesarios para mejorar su vivienda y asi vivir mas seguros y comodos.
texts.en:
Maria, 45, lives with her husband and son in a home that they own. She works raising chickens, which she has done for the past 10 years. She sells her products in neighboring towns, and with her earnings she is able to get ahead with her family.

She wants to make renovations to her home by replacing some of the doors and windows, but she does not have the necessary funds, which is why she is requesting this loan. With this loan, she will purchase the needed materials to renovate her home so that her family can live more safely and comfortably.

loans.use: purchase necessary materials, such as: balconies, windows, doors, etc.

loans.name: Ngân

texts.en:
Mrs Ngân is 55 years old and she is married. She has been operating a food stall selling fish for more than 10 years. Ngân lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. The income from her business is not high enough to do what she really needs to comfort her life. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

This is Ngân's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true. In the future, Ngân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Secelie

texts.en:
Secelie is 46 years old and married.

Secelie is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Secelie requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Secelie has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 26 times in the past to sustain the business.

Secelie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Vitaliana

texts.en:
Vitaliana works hard to support her family. Vitaliana is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Vitaliana requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, flour, etc. for her food production business.

Vitaliana has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Vitaliana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, flour, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Beata Benefreda

texts.en:
Beata Benefreda is 50 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Beata Benefreda is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Beata Benefreda has been in this business for 3 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Mirna Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mirna, de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, sus padres le enseñaron las actividades de la agricultura y la ganadería, estas actividades las desarrolla desde hace varios años; está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. 

Mirna, se dedica junto a su esposo a trabajar en las parcelas que alquilan durante la mañana y en el transcurso de la tarde ella se dedica a ordeñar las vacas que poseen, para vender la leche en los alrededores de la comunidad.

Mirna, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca, para producir más leche y poder elaborar queso y crema para vender.

Mirna, sueña con comprar un vehículo y así poder realizar viajes dentro y fuera de donde residen.
texts.en:
Mirna is 45 years old and studied until the ninth grade. Her parents taught her the agricultural and ranching business, and she has developed in these fields for several years. She is married and her husband earns a living in agriculture.

In the morning, Mirna works together with her husband in the plots they rent and in the course of the afternoon, she dedicates herself to milking the cows she owns in order to sell the milk in the vicinity of her community.

Mirna needs the load to buy a cow in order to produce more milk and to be able to produce cheese and cream to sell.

Mirna dreams of buying a vehicle and in this way be ale to make trips in and out of where they live.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Flavio De Jesus

texts.en:
Flavio is a 46-year-old-married man, who lives in the municipality of Bello. He has one daughter with his wife, whom he loves very much. For more than 10 years, this man has been running a busimess raising cattle, something he inherited from his family and learned, thanks to his father.

He wants to invest in his business so that he can improve his sales and increase his clients. He focuses all of this thinking on giving his family a good quality of life. He’s asking for a loan so that he can buy a cow and food for her and for the other animals he has.

Flavio has been working for many years in his business. One of his dreams is to leave his business to his daughter so that she takes charge of it.

You can help Flavio with just a loan and get him closer to achieving his goals.

loans.use: to buy a cow and food for her and for the other animals he has.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.en:
Francisco is 57 years old and lives in the municipality of El Carmen de Viboral. Unfortunately, recently, he lost his wife, something that was really hard but that he faced with dignity and a lot of strength to keep going and to give his family a good life. He has four grown children, who help him in the business he’s been running since 1985: a farm where he raises cattle and grows different products.

Now he is more decided than ever to improve his business and make it grow. He wants to invest in it so it can get bigger and last in time. He is asking for a loan so he can buy a milk cow, some fertilizer, irrigation and agricultural inputs and to have some working capital.

Francisco dreams to pay for his children's education and to give his whole family a good quality of life. Help him now so he can achieve all his goals.

loans.use: buy a milk cow, some fertilizer, irrigation and agricultural inputs and to have some working capital.

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en:
Vevencia is 65 years old and married with six children.

Vevencia is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Vevencia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Vevencia has been farming sugarcane for 16 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 23 times in the past to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Vevencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 40 years old and lives in the municipality of Fresno. For more than 5 years he has been running his own business; he cuts grass and works as a gardener, something he learned thanks to a friend and which he does because he loves working with nature.

This business is the only job he has to provide for his family: that’s why he wants to increase his profits. He also would love to see his business last in time. Right now he wants to invest in his business so he’s asking for a loan to fix his scythe and to repair his chainsaw so that he can keep working.

Nelson is a family man, so his dreams revolve around his family, and he wants to pay for his children's education so that they grow up to be good people. You can help Nelson to achieve his goals: a loan will get him a lot closer.

loans.use: to fix his scythe and to repair his chainsaw so that he can keep working.

loans.name: Antonia De Jesus

texts.es:
Antonia, de 52 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, estudio hasta sexto grado, ella creció con sus padres, está acompañada y tuvo hijos pero ya no viven con ella.

Antonia, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol junto a su esposo, ellos siembran en una parcela que alquila durante la mañana y en la tarde cuida y ordeña las vacas, mientras su esposo se va a trabajar a otras parcelas como jornal. 

Antonia, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar como abono, semilla, pesticida y arada; con la amplia experiencia que tiene espera obtener una buena cosecha que le generara buenos ingresos.

Antonia, sueña con comprar más vacas para producir leche y venderla.
texts.en:
Antonia, 52, works farming and raising livestock. She was raised by her parents and she has a sixth grade education. She is married and she has children who no longer live with them. Antonia works growing corn and beans with her husband. They farm a plot of land that they rent. They farm in the mornings, and in the afternoons she cares for and milks their cows while her husband goes to work on other farms as a day laborer.

Antonia is seeking a loan to purchase agricultural supplies, such as: fertilizer, seed, pesticides and plows. With her vast experience, she hopes to yield a good harvest that will generate good earnings. Antonia dream of purchasing more cows to produce milk and sell.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, seeds, pesticides and plows.

loans.name: Maria Matilde

texts.es:
María Matilde,con 33 años de edad, soltera, con 2 hijos, vive con su familia en este mismo distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú, en una zona rural.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

María Matilde se dedica a brindar los servicios de jornalería, contando con herramientas propias, como palana, bicicleta, pico y hoz; con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio.Negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para arreglos de vivienda y para mantenimiento de equipos y herramientas, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio; Ella piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona.

María Matilde ha tenido tres créditos de 3400,00; 1500,00 y 2000,00 los cuales los ha cancelado de manera puntual. Desde que se convirtió en nuestro socio, su negocio ha mejorado y su calidad de vida de igual forma.
texts.en:
María Matilde, 33 years old, is single and has two children.  She lives a rural area with her family in the Oyotún district, located in the Chiclayo province and the Lambayeque department of Peru.  Its inhabitants make a living mostly in agriculture, livestock raising and commerce. 

María Matilde makes a living by providing day laborer services with her own tools, including a shovel, bicycle, pickaxe, and sickle.  She has more than 10 years of experience in the field and her business is located in her house.  She is requesting a loan to make housing repairs and to maintain her equipment and tools.  This investment will help her keep her equipment and tools in better condition, which has a great impact on her business.  She intends to increase the productivity of her services so that she can better serve the diverse needs of the clients in her area.  

María Matilde has had three loans with amounts of 3,400.00, 1,500.00 and 2,000.00, which she has paid off promptly.  Since she became our partner, her business has improved, just as much as her quality of life.

loans.use: to make housing repairs and to maintain her equipment and tools

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer is 27 years old and lives in the municipality of Argelia. He has three children: two daughters and one son, 6, 4 and 1 respectably, whom he loves very much and whom he wants to see grow up with a good quality of life. For 10 years this man has been running his own business, he grows coffee, something really traditional in Colombia.

He wants to increase his profits so he can give his family a better life and make his business grow, so it can not just last in time, but become successful. The high costs of the inputs hasn’t allowed him to invest what he wants, so he’s asking for a loan so he can buy agricultural inputs like fertilizers and insecticides so his crops have better quality.

Elmer needs to repair his house because it has some structural issues that he has to take care so his family can be safe. This loan will help Elmer in his business and in his personal life, for his family this is a great opportunity, do it now.

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs like fertilizers and insecticides so his crops have better quality.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
La socia Adela se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra café y plátanos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Adela continues to make a living in the agriculture business and has a plot of agricultural land, where she sows coffee and bananas.  Adela works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm.  She has several years of experience in this business and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand her agriculture business.  She is requesting the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer.  Adela is happy for the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is truly encouraged that he has received a number of loans in the past which have helped sustain his direct selling business and his rag-making business. He feels fulfilled that he is able to carry on with his responsibility to provide for his family.

Once again he needs funds in the amount of 25,000 PHP to buy more fabric, scrap cloth, thread, and other materials to meet the increasing demand of customers for his rags. He will also pay for personal products to meet customer’s orders. His round, palm sized rags are useful for cleaning cabinets and kitchen counters. His businesses means a lot to him, for this is where he his income to send his child to College comes from. Education is his hope and the path for a better future for his children. He thanks God for CCT and Kiva for your continuous support for small businesses like his.

Abraham dreams for his children to become professionals someday. He prays for happiness and contentment always in life. He meets weekly with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics, thread, and supplies for his rag making business.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La socia Estela  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere que sus hijos que terminen de estudiar, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant grande. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras, arroz y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Estela continues to make a living in the food sales business.  She is an enterprising woman who, with the support from her business, wants for her children to finish their studies.  Her dream is to have a large restaurant.  She is requesting the loan to buy chicken, vegetables, rice and meat.  Estela is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, vegetables, rice and meat

loans.name: Ana Bella

texts.es: Ana de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijas, ella se dedica desde hace 20 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana, 35 years old, lives in her own house with her three daughters.  For twenty years, she has made a living by making and selling tortillas.  Her business is located in her place of residence and she has several clients.  With the profits that she makes, she is able to cover some of her household expenses.  She is requesting a loan to purchase corn in bulk and lime to be able to continue making tortillas so that she can have a better income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase corn in bulk and lime

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Margaret learnt about the Fresh Life Toilet through Mary one of Fresh Life Toilets’ operators who has provided the facility for her tenants. She loved the facility’s cleanliness and odorless features hence her desire to join the movement.

Margaret lives in Kayaba and, as she says, the only available toilet facilities are not close-by. They are not available for easy access during the night. As such, Margaret has resolved to provide easily accessible toilet services to her community by installing one Fresh Life Toilet.
While her community will gain access to clean, hygienic and easily accessible toilet facilities, she also anticipates earning some income so as to provide for her grandchildren.

Let us help Margaret in acquiring one Fresh Life Toilet

loans.use: to pay for one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Ranjana

texts.en:
Ranjana is a rural woman of 26 years. She is married and blessed with two sons. One of her sons reads in grade four and the other one is in grade one. They live in a small village in Falakata, West Bengalin in their own house.

Ranjana's husband is involved in a nut business. But his income is inconsistent and they find it hard to depend on his income. So to earn additional income, Ranjana has been engaged in a milk-selling business for four years. Now to develop her business, she wants to purchase a dairy cow to rear and sell milk. She thinks it will earn more profit as cow's milk is in great demand in her locality. She runs the household efficiently and manages to save a small amount each week.

Now she is seeking the loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase one more cow so that she can develop her milk-selling business. Her main clients are her neighbors. Buying a cow will increase her financial security in the long run by giving them an asset they can sell during hard times. Her main challenge is to provide her children with a proper education, which she hopes will be possible through the profit generated from her business.

She gives her heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es: Ana de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica a vender huevos y queso en las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace mas de un año, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de huevos y quesos por mayor y así obtener mejores ganancias y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Ana is 39 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their daughter.  For more than a year, she has made a living selling eggs and cheese in the different neighborhoods that are close to her home. With the earnings she obtains from her sales, she manages to cover some of the household expenses. 

She is asking for a loan to buy wholesale eggs and cheeses and that way have better earnings and be able to give her family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy wholesale eggs and cheeses

loans.name: Mosoq Ñustagroup

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MOSOQ ÑUSTA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Lamay, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Leonarda ella es conviviente y tiene 38 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The members belong to the Communal bank “MOSOQ ÑUSTA”. This bank is located in the district of Lamay, belonging to the province of Calca and department of Cusco. Leonarda is one of its members. She is 38 years old and has a domestic partner and 4 children. Leonarda works in the handicraft business. She sells tapestries, sweaters, blankets and looms. She sells diverse tapestries. Leonarda works from 8:00 a.m until 7:00 p.m. She has worked already 8 years in this business and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her business of selling tapestries and looms. She is requesting a loan to buy tapestries, sweaters and looms. The other members work in the business of sale of sweets, sale of clothes, grocery store and restaurant. Through this way, Leonarda is grateful to those who form part of this dream and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tapestries, sweaters and looms.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es: Fabiola es una ama de casa que encontró la manera de ofrecer bienestar a su familia por medio de su proyecto de negocio, esta emprendedora mujer de 34 años es habitante de un barrio de Arjona municipio de Bolívar y decidió seguir el consejo de una amiga, quien le sugirió vender carnes frías entre sus vecinos. Con escaso capital inició su sueño de prosperidad y compró un variado surtido de embutidos; jamones, salchichas, salchichones y mortadelas, que entregó a sus clientes para cancelar en cómodas cuotas.  Su éxito no se hizo esperar, hoy en día su oferta de alimentos se amplió al incorporar un nuevo producto, pasteles que su madre elabora a base de arroz, carne de cerdo,  pollo y vegetales, los cuales vende todos los fines de semana por encargos.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en un mayor surtido de carnes frías y comprar víveres para la preparación de los pasteles, así incrementará sus ventas y con ello sus utilidades.  Fabiola es madre de dos hijas de 14 y 9 años y su cónyuge la apoya con su labor comercial.  Su meta a futuro es ampliar su base de clientes y comercializar otros productos entre ellos joyas en plata porque conoce sobre éste negocio.
texts.en:
Fabiola is a housewife who found a way to offer wellbeing to her family through her business project. This enterprising 34-year-old woman lives in the Arjona neighborhood in the Bolívar municipality and decided to follow the advice of a friend who suggested that she sell cold meats to her neighbors. 

With scarce capital, she initiated her dream of prosperity and bought a variety of cold meats: ham, sausages, and bologna, which she provided to her customers to pay off her debts in comfortable installments. Success came quickly, now her offering of food has increased to incorporate a new product: pastries that her mother makes with rice, pork meat, chicken, and vegetables, which she sells every weekend on demand. Now she is applying for a Kiva credit, the first financing that the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation has made, to invest in a bigger supply of cold meats and to buy supplies to prepare the pastries. That way she will increase her sales and with that her profits. Fabiola is the mother of two daughters who are 14 and 9 years old, and her husband helps with his commercial labor. 

Her future goal is to grow her client base and sell other projects like silver jewelry because she knows about that business.

loans.use: to invest in a bigger supply of cold meats and to buy supplies for preparing pastries.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de cuarenta y siete años de edad, muy trabajadora ella  se dedica al arreglo de zapatos, actividad que heredo hace más de veinte años ya que su esposo murió atropellado en su bicicleta cuando iba a comprar material para la zapatería, desde allí transformo a este negocio en el sustento diario para ella y sus tres hijos.
Ella necesita el dinero para poder comprar tacos, hilos, suelas, y herramientas que le permitan hacer menos difícil y más rápido su trabajo para obtener mayor ganancia y satisfacer sus necesidades básicas y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martha is a 47-year-old woman who is very hardworking.  She makes a living repairing shoes, a profession that she inherited over twenty years ago when her husband was struck on his bicycle when he went out to purchase materials for the shoe shop.  From there, she transformed this business into the livelihood for herself and her three children.  

She needs the money to purchase heels, thread, soles and tools will that allow her to do her work more efficiently in order to make a better profit and to meet her and her children’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more work instruments and materials

loans.name: Sampa

texts.en:
Sampa lives in a small village in Kandi in the Murshidabad district. The mother of two daughters, Sampa is an energetic and hardworking woman of 27 years. One of her daughters is a student in grade one and the other is a kid now. She received an education up to grade eight. Being a responsible mother and dedicated housewife, she runs her family with great care.

Her husband is associated with a clothing business. He purchases varieties of clothing from the wholesale market and sells them in their locality. He sells clothing like saris, petticoats, blouses, pants, shirts etc. He has been involved in this business for the past 10 years and has long experience in this area of business. In the upcoming festive season, his valuable customers’ demands will increase, so he likes to restore his collection of clothing with more designed items. As he has no capital in hand, Sampa requests a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to invest in her husband’s business.

She will use the loan amount to buy more stocks of clothing for her husband’s business to better supply their clients because festival season is knocking at the door. She hopes the expansion of the business will earn more revenue for her husband to provide proper economical provisions for the family.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of clothing for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Elvis Inocente

texts.es:
Elvis Inocente con 39 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, sin carga familiar, vive en casa de su padre, en el centro del distrito de Cayalti, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Elvis Inocente se dedica a la actividad de venta de comida preparada, pollos al cilindro los cuáles los reparte a domicilio. El crédito será invertido en la implementación de un local para el mejor desarrollo de su negocio y con esto mejorar su número de ventas y tener mayores ingresos.

Socio nuevo en Epyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Elvis Inocente is 39 years old, unmarried, without a family. He lives in his father's house in the center of the Cayalti district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department, in Perú. Most of the inhabitants of this area make a living in agriculture, livestock, and retail.

Elvis Inocente makes a living selling prepared food: rotisserie chicken which he delivers to his customers' homes. The loan will be invested in establishing a restaurant for better development of his business and to improve the number of sales and earn a better income.

He is a new member of Epyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to establish a restaurant

loans.name: Begilia

texts.en:
Begilia is 58 years old and married.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Begilia is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Begilia has been in the pig fattening business for 10 years and she also earns additional income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Pratima is a rural woman from a small village in Kandi, Murshidabad district. She is 48 years old and blessed with three children (a daughter and two sons). One of them is jobless and the other two are students of the graduate level.

Her husband runs his fast food business to earn their livelihood since this is their sole source of income. Pratima assists her husband in preparing the food. They prepare various kinds of fast food like chops, samosa (In Bengal it is called “singhara”), savory puffed rice, puri, paratha etc. and sell these tasteful items in the market by wandering through with a cycle van. The couple works hard to run their business smoothly but now the business is not going well, so they want to enhance the business for more income. For this, they need capital. To achieve the same, Pratima seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy more necessary ingredients like oil, gram flour, puffed rice, spices, nuts, peas, potatoes, etc. in bulk so that they can make their fast food items on a large scale to serve more customers.

Pratima hopes this will enable her to increase the monthly income for her family’s well being and can save for the future to provide a good education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary ingredients in bulk for making more fast food.

loans.name: Aida Julieta

texts.en:
Aida is a 36-year-old-married woman who lives in the municipality of Cañasgordas. She has 2 children, a daughter who is 12 years and a son who is 10. She has owned a restaurant since last year, something she started because of the economic needs of her family and her huge cooking talent.

There’s a lot of competition in the municipality, so to improve her business she wants to invest in it, so she can increase her sales and clients and so her business will last in time. She asked for a loan so that she can buy a stove and some cooking inputs she needs to keep making her delicious food.

Aida has many dreams, but the most important one is to buy a house for her family so they can have a good quality of life. You can help Aida to accomplish all of her dreams with just one loan.

loans.use: to buy a stove and some cooking inputs she needs to keep making her delicious food.

loans.name: Laureana

texts.es: Doña Laureana de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 30 años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, gracias a su trabajo es como puede solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Laureana is 62 years old, and she lives in her own house with her family. She has made a living creating clothing for 30 years. Her sewing shop is located in her home and she has many customers due to the quality of the clothing she makes. Thanks to her work, she is able to cover some of her household costs.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabrics, buttons, elastic, etc. and that way be able to continue her work, which generates a good income.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabrics, buttons, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Elvis Enrique

texts.es: Elvis es un empresario independiente que se dedica al mantenimiento y reparación de motocicletas, esta profesión la estudió en una corporación en donde adquirió todo el conocimiento necesario para ofrecer un servicio de calidad, sin embargo este emprendedor hombre no se limitó a ofrecer simplemente el servicio, por el contrario palpó la oportunidad de vender los repuestos y componentes necesarios en las reparaciones y mantenimientos de las motocicletas.  En la actualidad cuenta con diez años en esta labor, ofreciendo servicio a todo costo y recibe diariamente en su taller a los Cartageneros que necesitan cambios de cadenas, guayas, luces entre otros y reparaciones de motor, balanceo y demás.  Elvis está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de repuestos; pastillas de frenos, luces, tornillos, frenos, aceite entre otros.  Para Elvis es muy importante contar con un inventario bien surtido para garantizar ventas diarias en su negocio y con esta inversión tendrá un completo surtido a su disposición y la de sus clientes.  Su principal desafío es ahorrar y su meta es crecer en su negocio y ofrecerles estudio profesional a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Elvis is an independent businessman who makes a living maintaining and repairing motorcycles. He studied this profession in a corporation where he acquired all of the necessary knowledge to offer quality service. Even so, this enterprising man does not limit himself to simply offering service, on the contrary, he took the opportunity to sell replacement parts and necessary components for repairs and maintenance of motorcycles. He has been doing this work for ten years now, offering service of all costs, and daily he welcomes customers from Cartagena to his shop who need to change their chains, locks, lights, etc. and to repair motors, balance their vehicle, and more. 

Elvis is applying for his first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which he will invest in buying replacement parts: brake pads, lights, screws, brakes, oil, etc. For Elvis, it's very important to have a well-stocked inventory to guarantee daily sales in his business, and with this investment he will have a complete supply at his and his customers' disposal. His main challenge is to save money, and his goal is to grow his business and offer the opportunity of professional study to his two sons.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts:  brake pads, lights, screws, brakes, oil, etc.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Erna works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Erna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy vitamins, vaccines and feeds for her business.

Erna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, vaccines and feeds for her business

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo is a 35-year-old man who is currently married, but still hasen't been blessed with children. He is only in charge of providing for him and his wife. He accomplishes this by driving a taxi, but the owner of this taxi is his father. Guillermo gives a fee of the profit to his father, and he thinks this is fair, but he wants to buy a taxi of his own to increase his income.

When he reaches this goal, he is willing to hire someone to drive his father's cab. His biggest dream is to own a small taxi company, but he knows that it may take some time, Now he is only looking to get an extra cab, and to achieve this goal he is asking for a 10,527.00 MXN loan to make the first payment on the new car.

loans.use: To buy a taxi

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri is 59 years old. She is from the village of Sulori and lives with her husband. They own agricultural land and also one milk cow. She realizes income from selling the agricultural products, milk, and nuts in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. Meri's husband helps her greatly in her everyday activities.

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way and increase their income, Meri decided to purchase additional stock of nuts at wholesale price, keep it and then re-sell during the winter, when it's price is highest. Her request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.

The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased, regards Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to purchase stock of nuts and sell it during the winter season.

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en:
Silveria is a farmer from the town of Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She is married with three adult children. She has been in the farming business for 40 years now. This is the source of her income.

Silveria is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pay for labor for other farmers who will help work on the land. With this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield.

In the future, Silveria hopes to make her farming business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Salomon

texts.en:
Salomon is an artisan from Peru who specializes in ceramic masks. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of ceramic materials.



Salomon has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:



"I am a self-taught artist, dedicating myself to ceramics since my youth. I specialize in masks influenced by the Vicus, Moche, and Nazca cultures. I focus largely on the mix of form and color: despite a lack of formal training I have created a unique, personal style. I hope to improve my work with each passing day, and achieve a style that is gratifying for me and that it will resonate in people's hearts and minds."



"This loan will allow me to acquire the materials I need to craft more masks and add new designs to my collection. Many thanks!"



Use the link below to view Salomon's ceramic masks on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/810

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of ceramic materials

loans.name: Jose Moises

texts.es: José un joven trabajador y con muchos deseos de superación de 22 años de edad vive en casa familiar junto a su compañera de vida. Él se dedica a la venta de ropa y lonas para carro y es de esa manera que se gana la vida para llevar el sustento a su hogar, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 1 año en una zona de mucha afluencia de personas. Su venta José la realiza un vehículo que le permite transportar más fácilmente su mercadería. Por lo anterior José desea mejorar la entrada de su vivienda para poder ingresar con el vehículo, además de invertir en más productos para su negocio, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: prendas de vestir, lona y materiales para mejorar la entrada de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jose, a hard-working young man who is 22 years old and is eager to get ahead in life, lives in his family's house along with his life partner. He earns a living selling clothing, and canvas car covers and thus supports his home. He has worked at these sales in a busy area for one year.

Jose makes his sales using a vehicle which allows him to transport his merchandise more easily. Consequently, he wants to improve the entrance of his home in order to be able to drive in with the vehicle, and also to invest in purchase of more products to sell. Jose is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy clothing, canvas and materials to improve the entrance to his home.

loans.use: to buy clothing, canvas,  and materials to improve the entrance to his home.

loans.name: Jose Ruben

texts.es: José de 52 años de edad habita en casa propia con su esposa, la cual también aporta para la economía del hogar. José trabaja en área de mantenimiento en una empresa privada desde hace 4 años, en el cual ha sabido ganarse la confianza con su responsabilidad y honradez. El desea hacerle mejoras a unas paredes de su casa para poder hacer el cambio de techo, ya que por cuestiones de dinero no ha podido, por ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, ladrillos, madera y lámina para poder hacer el cambio de techo de la vivienda y tener una mayor protección en la época de lluvia.
texts.en:
Jose, 52 years old, lives in his own house with his wife, who also works to provide financial support for their home. For four years, Jose has been working in maintenance in a private company, where he has gained trust through his responsibility and honesty.

Jose wants to make improvements o the walls of his house in order to be able to replace the roof, but for financial reasons has not been able to do so. He is asking for a loan from FUSAI to spend on cement, bricks, wood and mental sheeting to be able to replace the roof of his home and have better protection in the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, wood and metal sheeting to replace the roof of his home.

loans.name: Maria Lorna

texts.en:
Maria Lorna is a woman from the town of Duero, Bohol. She is married with two teenagers aged 14 and 15. Maria Lorna has run a sari-sari (variety) store for nine years now. She sells items ranging from sugar, coffee, noodles, shampoo, cooking oil, and soap to various snack foods.

She is asking for a loan to buy SMART sim cards, purified water, canned food, eggs, noodles, cooking oil, detergent, bath soap, shampoo and chips to cater for the needs of her customers, as well as maintain the inventory of her store.

In the future Maria Lorna hopes to expand her business and increase her profits so she can educate her children.

loans.use: to buy SMART sim cards, purified water, canned food, eggs, noodles, cooking oil, detergent, bath soap, shampoo and chips

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en:
Claudette is a 36-year-old woman from Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She earns a living through her hog raising business. Claudette has been in the business for four years now.

Claudette is asking to take a loan to buy piglets, supplements, and hardwood for renovation of her barn. With a loan, Claudette will be able to improve her hog raising business and make it a success.

Her income will be used for the schooling of her four children ages 2, 3, 6 and 9. Moreover, she wants to save money for future reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, supplements, and hardwood for renovation of her barn

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the community of Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. In her store she sells basic household items like soft drinks, chips, detergent, canned goods and seasoning. This business is existing for three years now.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy coffee, soft drinks, toiletries, canned goods, chips and seasoning for better income. She is 33 years old and married with three children ages 4, 9 and 10. In the future, Catherine hopes to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy coffee, soft drinks, toiletries, canned goods, chips and seasoning

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Teresa de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su nieto, ella posee un comedor ubicado cerca de su lugar de residecnia desde hace 5 años, y tambien dese hace 15 años se dedica a la elaboracion de dulces artesanales, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo es como puede salir adelante, ela esta solicitando un credito para la compra de materia prima como: arroz, pollo, carne verduras y otros productos para seguir con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Teresa is 60 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and grandson.

She has had an eatery located close to her place of residence for 5 years. In addition, for 15 years she has worked in the production of artisan candies. With what she earns from her work she is able to get ahead.

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies like rice, chicken, meat, vegetables and other products to continue with her work and thereby to have a better economic income.

loans.use: to buy supplies like rice, chicken, meat, vegetables and other products.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: José de 35 años de edad habita en vivienda familiar con su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 16, 13 y 1 año y medio por los que ha esforzado por salir adelante. Él se dedica a prestar sus servicios en una empresa privada como motorista y de esta forma es que obtiene sus ingresos para llevar el sustento a su familia. José desea mejorar su vivienda ya que en la época de invierno en el área de su cuarto el agua se filtra por encontrarse deterioradas las láminas,  es por ello que él solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: madera, clavos y láminas para mejorar el techo de su vivienda y de esta manera brindar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en: José, 35 years old, lives in his home with his wife and their 3 children, ages 16, 13, and 1, for whom he has made an effort to get ahead. He works lending his services in a private business as a driver and in this way he obtains income to support his family. José wants to improve his home since in the winter season in his bedroom area, water breaks in because the metal roofing is damaged. That is why he requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in: wood, nails, and metal sheeting to improve the roof of his home and in this way provide better security for his family.

loans.use: to invest in: wood, nails, and metal sheeting to improve the roof of his home.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.en:
Hortencia is a 40-year-old woman. She is married to Jorge, a loving husband. They have a son who is 26 years old, but he departed for the USA seeking a better life. He tries to help his parents by sending some money every month.

Hortencia makes a living working as a housekeeper. She has been working in that occupation for the last 15 years. She wants to build a fence for her house and place some doors in it. If she could get a 15,790 MXN loan, she would be able to make the improvements she wants.

She has all the support of her husband. He also wants to arrange those parts of the house. Kubo supports them because of the close bonds they share. They are a united couple, and that's why Kubo believes they will succeed at this project.

loans.use: to fix her house.

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.en:
Aurelio is a 51-year-old man. He studied to become a veterinarian, but he doesn't make a living out of it. He just gives consultations from time to time. He is also married to a loving wife, and they have been married for a long time.

They both are dedicated to trout farming. They own a trout farm, and in this, they raise trout for three months. They buy them when their weight is around a half pound (for trout) and sell them to restaurants when their weight increases to a pound. He manages the big calls of the business and takes care of the trout with his veterinary knowledge. His wife helps by running the commercial relationships, like contacting potential clients and arranging sales.

Aurelio also gives consultations and advice to local trout farms, since it is a trout farming area.

Lately, he had been buying 200 pounds of trout to farm, but he can't meet the client demand with that amount. So, he is looking for a 22,106 MXN loan that will allow him to buy 1,000 pounds (give or take) of trout, which will be enough to supply the demand.

Kubo believes in his project because he knows what he does. He has been in this business for around 25 years, and he has been doing well enough to constantly increase demand.

loans.use: to buy trout and meet client demand.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is a dressmaker from Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She is 53 years old with one dependent, aged 17. Luz has been in the business of making dresses for 20 years now. This is the source of her income.

She is asking for a loan to buy more cloth and thread. With this, she will be able to augment her income for her household needs.

In the future, Luz hopes to make her business successful for her child's needs and that of the family's healthy diet.

loans.use: to buy cloth and thread.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a married woman with two dependents, ages 15 and 18. She is from Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. Rosalie works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially the education of her children.

Rosalie has been in the hog raising business for four years now. She also grows vegetables. She takes every opportunity to earn a living. As of this time, Rosalie lacks the financial resources to improve her hog raising business. She is requesting a loan to buy piglets, supplements, and fertilizer for her farm.

Rosalie dreams of expanding her venture to generate more income so that she will be able to continue sending her children to school for better learning and education. Moreover, she wants to let her family experience the fullness of life. Any additional revenue will be used for reinvestment in the same business and for savings.

loans.use: to buy piglets, supplements, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a resident of Kiambiu informal settlement. It is here that he has set up his small-scale businesses from which he provides for his family. He runs a water vending and rental units business.

At his eight rental units, tenants have not had access to toilets, as there are none; they use neighboring ones at a fee. Earlier this year, Charles learnt of the Fresh Life toilets that have begun penetration in Kiambiu, and Charles was eager to learn about the franchise; establishing a toilet for his tenants is among the goals to achieve this year.

As such, he was eager to learn about the Fresh Life franchise and the Kiva microlending platform in particular. He anticipates that installing Fresh Life toilets at his plot will be a solution to the frequent tenants’ turnover, and ultimately will improve sanitation at the premises.
