He is seeking to purchase one Fresh Life toilet to be installed at the plot. Let us help him in his quest.

loans.use: to pay for one Fresh Life toilet.

loans.name: Zarema

texts.en:
“I am applying for a Kiva loan in order to be able to pay for my Bachelor Degree at AUCA. I had a dream to study here, and now having passed the entrance exams successfully, I need to find funding for myself.
I live with my mother, grandmother and younger brother. Unfortunately, my parents divorced 2 years ago and my father doesn’t pay alimony for us as he is unemployed. My mother is a doctor at National Hospital, and is a budgetary employee. She earns around 10 000 KGS in a month, what is about 145 USD and which is a funny sum for other countries. My grandmother is a pensioner, we are happy to have her, because thanks to her we know the history of our family and we are proud to live three generations in one house. Her hobby is knitting and she teaches me how to make sew interesting pieces by your own hand.
My mother wanted to take a credit from local bank, but we were shocked by it’s 20% percent interest fee. When I applied for financial aid at AUCA and was told about an interest free Kiva loan, we couldn’t believe it. American University in Central Asia is one of the prestigious universities in Asia, and it has such needed funding through Kiva. Learning more about Kiva on their web-site, I got acquainted with other borrowers and definitely made my mind up to apply. Kiva loan is a great chance for me to get a higher education now and pay it back after graduation. I highly appreciate Kiva lenders’ attitude and hope to be heard by them.”

- Zarema

loans.use: to pay for her higher education costs at AUCA

loans.name: Natali

texts.en:
Natali is a 24 woman, she is married and has a young child. she and her loving husband work every day in order to provide a good life for their child.

Natali, on her side, sells catalogue products like make up and cosmetics, she also sells perfume and hair products. She is on her way to open a beauty salon. She studied to be an stylist, so, with the encouragement of her parents, she wants to put into practice her knowledge and open a salon as soon as possible She already has a place to establish the saloon, she has most of furniture needed because her mother helped her with it. She is just missing work tools like scissors, razors, hair treatments and towels. With a 5,000.00 loan she will be able to get those and start her saloon.

Natali has her parents' and husband's full support and she believes in her project. That's a huge perk for the Kubo client -- someone who believes in their own project is always welcome.

loans.use: to start a salon business.

loans.name: Gertrudis Del Transito

texts.es:
Gertrudis, de 56 años de edad, no fue a la escuela porque vivían en extrema pobreza, siempre estuvo trabajando para ayudar en los ingresos de su familia; está soltera, pero tiene 3 hijos y todos viven en el mismo terreno pero en diferentes viviendas.
 
Gertrudis, tiene una pequeña granja de cerdos desde hace 8 años, ella compra los cerdos pequeños y luego los engorda para venderlos, ella aprendió el oficio porque sus padres siempre tenían uno o dos cerdos para hacer lo mismo; decidió dedicarse a la crianza de cerdos porque consideraba que generaba buenos ingresos; pero a parte de eso también tiene pollos indios los cuales también vende, los cerdos los tienen en una pequeña galera atrás de su vivienda.
 
Gertrudis, necesita el préstamo para comprar cuatro cerdos que tiene encargados, pero que aún no los ha cancelado.

El sueño de Gertrudis es poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Gertrudis is 56 years old. She did not go to school because they lived in extreme poverty. She was always working to help with her family's income. She is single, but she has 3 children and they all live on the same plot but in different homes.

Gertrudis has had a small pig farm for 8 years. She buys small pigs and then fattens them to sell them. She learned the trade because her parents always had one or two pigs in order to do the same. She decided to earn a living raising pigs because she judged that it produced a good income. But aside from this, she also has Indian chickens which she also sells. The pigs are kept in a small pen behind her house.

Gertrudis needs the loan in order to buy four pigs for which she has orders but has not paid off. Gertrudis' dream is to be able to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy four pigs.

loans.name: Santos Yllermo

texts.es:
Santos Yllermo tiene 40 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico, vive junto a su esposa y sus tres menores hijos de edades 13,8,4 años de edad de los cuales el primero cursa secundaria y el de 8 años cursa primaria en colegio Nacional del distrito de Pucará.El tiene 10 años radicando en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.Su población se dedica a la agricultura de frutas,café,arroz entre otros y comercio de los mismos, asi mismo se dedican a la ganadería.Tiene muy buena referencias tanto personales como laborales en su comunidad.

La actividad a la que se dedica el Santos Yllermo es la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, ubicado en el caserío de Cabra sondor, con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años.El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna,y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cuál no tendrá problemas en vender su producto, además del cultivo de café Santos Yllermo se dedica al cultivo de piña y maíz.

El socio De La Cruz Huamán Santos Yllermo,es socio recurrente. Santos Yllermo firma con su esposa.
texts.en:
Santos Yllermo is 40 years old. He lives in his own home, made of rudimentary materials, with his wife and three youngest children, ages 13, 8 and 4. The first studies in high school, while the 8-year-old attends elementary school at the national school of the Pucará district. He has resided in the Pucará district, province of Jaen, department of Cajamarca, Perú, for ten years.

His settlement works in agriculture of fruit, coffee and rice, and the trade of these. Similarly, they work in the cattle industry. He has very good references, personal as well as from the workplace, in his community.

Santos Yllermo has ten years of experience working in agriculture located in the small village of Cabra Sondor, specifically in the cultivation of coffee.

The loan that will be given to him will be used in farming and the application and incorporation of pesticides, fertilizers and labor for his harvest. In this way, it will help him improve his crop physiologically, morphologically and productively, as well as to have a timely harvest and, thus, better production and a better quality product. Because of this, he will not have trouble selling his product. In addition to the cultivation of coffee, Santos Yllermo works in the production of pineapple and corn.

The member De La Cruz Huamán Santos Yllermo is a recurring member. Santos Yllerma signs with his wife.

loans.use: in farming, the application and incorporation of pesticides, fertilizers and labor for his harvest.

loans.name: Mahina

texts.ru: Махина проживает в Ганчинском районе.  Ей  26 лет. Она еще не замужем. Она живет с родителями. Она с самого детство  была  активной и смышленой   девочкой. Хорошо   училась  и стремилась  быть самостоятельной. Она открыла маленький продовольственный магазин  и начала свой бизнес. Начатое дело  Махиной стало успешным, ее дело пошло в гору.  Благодаря своему стремлению и желанию работать  она хочет расширить свой бизнес,  но для этого   не хватает собственных средств. Она решила обратится в  МДО   Арванд за кредитом  для расширение бизнеса  и заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверия.
texts.en: Mahina lives in the Gonchi District. She is 26 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. She has been an active and clever girl since childhood. She did well in school and aspired to be self-sufficient. She opened a small grocery shop and started her own business. Mahina's business began successfully and completely took off. Thanks to her ambition and desire to work, she wants to expand her business. However, she does not have enough funds to do so. She decided to turn to MDO Arvand for a land to expand her business. She thanks you in advance for your support and trust.

loans.use: to buy goods for sale.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La sra Maria es una mujer que vive en el canton Guaranda, es casada tiene una edad de 56 años se dedica a la venta de animales, y a la siembra de papas y maiz, cria de ganados, cerdos, y pollos. mediante el uso de este credito Maria pretende comprar una vaca maltona  de esta manera incrementar sus animales. El sueño que ella desea alcanzar es mediante el ingreso que obtenga por el aumento de sus animales poder brindar una mejor educacion para sus dos hijos.

En su tiempo libre se dedica a leer libros junto con sus hijos.
texts.en: Maria is a woman who lives in the city of Guaranda. She is 56 years old, married, and works selling animals as well as growing potatoes and corn, raising livestock, pigs, and chickens. Using this loan, Maria intends to buy a young cow in order to increase her number of animals. The dream that she hopes to achieve through this income she will earn by increasing her number of animals, is to be able to provide a better education for her two children. In her free time, she reads books with her children.

loans.use: to buy a young cow to increase her number of animals.

loans.name: Pardagul'

texts.ru: Это дама Пардагуль. Ей 52 года. Она замужем и имеет 5 детей. У нее один сын и четыре дочери. Сын женатый парень. Пардагуль вместе детьми живет в городе Душанбе.  Дочки учатся в школе и в университете. Невестка помогает Пордагуль на работе. Невестка и младшая дочка тоже занимается шитьем женской одежды. Пардагуль 20 лет своей жизни занимается швейной деятельности. Ей нравится своя работа, и ежедневный доход. Он зарабатывает, и кормить семью. Пардагуль очень трудолюбивая и жизнелюбивая женщина. Она  сейчас просит кредит за  оплаты учебы дочери. Без оплаты ее будут исключить с университета. Пардагуль очень нуждается на Вашу помощь. Она верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: This woman is Pardagul'. She is 52 years old. She is married and has five children - one son and four daughters. Her son is a married man. Pardagul and her children live in the city of Dushanbe. Her daughters attend school and university. Pardagul's daughter-in-law helps her with her work. Her daughter-in-law and youngest daughter also sew women's clothing. Pardagul' has been in the sewing business for 20 years. She likes her work and her daily income. She earns an income and feeds her family. Pardagul' is a very hardworking and joyful woman. She is currently requesting a loan to pay for her daughter's education. Without this payment, her daughter will be expelled from her university. Pardagul' really needs your support. She trusts in you and your support.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education.

loans.name: Maria Melida

texts.es: Melida de 57 años de edad, habita en vivienda propia al lado de sus nietos de 11 y 14 años y demás familia. Melida se encarga de cuidar a sus nietos de los cuales la madre en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida viajó al extranjero y de esta manera aportar una ayuda para su familia, también uno de sus hijos se dedica al cuidado de ganado y con lo cual ayuda a Melida con los gastos del hogar. Melida en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida solicito un crédito anteriormente, con el cual logro iniciar con la construcción de su vivienda, por lo que nuevamente solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines, puertas y ventanas para cumplir su sueño de una vivienda digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Melida, who is 57 years old, lives in her own home next to her grandchildren, aged 11 and 14, and the rest of her family. Melida takes care of her grandchildren whose mother, in search of bettering her quality of life, traveled abroad, and in this way provides support for her family. Also, one of her children works caring for livestock, and with this, helps Melida with the household expenses.

Melida, in looking to improve her quality of life, received a loan previously, with which she was able to begin the construction of her home. For this reason, she is again asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: metal sheets, poles, doors and windows in order to achieve her dream of adequate housing for her family.

loans.use: to invest in: metal sheets, poles, windows and doors, to realize her dream of adequate housing for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: metal sheets, nails, iron and hand labor to improve the roof of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos desde hace 5 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella solicita nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas gallinas y concentrados para seguir con la crianza y así poder obtener mejores ganancias y tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young woman, whose face has been pixelated as she is 27 years old and lives in a high risk area, has worked raising hens and pigs for the past five years. With the earnings she makes, she is able to take care of some of her household expenses.

This young woman lives in her own home with her family unit. She is again asking for a loan to buy more hens and chicken feed in order to continue breeding and, in this way, be able to obtain greater earnings and, together with her family, have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more hens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Angel Miguel

texts.es:
Angel es un hombre de 25 años, soltero, dedicado a la agricultura y venta de papas, cerdos, cuyes. Mediante el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abonos, necesarios para iniciar sus cultivos, el sueño de Angel es de adquirir en un futuro un vehiculo.
En el tiempo libre se dedica a bailar con sus vecinos.
texts.en: Angel is a 25-year-old, single man who works in the field of agriculture and the sale of potatoes, pigs, and guinea pigs. He will use his loan to purchase manure, a necessity for starting his crops. Angel's dream for the future is to acquire a vehicle. In his free time, he likes to dance with his neighbors.

loans.use: to purchase manure.

loans.name: Nurai

texts.en:
“I am sure study at AUCA will give me excellent knowledge and good prospects in the future. I have been a humanist since my childhood. I preferred learning by heart all kinds of structures like 'present simple' or 'passé compose'. The clarifying factor of choosing the European Studies Department is that I want to master a second foreign language, also I want to learn more about history, geography and the culture of Europe. I would like to do research on European rights, its international economic relations, and also the European Union’s safety. It’s exciting to be an expert on the western world, which really differs from the Asian one.
I am applying to Kiva for a loan to help my parents in finding a solution to our financial difficulties. We are five in our family: my parents, me, my younger brother and younger sister. My father was a taxi driver his whole life, my mother is a house wife as she had to take care of my younger siblings. We live in the two bedroom apartment of my grandmother as we don’t have our own estate or car. Two years ago my father tried to open his own business where he brought Japanese cars to Kyrgyzstan to sell them here. Unfortunately, last year our government outlawed the import of right-handed cars, so my father was forced to end the business. Now he is 40 years old and it’s hard to find him a good and well paid job.
Looking back and at the present, I understand that my parents had hard times through life, but they struggled to give us a good education. From my side, I had done my best in my studies at school, participated in all after class activities like language and musical contests, Olympiads and sport competitions. I loved my school, my teachers and classmates. Now I have great expectations for the AUCA community and I am happy to be a member of it thanks to financial aid and this Kiva loan.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education costs at AUCA

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is an entrepreneur from Mukuru kwa Reuben. Having experienced poor sanitation first hand, he is passionate about sanitation and along with his peers they began a youth group focused on improving sanitation in their home area. Together, they have established and operate three Fresh Life franchises.

As Cyrus says, the Fresh Life Toilet has been a good sanitation solution in their area that does not have a connected sewerage system for safe disposal of waste.

Earlier this year, Cyrus set out to establish a school, Cyrock Academy. One of the requirements by the government before establishing a school is the access to toilet facilities by potential students. Having interacted with Fresh Life, Cyrus is confident that Fresh Life Toilets offer more than access to toilets for the students. In particular, he loves the hand washing practice at the heart of Sanergy’s work and this will go a long way in improving overall sanitation among students.

Let us help him in acquiring one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.use: to pay for a Fresh Life Toilet

loans.name: Pablo Emilio

texts.es: Pablo de 30 años es un peluquero empírico que aprendió este arte mucho antes de cumplir su mayoría de edad, con apenas 14 años tuvo la oportunidad de trabajar y aprender en este oficio e hizo sus primeros cortes de cabello a jóvenes y caballeros.  Años más tarde se profesionalizo en una institución del estado e inició en el año 2013 su negocio, en donde ofrece manejo de la imagen masculina con una variedad de cortes clásicos hasta estilos contemporáneos,  servicio de barbería y demás. El resultado de la práctica y la experiencia se ven reflejados en la calidad de su trabajo, por eso Pablo está decidido a crecer profesionalmente y con la finalidad de ofrecer un mejor servicio, está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para mejorar el aspecto de su negocio con este capital realizará adecuaciones e invertirá en insumos como shampoo, gel, cuchillas entre otros.  Pablo vive con su cónyuge y su hija de cinco años en Arjona un municipio del departamento de Bolívar y en esta localidad se consolida su clientela, su sueño de prosperidad es inscribirse como comerciante ante la cámara de comercio e instalar un aire acondicionado en su local tener más afluencia de clientes, lo que se traduce en mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Pablo is a 30-year-old experienced hairdresser who learned his art a long time before reaching adulthood. At barely 14 years old, he had the opportunity to work and learn this business and he made his first haircuts on young people and gentlemen. Years later he became a professional at a state institution, and then started his business in 2013 where he shows command of the masculine image with a variety of classic to contemporary cuts, barber service, and more.

The result of this practice and experience is reflected in the quality of his work. This is why Pablo is determined to grow professionally and has the goal of offering better service. He is asking for a Kiva loan, his first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to improve the appearance of his business. With this capital he will make improvements and invest in supplies like shampoo, gel, and razor blades among other items.

Pablo lives with his life partner and his 5-year-old daughter in Arjona, a town in the department of Bolivar, and this is where he builds his clientele. His dream for success is to register as a merchant with the chamber of commerce, to install an air conditioner in his place of business, and to have a greater flow of customers which will translate to better income for his family.

loans.use: to make improvements and invest in supplies such as shampoo, gel, razor blades and other items.

loans.name: Mi Futuro Group

texts.es: 5 Personas  responsables de distintas actividades comerciales  todos ellos residen en el distrito del  Agustino. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal  “MI FUTURO” uno de ellos es la Sra. Yanet    de 30 años de edad conviviente  y con 2 hijos menores de edad. La Sra. Yanet se dedica ya hace 6  años al negocio de ventas de productos de bazar (utensilios de plástico, perfumería, bisutería, etc.)  En un local dentro del mercado todos los días,  la Sra. Yanet  nos cuenta que ha llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes lo cual a generando ingresos  para cubrir los gastos de su casa.  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos de bazar  y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más productos de bazar y poder generar más ganancias. La Sra. Yanet es la que se encuentra en el medio del grupo y se le distingue por su blusa ploma de manga corta de color negro. A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y  diciéndoles que cumplirá todas su metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Five people, owners of different commercial activities, all of whom live in the district of Agustino: these are the members of the solidarity group "Mi Futuro" (My Future). One of the members is Yanet who is 30 years old and lives with her partner and two minor children.

Yanet has worked for six years selling bazaar products (plastic utensils, perfumes, costume jewelry, etc.) She works everyday in a storefront inside the market and Yanet tells us that she has established loyal clients which has generated earnings to cover her household expenses.

In the future, she would like to have her own storefront where she could sell her bazaar products and obtain greater economic earnings. With the given loan, she will invest it the purchase of more bazaar products in order to generate greater earnings.

Yanet is the woman in the middle of the group and can be identified by her grey, short-sleeved blouse with black sleeves. She says goodbye with a hug to Kiva, saying that she will achieve all of her proposed goals.

loans.use: to buy bazaar products (perfume, costume jewelry, etc.)

loans.name: Ardasher

texts.en:
“I came to Bishkek to get a Bachelor Degree at one of the best universities in Central Asia. I am from Tajikistan. I have chosen the Sociology Department because of the social issues in Tajikistan. Sociology emphasizes approaches to social problems after analysing the situation. My Motherland’s society is too weak. The economics is undeveloped. There is a high rate of corruption because of many civil wars. Despite the fact that most of the people are educated, they are not able to find jobs as unemployment is another problem. There are many universities in my country, but they can’t be compared to the western universities. So one of my goals is to gain complete knowledge and practical skills at AUCA, not just for me and my family, but also for my lovely country, where I will live and work the rest of my life.

I have a brother, who is also a student. My father is searching for a job, and my mother is the only financial supporter of my family. My mother’s salary is about 1,200 Tajik Somoni per month, around 188 USD. After paying for living expenses, my brother’s tuition fees and my travel expenses to Bishkek, my parents are having a really hard time. AUCA gave me partial financial aid in paying for my degree. This is an appreciable step, but my parents still need the rest of the payment. I have never heard about Kiva before and was so glad to learn about it at AUCA. As you know, the Central Asian countries are less developed, so we don’t have interest free loans for education at local banks. I am happy to have such an opportunity now and will pay it back after graduation. I express gratitude to the Kiva organization and its lenders, who care about other people and their difficulties.”

loans.use: to pay for his Bachelor Degree at AUCA

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
“My name is Madina. I am 17-years-old Dungan girl with big ambitions. People in our country know that Dungan is a patriarchal community and women are house-wives. I want to break the rules and I want to be independent in the future, and I am motivated to achieve everything by myself and to show others that women can act and make their life by themselves too. Another curious idea in me is that my purpose in life is to be a software engineer. Many people consider that this profession doesn’t suit girls and that men are the best engineers, I don’t agree with this opinion. The idea of being an IT-specialist was born in me, while I watched lots of feature films and documentaries. I saw what an important role computer technologies play in our life; how they can facilitate life, contribute in discoveries on space exploration, medicine, economy, etc. I wanted to learn how it works and decided to find out.

Unfortunately, technology is not developed in Kyrgyzstan, in addition to this there aren’t many universities, where we can get good knowledge on it. I chose AUCA, because it is the only place in my country, where I can get advanced teaching methods and best resources to gain my goals. I know that many AUCA Alumni work at international IT organizations such as Google, Microsoft, Cisco, etc.

As to financial support that I am asking from Kiva lenders, I am really in need of it.  As I stated above, my mother is a house-wife, so my father is the only supporter of six of us: I have 3 siblings. We spend the most part of our money for food, education, transportation, and medicine, as me, my mother, and my elder sister have must visit the doctor every six months due to an eye condition. Therefore, I ask for a help of Kiva lenders and want to assure you that your loan will make a difference for my family.”

loans.use: to pay for her tuiotion fee in SFW Program at AUCA

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a polishing machine and a soldering iron for his workshop, the earnings from which he uses to sustain his family.

loans.name: Mylin

texts.en:
Mylin is 29 years old, married, and has one child.

Mylin works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items like rice, coffee, cereals, detergent and soap, canned goods, snack foods, etc., to sell.

Mylin has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Mylin aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like rice, coffee, cereals, detergent and soap, canned goods, snack foods, etc., to sell

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, spices, vegetables, etc., for her food vending business.

Cresilda has been in this business for 25 years. Cresilda earns additional income from pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Cresilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of being able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, spices, vegetables, etc., for her food production business

loans.name: Abundia

texts.en:
Abundia is 33 years old, married, and has eight children.  One of her children is currently in school.

Abundia is in the agricultural business of raising livestock in the Philippines. Abundia requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Abundia has been raising livestock for 6 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Abundia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 60 years old,  married, and has five children.

She earns a living by farming root-crops in the Philippines. Beatriz is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Beatriz has been farming root-crops for 2 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Denis Enrique

texts.en:
Denis is 62 years old and lives in the municipality of Valencia. This man has been running his own business for 30 years, the half of his life, so he’s an expert in growing different products in his farm, something he started for his love of working the land.

He’s thinking of making his business bigger and more successful, so he wants to invest in it, because he dreams of seeing his business lasting another 30 years. He’s asking for a loan, so he can buy some agricultural inputs and to pay for some technical assistance.

Denis is a hard working man who never stops dreaming. Right now he wants to improve the conditions of his house so his family can have a better quality of life. You can help Denis with his dreams with just a loan.

loans.use: to buy some agricultural inputs and to pay for some technical assistance

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: jorge de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica a la crianza se ganado bovino y de pollos de engorde, tambien cuenta con una yunta de bueyes desde hace 12 años, con los que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, el cliente esta solicitando nuevamente un credito para la compra de otros 2 novillos para repasto y seguir con su tabajo para una mejor calidad de vida junto cn su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is 46 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner. He works raising cattle and broiler chickens. He has also had a yoke of oxen for twelve years. With what he obtains from his sales, he is able cover his household expenses.

The client is once again asking for a loan to buy two more steer for grazing and to continue with his work for a better quality of life, together with his family.

loans.use: to buy two more steer for grazing.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Carlota works hard to support her family.

She has a farming sugarcane business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. 

Carlota is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farming sugarcane business.

Carlota has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. Emma is married and has a buy and sell root-crops and fruits business in the Philippines.

Emma requested a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more root-crops and fruits to sell to her customers.

Emma has been in this business for 15 years now.

Emma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more root-crops and fruits to sell to her customers

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 64 years old, married, and has six children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more merchandise to sell in her general store.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 50 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Erlinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maria Norelly

texts.en:
María is a divorced 41 year old mother and lives in the municipality of Bello. She has 2 sons, 15 and 17 years of age. Right now she doesn’t have a job, so she has some problems to provide for her family, but she wants to succeed and to find ways to support her children.

The lack of money hasn’t allowed her to do what she wants to do, which is to start her own cooking business, something that she loves to do. She’s asking for a loan so she can start studying, so she can learn about dessert making, which is something she loves.

María expects that with her studies she can learn a lot not only about making this kind of food, but about managing and starting her own business. 

You can help María to achieve her goals; a loan will get her a lot closer to them.

loans.use: to pay for school fees

loans.name: Maria Judelyn

texts.en:
Maria Judelyn is a 42-year-old married woman and mother of three children. All three of her children are currently in school.

She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Maria Judelyn has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.  Maria Judelyn has been in this business for 17 years.

Maria Judelyn requested a 8,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

In the future, Maria Judelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Maria Mora

texts.en:
Maria Mora is a 40-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school.

She is a very hard working entrepreneur, and has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. Maria Mora has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Maria Mora has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann works hard to support her family. Mary Ann is married and has a business selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines.

Mary Ann requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

Mary Ann has been in this business for two years now.

Mary Ann would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 40,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Gloria has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income from selling purified drinking water and gasoline.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 45 years old, married, and has six children. Four of her six children are currently in school.

Lourdes is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lourdes has been in pig fattening for 7 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita is 47 years old, married, and has nine children. Five of her nine children are currently in school.

She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a business selling flowers in the Philippines. Melita has been in this business for 12 years. 

Melita requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials and flowers for her business.

In the future, Melita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and flowers for her business

loans.name: Marliza

texts.en:
Marliza  is a 23 year-old woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a single mother to a two-year-old son. 

Marliza relies on fishing for an income. The business is not always good, especially if the weather is not conducive to fishing, like if there is typhoon or storm, but she perseveres for her son's future. 

She is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy a new fish net and nylon.

Marliza hopes that she can expand her venture and earn a bigger income so she can provide for her child's schooling someday.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and nylon

loans.name: Wara Nicole

texts.es:
La señora Wara Nicole es una mujer joven de 22 años, es una persona responsable con iniciativa para superarse y mejorar la situación económica de su familia. tiene un deseo integro para salir adelante por tal razon fue participe de la capacitación a nivel técnico básico en producción de uva, estos cursos se realizaron bajo el convenio de Fautapo y cea thaqu thaqu, que son instituciones que brindan capacitación y apoyo a emprendimientos productivos en la región. por las características mencionadas en formación de la señora Wara Nicole requiere un préstamo para invertir en la compra de plantas de uva, viguetas, alambres y otros para el cultivo de uva. esta es una iniciativa de wara nicole quien cuenta con la experiencia además está muy entusiasmada con el proyecto que tiene de producir uva y ofrecer al mercado su producto.
actualmente la señora Wara Nicole se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura en la producción papa, zanahoria  y frejol, aprendió desde joven sobre la agricultura por la afluencia de sus padres en este rubro y por qué tiene terrenos donde realiza su actividad.
texts.en:
Wara Nicole is a young 22 year old woman. She is a responsible person with the initiative to overcome and improve the economic situation of her family. She has an honest desire to get ahead and for that reason attended training at a basic technical level in the production of grapes. These courses are given under the agreement with Fautapo and Cea Thaqu Thaqu which are institutions that provide training and support for productive undertakings in the region.

For the characteristics mentioned in the training Wara Nicole requires a loan to invest in grape plants, poles, wires and others to grow grapes. This is an initiative of Wara Nicole who has the experience and is also very enthusiastic about the project that she has to produce grapes and offer them on the market.

Currently Wara Nicole works in agriculture producing potatoes, carrots and beans. She has learned about farming since she was young from the knowledge of her parents in this area and because she has land to carry out this activity.

loans.use: to buy grape plants, posts, wire and others to grow grapes for the market, in this way generate economic income and improve her quality of living.

loans.name: Partria

texts.en:
Partria is 55 years old and married with four children.

Partria is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Partria requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Partria has been raising livestock for 22 years now, and has borrowed 26 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Partria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Rochie

texts.en:
Rochie is 39 years old, married with four children.

Rochie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rochie has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rochie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Nemenciana

texts.en:
Nemenciana is 61 years old, married, and has five children.  

Nemenciana is in the agricultural business of farming corn in the Philippines. Nemenciana requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nemenciana has been farming corn for 9 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Nemenciana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is a 39-year-old married woman and mother of seven children. Three of her seven children are currently in school.

Analy is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 6 years. 

Analy requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional merchandise such as eggs, canned goods, coffee, candies, biscuits, etc,. to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Analy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise such as eggs, canned goods, coffee, candies, biscuits, etc,. to sell

loans.name: Wilfredo Jr.

texts.en:
Wilfredo Jr. is a 56-year-old fisherman from Bien Unido, Bohol. He is a married man with one dependent child who is fifteen years old.

Wilfredo Jr. has applied for a 5,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner CEVI to buy new fishing nets and marine plywood for his boat. He believes that by repairing his boat, his catch will improve and as a result his income will be more stable.

Wilfredo Jr. works hard at his fishing, as he wants to save money for his child's schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and marine plywood for his boat.

loans.name: Grillan

texts.en:
Grillan is a 22-year-old married mother of two children, ages 2 and 4. She helps her husband in their fishing business to earn a living. It is their main livelihood and it sustains the needs of her children. 

She needs help through a loan so she can buy fuel (gasoline) for the boat.  Buying fuel daily in small amounts is more expensive, but if she can buy a week's worth of fuel, she will save money that can be used for her family.  

In the future, Grillan hopes to continue improving her livelihood as well as the quality of life of her family. 

Her income will be saved for the education of her two girls.

loans.use: to buy fuel for her boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tamarind and brown sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a coffee pot, a coffee grinder, and accessories in order to offer more services in her sweet shop and generate better income for her family.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rona is 35 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rona has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Rona requested a PHP 22,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rona has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Rona would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 62-year-old married woman and has two children. One of her children is currently in school.

Josefina is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She has a food vending business in the Philippines.  Josefina has been in this business for 1 year. 

Josefina requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as vegetables, meat, spices, etc.

In the future, Josefina would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, vegetables, meat, spices, etc.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles, 46, is married and has four children, one of whom is in school. For the past four years she has sold ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.

Angeles has applied for a 11,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy items to sell such as pants and underwear. She works hard in order to provide a secure and stable future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear items to sell such as pants and underwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing and land cultivation

loans.name: Remelita

texts.en:
Remelita is a 25-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She lives with her family in the town called Bien Unido in Bohol.

Remelita has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for 11 years. She is in need of additional capital for their business. She is requesting a loan to buy an engine, crab traps and fishing nets. This loan will enable Remelita and her husband to augment their catch. They sell their catch to the market.

Remelita dreams of expanding her fishing business and making it a success. Moreover, she wants to save more money for the education expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy an engine, crab traps and fishing nets.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 52 years old and married with five children. With two children still in school, Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, eggs, noodles, detergent soap and fabric softener to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 37 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, detergent soap and fabric softener.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, eggs, noodles, detergent soap and fabric softener to sell.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Sally is 39 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Sally has a general store business in the Philippines. Sally requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Sally has been in this business for five years. In the future, Sally would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad works hard to support her family. Soledad is married and has a buy-and-sell native mats business in the Philippines.

Soledad requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more native mats to sell.

Soledad has been in this business for 20 years now.

Soledad would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more native mats to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, 44, is widowed and has four children, one still in school. For the past three years she has run a sari-sari, or small general store, where she sells a variety of items.

Arlene has applied for a 12,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy snack foods, candies and other groceries to sell. Her work is devoted to providing her family with a secure and stable future.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, candies and other groceries to sell in her sari-sari.

loans.name: Ayisa

texts.en:
Ayisa is a 40-year-old mother of four children. Three of her four children are in school.

She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Ayisa has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.  Ayisa has been in this business for 6 years. 

Ayisa requested a 16,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like slippers, dresses, etc.

In the future, Ayisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like slippers, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a  67-year-old married mother of six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cecilia has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Cecilia has been in this business for 10 years.

Cecilia requested a 29,500 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fruits to sell.

In the future, Cecilia would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits to sell

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is 63 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for her daily needs.

Demetria runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items

Demetria requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other grocery items.

In the future, Demetria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other grocery items

loans.name: Diana Rose

texts.en:
Diana Rose is a 27-year-old married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Diana Rose has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business, such as meat, spices, etc..

She has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Diana Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business, such as meat, spices, etc.

loans.name: Eden Mercury

texts.en:
Eden Mercury is 46 years old and married with five children. One of her children is in school. Eden Mercury works very hard to provide for her family.

Eden Mercury runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, home-care products, bread, and other groceries.

Eden Mercury has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, home-care products, bread, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mirian Lorena

texts.es:
Mirian es una mujer de 21 años, soltera, su actividad principal es la siembra y venta de habas y papas, mediante el credito pretende comprar abonos y semillas para una optima produccion, ya que el sueño de mirian es la de tener su casa propia, para ella y sus dos hijitos.
En su tiempo libre le gusta descansar.
texts.en: Mirian is a 21 year old woman.  She is single and her main job is planting and selling beans and potatoes.  With the loan, she intends to buy fertilizer and seeds to get an optimum production.  Mirian's dream is to have her own house for herself and her two small children.  In her free time she likes to rest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for a better production.

loans.name: Théramène

texts.fr: Théramène a 55 ans. Elle est mariée et elle a deux enfants. Elle a un petit poulailler dans lequel elle élève une cinquantaine de poulet. Cette activité est très rentable. Elle demande un microcrédit pour acheter plus de poussins et pour investir dans l’achat de nourriture spéciale pour faire grandir les poulets rapidement.
texts.en:
Théramène is 55 years old. She is married and has two children.

She has a small coop in which raises about fifty chicken. This business is very profitable.

She is requesting a micro-loan to purchase more chicks and to invest in the purchase of special food to help her chicken grow rapidly.

loans.use: buy feed for her chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in supplies to lay the floor of his home.

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
El señor florentino en su juventud trabajo en muchas actividades, sabe trabajos de albañilería, pintura, gomería y por la procedencia del área rural actualmente se dedica a la actividad agrícola ya que tiene sus propios terrenos para su producción; por el interés de progresar y superarse personalmente recibió la capacitación a nivel técnico básico en confección textil en su misma comunidad, estos cursos se realizaron bajo el convenio de la Institución Fautapo y Cea Thaqu thaqu que son instituciones que brindan capacitación y apoyo a emprendimientos productivos en la región. por las características mencionadas en formación del señor florentino, su esposa e hijos que también fueron participes de esta capacitación,  es por eso que e señor Florentino requiere un préstamo para invertir en la compra de maquina recta, maquina over look, plancha, mesa, telas e hilos. 
El señor florentino tiene 45 años de edad, es una persona responsable con iniciativa para superarse y mejorar la situación económica de su familia ya que tiene 8 hijos dependientes quienes también trabajan con él.
florentino iniciara el emprendimiento en producción textil para lo cual ya tiene ubicado el local, está dispuesto a trabajar y realizar un aporte con su trabajo al desarrollo del país. con bastante entusiasmo cuenta que las prendas de vestir que tiene puesto, fueron confeccionados por el mismo, durante la formación que tuvo en el centro además cuneta cpon la experiencia de este rubro por su habilidad en diseños textiles
texts.en:
In his youth, Florentino worked in many trades. He knows how to perform masonry work, painting, tire repair and, as he comes from a rural area, he currently works in agriculture as he has his own land for production. In the interest of personal progress and to better himself, he received a basic technical training in garment making in his own community. These courses were carried out by the Institución Fautapo and Cea Thaqu, which are institutions that provide training and support productive undertakings in the region. Because of the mentioned characteristics of the training that Florentino, along with his wife and children who also participated in the training, received; Florentino requests a loan to invest in the purchase of a straight-stitch sewing machine, an overlock sewing machine, an iron, table, fabrics and threads.

Florentino is 45 years old and is a responsible person with initiative to better himself and improve the economic situation of his family. He has eight dependent children who also work with him.

Florentino will start his venture in textile production for which he already has a store front. He is willing to work and with his work, make a contribution to the development of the country. With a lot of enthusiasm, he shares that the he made the clothing that he is wearing during the training in the center. With the experience of this training, he also has textile design abilities.

loans.use: to buy a straight-stitch sewing machine, an overlock sewing machine, an iron, table, fabrics and thread in order to have his own manufacturing workshop and improve his economic income for his family.

loans.name: Adalid

texts.es: El Sr. Adalid de 28 años de edad vive y trabaja actualmente en domicilio y terreno propio, no tiene hijos que depende de el ni esposa, el cual es solo vive con su padre que es de la tercera edad ya que su madre ya dejó de existir hace muchos años, vive en el departamento de Chuquisaca municipio Villa Vaca Guzmán. Su principal actividad del señor Adalid es la producción de cítricos como ser naranja y mandarina ya que fue capacitado en el centro de educación agropecuaria campesina CEPAC. Es por eso que requiere el préstamo que será destinado para la compra  de materiales y equipamiento para la producción de cítricos, con la compra de la misma empezara su actividad ya que tiene la necesidad de facilitar su trabajo con la producción de cítricos por lo tanto podrá generar buenos ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida en su hogar y su diario vivir ya que esta actividad requiere de menor trabajo en mano de obra una vez establecida la actividad.
texts.en:
28-year-old Adalid currently lives and works in his own home and his own land. He doesn't have dependent children or a wife; he just lives with his father, who is a senior citizen. His mother passed away many years ago. He lives in the Chuquisaca department in the municipality of Villa Vaca Guzmán.

Adalid's main job is growing citrus fruits like oranges and mandarines, as he was trained at the Countryside Agriculture Education Center, CEPAC [for its initials in Spanish].

For this reason, he needs the loan to buy materials and equipment for citrus fruit production. With this purchase, he will begin this job. He needs to obtain work producing citrus so that he can make good income and improve his living conditions in his home and daily living, since this job requires less physical labor once it is established.

loans.use: to buy materials and equipment for citrus fruit production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her education and to pay for medical treatment.

loans.name: Solisa

texts.en:
Solisa is 54 years old and married with one child. With her one child still in school, Solisa works very hard to provide for her family.

Solisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Solisa has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, cereals, coffee, canned goods, shampoo, and noodles.

In the future, Solisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 41 years old and has two children. Vivian is married and has two children who are in school.

Vivian is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Vivian requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Vivian has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vivian would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Anabelle is 45 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Anabelle has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Anabelle requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines and other supplies for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Anabelle has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Anabelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Irenella

texts.en:
Irenella is a 30-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Irenella has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for raising her livestock.

Irenella has been in this business for 5 years, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and has now requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Irenella would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for raising her livestock.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 52-year-old married woman with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Jocelyn has a hat weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy nipa leaves, and other supplies to use in her business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy nipa leaves and other supplies to use in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in wood, nails, windows and doors in order to finish building her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sausage, prepared egg rolls, and cooking oil

loans.name: Ruperta

texts.es: La señora Ruperta, tiene 27 años de edad y su familia está conformada con un hijo pequeño, vive al este de la ciudad de Cochabamba, no cuenta con vivienda propia, trabaja en labores de limpieza de casas durante el mes, todo el año en diferentes zonas de la ciudad, y su esposo es pintor de chapería, a través de los años con sus ahorros tienen una herramienta de trabajo que es una compresora con la que el esposo trabaja pintando autos en una chapería de la zona este hacia la provincia.  Con los ahorros están comprando una movilidad para hacerla trabajar, el motor está en muy mal estado y tienen que cambiarlo, es para ello que necesitan el préstamo, asì podrán movilizarse mejor hacia cada uno de sus trabajos, porque el transporte público  hacia las zonas donde viven tiene dificultades de frecuencia. En los fines de semana la movilidad servirá de herramienta de trabajo para lograr un poco de ingreso adicional para poder ahorrar para una vivienda propia que es su objetivo al haber formado ya su familia con un hijo.
texts.en:
Ruperta is 27 years old, and her family includes her little son. She lives to the east of the city of Cochabamba. She doesn't have her own house. She works cleaning houses during the month, in different areas of the city throughout the year.

Her husband works painting cars. From their savings over the years, they have a tool, a compressor, with which her husband works painting cars in a body shop in the eastern part of the province.

With their savings, they are buying a vehicle to get into working condition. The motor is in very bad shape, and they have to change it. For this reason, they need the loan, so that they can more easily get to each of their jobs. Public transportation to the areas where they live has inconveniently infrequent schedules.

On the weekends, the vehicle will serve as a work tool, to obtain a little additional income. Their goal is to save up for their own house, since they now have formed a family with a child.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle motor in order to complete her work in a more practical way and save on public transportation

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.en:
Arlinda is 44 years old and has five children. Arlinda is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Arlinda is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Arlinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Arlinda has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Arlinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Arnulfa

texts.en:
Arnulfa works hard to support her family. Arnulfa is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Arnulfa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Arnulfa has been in this business for 18 years now.

Arnulfa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Conchita is 54 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Conchita has a selling ornamental plants business in the Philippines. Conchita requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Conchita has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Conchita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 52 years old and has four children. Elizabeth is married and has one child who is still in school.

Elizabeth is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Elizabeth has been raising livestock for three years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Fermeliana

texts.en:
Fermeliana works hard to support her family. Fermeliana is married and has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Fermeliana requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Fermeliana has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Fermeliana would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.
